38760873.review:
It's kind hard to review this game without spoiling anything so the content will be brief and to the point.

If you've played DR1 then instead of the original survivors of the killing game you are presented with 16 new characters on a seemlingly peaceful island. The purpose is to collect hope fragments in order to leave the island and grow HOPE within each student, easy right, WRONG!

HEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE'S BAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACK!

Monokuma that is!

Just like the original DR1, the "students" are thrown into another killing game. In terms of gameplay it is very similar except now the difficulty has been drastically increased, even on Kind mode. I have to admit I had some difficulty during some of the trials because some of the truth bullets that match with some of the contradictions aren't all that intuitive to grasp at first.

Logic Dive is a welcome addition to the various mini-games as well as the improved hang man's gambit.

My mind was totally blown and cannot praise the story writing enough, if you're a fan of DR1 or love a good mystery solving game this is a welcome addition to your library.

38666677.review:
[b]Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair[/b] ist ein Mystery-Puzlespiel mit Zahlreichen Denkspurteinlagen und seichten RPG Elementen. Dieses Spiel mag optisch und vom User Interface einiges mit einer Visual Novel gemeinsam haben, ich denke allerdings, dass man es nicht wirklich als solche bezeichnen kann.
Wie Üblich findet sich eine Zusammenfassung für die, die es gern kurz und bündig haben, ganz unten :D

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Wie im Vorgänger spielt sich das Gameplay in verschiedenen (aus diesem bekannten) Ebenen ab.
Im Großen und Ganzen besteht fast jedes Kapitel aus einer Kombination dieser.
(Wer den Vorgänger bereits kennt, kann die folgenen Absätze übersringen und zu "Was ist Neu?" übergehen.)

[u][b]Bekannte Elemente[/b][/u]
[b]Free Time[/b]
Man ist frei, die zur Verfügung stehende Umgebung zu erkunden und mit den anderen Charaktern zu interagieren, diesen Geschenke zu machen, dadurch den Beziehungslevel zu erhöhen und Skills und sogenannte "Hopeshards" zu erhalten, mit denen man sich im Shop neue Skills kaufen kann. Jeder Charakter offeriert einen neuen Skill, wenn man alle Hopeshards von ihm erhalten hat. Einige Charaktere könnten je nach Situation nicht zur Interaktion zur Verfügung stehen.
Nach einer gewissen Zeit passiert ein Mord und eine Untersuchung (Investigation) beginnt
Es ist wieder möglich, seine hart erarbeiteten Monocoins an einer Kapselmaschine gegen Geschenke zu tauschen

[b]Investigation[/b]
Sobald es einen Mord gegeben hat und sich alle am Tatort eingefunden haben, startet die Untersuchung des tatrelevanten Schauplätze. Man sammelt indizien in Form von Aussagen der anderen oder Objekten, die gefunden werden. Sobald man alle Indizien gefunden hat, startet das "Classtrial"

[b]ClassTrial[/b]
Hier spielt sich das Rahmengameplay ab. Durch das Überwinden viele Geschicklichkeits und Logikeinlagen wird die Debatte vorangetrieben und der Mörder enttarnt. Klassisch ist die Nonstopdebatte, in deren Verlauf man in den Aussagen der anderen, ungereimtheiten finden und diese mit Hilfe gefundener Indizien wiederlegen muss. 

[u][b]Was ist neu?[/b][/u]
[list]
    [*]Zum einen wurde das ClassTrial um einige Elemente erweitert und einige vorhandene aufpolliert (fordernder gemacht)
    [*]Die aus dem Vorgänger bekannten Monocoins sind auch hier wieder dabei, allerdings sind diese wesentlich leichter zu bekommen als im Vorgänger
    [*]Die Möglichkeit ein Tamagochiartiges Pet aufzuziehen. Ist es ausgewachsen, bekommt man von ihm Monocoins und einige Geschenke
    [*]Anders als im Vorgänger kann man Skillslots nun nicht mehr nur durch Interaktionen mit anderen freischalten. Der Hauptcharakter kann wie in einem RPG im Level austeigen. Das passiert, indem er sich mit anderen unterhält, Dinge Untersucht oder einfach herumläuft.
    [*]In jedem Kapitel können Monokumapuppen gefunden werden, was neben Monocoins auch einen Erfolg gibt, wenn man alle findet
    [*]Auch wenn man den Anime kennt, weiß man (fast) nichts über die Mordfälle die passieren.
    [*]Ein Minispiel kann freigeschaltet werden, in dem man in die Haut von Usami(aka Monomi) schlüpft
[/list]

[h1]Grafik, Soundtrack[/h1]
Die Charaktergrafiken haben mir vom Stil her etwas weniger gut gefallen als die des Vorgängers, sonst fand ich die Grafik wie im Vorgänger sehr passend umgesetzt.
Der Soundtrack ist wie im Vorgänger sehr gelungen

[h1]Zusammenfassung[/h1]
[b]Pro:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Wieder spannende Mordfälle zu lüften. Sogar noch skuriler als im Vorgänger
    [*]Aus dem Vorgänger bekannte und neue Geschicklichkeits und Logikeinlagen
    [*] Comedy und Fanservice
    [*]mehr Freetime zwischen den Morden als im Vorgänger
    [*]Wieder zwei Regler, die in drei Stufen die Schwierigkeit der Logik und Geschicklichkeitseinlagen regeln
[/list]

[b]Contra:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Bereits im ersten Kapitel prasseln viele Tutorials auf einen ein (recht steile lernkurve, verglichen zum Vorgänger)
    [*]vereinzelt Textfehler (falscher Name über Dialogen)
    [*]vereinzelt perspektiven Fehler in CGs
[/list]

[b]Fazit[/b]
Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair spricht die selbe Zielgruppe an, wie der Vorgänger, nämlich Leute, die gern Rätzel lösen und Geschicklichkeitseinlagen mögen. Vertretbare Englischkentnisse sind hier Vorraussetzung.
Wer im Rätseln nicht gut ist oder schlechte Reflexe hat, kann die Schwierigkeit aufs das Minimum runterschrauben, ohne etwas zu verpassen (außer die fordernden Einlagen) Ich wurde jedenfalls gut unterhalten, darum von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung.

38651850.review: 超高校级的宇航员：小高和刚（滑稽）

38648320.review:
TL;DR - fuckboi prince solves crimes with motley anime gang while traversing terrible minigames, resisting the game's match-making attempts, and eventually solving the mystery, and then you go back to watching fuckboi worry about shit.


I haven't played the first game btw

Dangenronpa 2 is a great game plagued by several minor issues.
You play some lame japanese kid who's a nice guy but also prone to worrying, stuck on some deserted island with only several quirky characters and a psychopathic bear for company. One thing leads to another and you find yourself trying to find which one of your 'friends' killed the person you kind of liked. You gather evidence, usually while you, as the player, formulate your own theories about what happened and once you have every neccessary piece a class trial is initiated (which is essentially you and your buddies acting as jurors). For actual real life detectives, it might be disappointing to discover the game doesn't allow you to find the murderer alone, but for the rest of us plebiens the trial is spent slowly but surely piecing together the killer's identity using your own logic and contributions from the class.

While you aren't alone, you are always the key character in solving the mystery. Most of the actual deduction is performed during class discussions and one on one 'rebuttal duels' with other students. Unfortunately, the game has several additional minigames you need to pass to solve the mystery.

The most broken of these is 'Hangman's gambit' where you have to play a minigame about putting together letters forming a phrase which is key to the discussion (and therefore mystery) at hand. The gameplay itself is fine, but it has one glaring problem. It only accepts one specific phrase. This is, I believe, a problem resulting from the japanese translation, because in japanese there is probably no synonyms for the object or action. Problem is in English, when you try to enter something like (for example) 'water bottle', it doesn't work, and the game turns into a trial and error game where you enter an extremely confused state as you realise what you thought is wrong and the entire investigation has shifted oh my god. Then after ten minutes of fiddling around, you find that the word you were supposed to enter is actually 'drink bottle'.
This is a broken minigame, and you do it about least twice every trial.

Another problem is a weird rhythm minigame which resulted from the developers not knowing why people play the game (hint: it's not for the sick beats and autotuned phrases). It's out of place, and slightly annoying but it wouldn't be such a problem if the tutorials weren't so thoroughly fucked.

The tutorials are entirely text based. This isn't too bad, except when the translators perfectly copied what is in japanese (which isn't too much of a problem in character interactions) and you don't know what the fuck they're talking about, especially seeing as you have no pictures to reference. It turns the first time playing a minigame into another trial and error piece of dogshite, but after you're done with all of them, you're usually alright.

Another problem (which is actually pretty subjective) is that between deaths and trials you spend your time faffing about with the other kids. It's alright, but not super interesting. The game also spends a lot of effort trying to set you up with 94M3R waifu, which is annoying but not obtrusive. While it is neccesary for the sake of the trial to look at the locations before the murder, its boring and the game kind of forces you to do it.
But that's not nearly as bad as I'm making it out to be.


Why do I play the game? I really, really enjoy the convoluted mysteries and the slow edging towards the killer. It's well done, and unless you are actually some sort of uber detective or have fourth wall technology, you only have an incomplete picture of how the killing was carried out (due to the fact you are piecing it together as your collect evidence). Ironically, it's only during the class trials, the only time where you play from 3rd person, that you truly feel like you are in the game. It's not because the main character's shit, it's because the mysteries are just so engaging, and the game usually does a great job of making you feel like you are actually solving it.

These are easily the best parts of the game, despite all the issues I have with them. The feeling of being some sort of beta-male uber detective is just too good. You're not dodging bullets, or saving princesses, you are using your head, engaging with the world of the game and solving crimes. That's fun.

For those worrying that the game gets too anime, don't worry. It does, but only with a few characters and moments which are infrequently spaced, and you kind of zone it out after a while. Don't let that stop you from playing this game.


EDIT: It does get pretty anime.

Also don't watch the 3rd series anime because I'm 99 percent sure they lose sight of the themes and just focus on plot.

[b]1편을 하지 않았다면 이 평가 읽기 전에 1편 클리어부터 하고 오세요[/b]

[h1]스토리[/h1]: 각 분야의 최고인 초고교급 학생..은 당연히 아는 설정일 것이니 생략, 이번엔 이들이 강제로 섬으로 수학여행을 간다! 
[strike]특히 어떤 트롤러와 함께하는 수학여행은 정말 행복하다^^[/strike] 꽤나 밝은 분위기라서 착각하게 만들지만, 엄연히 살인 게임은 존재한다. 심지어 이번엔 애들이 착해서 나중엔 모노쿠마가 살인을 안 할 수 없게 만든다. 참고로 주인공이 멋있지만 아주 불쌍하다..

[h1]게임성[/h1]: 1편의 게임성을 그대로 유지하되 숨은 모노쿠마찾기나 재판 미니게임등이 추가되었다. 미연시 요소는 더욱 훌륭해져 모든 이들과 즐거운 시간을 보낼 수 있다! (물론 일찍 안 죽는다면..) 캐릭터들이 확연히 1편보다 착하고 매력적이다. 그래픽과 브금 역시 여전히 수작. 전작엔 없는 주인공의 달리기 모션이 볼만하다.

[h1]접근성[/h1]: 1편이 마음에 들었다면 2편 역시 훌륭할 것이다. 오히려 처형씬의 강도가 줄어서 차라리 볼만할지도? 근데 짬이 좀 생겼다고 안일하게 플레이하다간 큰코다친다. 난이도가 대폭 증가하였고, 스토리가 엿을 먹일수도 있다. 최애캐가 죽는 고통을 겪고 몰입도가 저하될 수 있으니 부디 여분의 멘탈을 준비할 것.

[h1]총평[/h1]: 객관적으로는 10점 만점에 10점. 주관적으로도 10점!!
갓겜인 1편보다도 발전하였습니다. 명확히요. 근데 1편도 10점을 줘버려서 얘도 당연히 10점.
[strike]사랑해요 나나미[/strike]

38558982.review:
Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair is a story about Hope and Despair, but one with a far different take. Instead of a hero that is relentlessly optimistic, we have a protagonist who is grounded in reality, virtually normal in all ways, but still intelligent and sharp, and his way of solving murders and talking to friends is different than Makoto Naegi.

The gameplay is more refined, although some minigames could stand to be a little more polished. The non-stop debates are back, and they're as fun as ever. Like usual, you have to use the evidence to find holes and twists, and this time, you don't just say people are wrong. You agree with them, back up their statements, reinforce points.

The cast of characters is just wonderfully entertaining. There are bound to be favorites. I know I've chosen my favorite waifu(s), and it makes it all the more painful when you see them become a victim or become a blackened.

The story kept me heavily invested and I was on the edge of my seat wondering what evidence and whose testimony would change the course of the trials. The many moral dilemmas that each characters face made me consider what I would do in a similar situation.

There is also a good chunk of post-story content that'll keep you coming back for more. Minigames are fun, but the main attraction here is the dating sim. Now you can date your favorite character! What's not to like?

Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair is a story that invests a lot into its story, its characters, and its presentation. It takes what made the first game good and makes it better, exceeding the first game in almost every way. I give this game a 9/10.

38386570.review:
I've never been a fan of this genre but the Danganronpa games have recieved such glowing praise from everyone that plays them that I figured $13 was worth risking on the first game.  I couldn't be happier with that decision.  The first game was one of the most unique, interesting, and compelling single player games I've experienced in years.  After completing the first game I immediately purchased the sequel that everyone seemed to like even more.  I'll be honest, for the first few chapters I didn't find myself enjoying this game as much as the first one.  I still liked it but I genuinely cared about the characters from the first game so much that starting with an entirely new cast meant this sequel was fighting an uphill battle from the start.  Despite that obstacle this game has managed to easily become one of my favorites that I've ever played.  A gameplay loop of build relationships/alliances to survive, introduction of the motivation of the week (ie you'll all starve until someone kills), investigate the murder of one or more of those same people you're trying to work with, trial to figure out/prove whodunnit, elaborate execution of the convicted, and having every day end with the philosophical ponderings of what can only be described as a psychotic teddy bear is something I never I never would have guessed would be so compelling.  The games would easily fall apart if they weren't fantastically written and neatly wrapped in their colorful art style that belies a series with some of the darkest tones I've ever experienced in a game but they manage to hold together and pull it off beutifully.  I look forward to what the future holds in store for this series.

tl;dr I enjoyed this seies much more than I ever thought I would and highly recommend it.

38354142.review:
Sin duda es la mejor Visual Novel que he jugado en mi vida, superando con mucha fuerza a su antesesor. Una historia mejor que el anterior, personajes aún más entrañables (lo cual yo pensaba que era imposible de lograr), mejores mini-juegos en los juicios escolares (añadiendo al fin el sistema de apoyar los argumento como también que al azar te refuten tus propios argumentos) y, por lo que mejora notablemente al anterior, la sorpresa de que alumno morirá y cuales sobrevivirá (en la entrega anterior ya tenías claro quienes iban a sobrevivir y quienes a morir pero en este título no).

Sin embargo, cuenta con el mismo fallo que el anterior, termina un juicio escolar todos se ponen tristes y meláncolicos porque han perdido a uno de sus amigo, pero la mañana siguiente es como si nada hubiera pasado (sin contar a dos de ellos que de verdad se les nota un cambio en la personalidad). También, el nivel de dificultad está mal equilibrado: nivel facil es excesivamente fácil; nivel medio es  fácil; y nivel difícil es complicado.

En conclusión, si lo que quieres es una historia muy entretenida, con personajes con un carisma brutal y pasar muchas horas de entretenimento puro sumando la campaña y lo mini-juegos que se desbloquean tras el modo historia (también son enetretenidos), este es tu juego; pero si lo que quieres es ver un drama increible, con evolución de todos los personajes por la perdida de sus compañeros o un juego que deje con la pregunta "¿Cuándo considero a una persona mi amigo? - ¿Cuándo debo confiar en alguien?" (temas que intenta tratar el juego pero se los lleva el viento), este no es tu título.

Best waifu: Chiaki Nanami
Mejor personaje: Nagito Komaeda

38350460.review:
一周35个小时通关主线+弹丸if小说

惯例说下优缺点

优点：相比于前作，此次的推理部分和剧情部分深度和难度更上一层楼，大到世界观的构造，小到案件的细节和庭审逻辑连接，完成度都比上一部要高（没有很牵强的解释，更能让人接受），特别是最后两个案子，非常精彩，既很好地刻画了人物又埋下了剧情伏笔，为脚本点赞。弹丸的亮点——班级审判篇章，加入了此作我认为最合理的两个环节（同意论点和反论对决），让班级审判不再是主角一个人提出观点，其他角色的存在感up↑。[spoiler] （特别是狛哥√） [/spoiler]

缺点：日常篇的键鼠操作真的比上一部还要反人类，另外，游戏存在玩一段时间之后角色名字无法正常显示的bug[strike] （虽然没多大影响） [/strike]。

总的来说，就游戏性（完善班级审判）和推理（反转和伏笔的合理性）方面来说，比前作要优秀，游戏时长也多了近一半（除去通关后的爱岛模式）。剧情上应该是承上启下之作，对弹丸的世界观补充非常大，很多细节得到了补充，一本满足√。而且在本作最精彩的两个案子之后紧接着的就是大反转，燃爆了！！！[spoiler] 为创哥和狛哥打call [/spoiler]


------------------------------------------------我是剧透吐槽线---------------------------------------------------------------

  虽然我在片头角色介绍里就知道了七海是女主，但是狛哥不仅比男主出现的都要早，而且戏份又多，从始至终都扮演着重要的角色，就算爱岛模式里，也有他的真情吐（gao）露（bai），你敢说这不是你官方cp？？emmmm虽然我第一个攻略的是罪木。

  上一作的班级审判就感觉全程只有三个人智商在线，其他人有意义的观点提不出来，甚至很明显的东西都需要解释解释再解释，但是本作大大改良班级审判环节，至少其他人敢提出论点，逻辑就很顺畅了，有种大家在一起讨论的感觉。

  推理上本作真的完成度很高。没有哪个案子是一眼就能看出凶手是谁，都有适当的反转，无论是犯罪手法，犯罪动机，还是班级审批时的暗地搅局和诡辩，都比较合情合理。最让我不爽的罪木绝望病杀人，也在结局的大反转中得到了解释，嗯原谅你了小罪木♪(＾∀＾●)ﾉ

  剧情上，本作的伏笔和反转尤其多，令人惊喜。尤其是第五章狛哥自杀案，本以为是想哼这家伙肯定没安好心想害死所有人（╯‵□′）╯，结果风向越来越不对，哇擦原来是想抓住叛徒Σ( ° △ °|||)︴，但是明摆着七海是叛徒啊，哼果然还是没安好心（╯‵□′）╯，然后黑白熊赶紧出来跳反，哦原来误会了狛哥Σ( ° △ °|||)︴。。。本来想着就这么算了，没想到结局一个大反转，瞬间洗白白，狛哥真是个好人(*˘︶˘*).。.:*♡

  人物塑造上，狛哥，男主，七海，罪木，田中，九头龙塑造都都很好，狛哥就不说了，[spoiler] 真女主般的存在 [/spoiler]全体智商担当。田中也在第四章完全地被塑造地更加丰富饱满，而不是个只贴着中二病标签的人。结尾七海和男主的一段双簧也升华了这一对[strike]伪[/strike]cp，最后男主的爆发也算是整部游戏的燃点，为了未来而战！！

38304658.review:
— Hajime, what do you think good luck is?
— Are you trying to say... good luck is absolute power?
— Precisely! For me, that's exactly what good luck is!

Очень многое было мной проспойлерено за те годы, что фандом набирал обороты, и, даже несмотря на это, игра оказалась просто фантастически эпичной. По правде говоря, в самом начале мне сложно было представить, что все эти раздражающие фрики в сравнении с относительно адекватными героями первой части смогут как-то затронуть моё сердце по-крайней мере в той же степени, но как же я ошибалась! 

Атмосфера этой игры сильно отличается от предыдущей части, а разница в том, что атмосфера этой части выезжает не на всемогущей надежде, а на [i]абсолютном отчаянии[/i], и оттого развязки судов и концовка выглядят в сто крат эпичнее и пафоснее, вселяя в игрока веру в надежду не только пустым трёпом, но и реальным исходом дел. 

Герои этой части цепляют больше предыдущего поколения тем, что в этой игре раскрывается значительная часть их общего прошлого, намного лучше обоснованы их поступки и взаимоотношения. В этой игре мне даже доводилось плакать на некоторых судах, в то время как предыдущая часть у меня таких эмоций не вызывала. 

В этой игре раза в полтора больше общий объём контента, то есть помимо самого линейного сюжета в игру вложен тот же повседневный режим, полноценная отдельная мини-игра, лайт-новелла и море дополнительных артов. За такую стоимость вся игра и объём её истории превосходят все ожидания.

Главное достоинство ронпы для меня — это огромное количество [b]пафоса[/b], от которого моментами пробирает до мурашек. Этот пафос пронизывает всё, заставляя весь сюжет и персонажей бросаться из крайности в крайность, каким-то образом удерживая планку [i]логичности[/i] и [i]закономерности[/i] происходящего, то есть игра не скатывается в откровенный сюр, несмотря на то, что хаос — в принципе её основополагающая.

Основные недостатки игры состоят разве что в несколько криво исполненных мини-играх в процессе классных судов, причём этот недостаток прослеживается именно во второй игре, а в первой он отсутствует. То-есть проблема не в ПК-адаптации. Появился он за счёт того, что все режимы были усложнены и ускорены, поэтому идеальное прохождение, например, Panic Talk Action и Hangman's Gambit (особенно последний за счёт того, что он по сути работает на рандоме) становится практически невозможным.

Имхо, вселенная Данганронпы обязательна для ознакомления для всех аниме-больных, причём крайне желательно и через игры, и через аниме. Аниме, может, вышло не настолько крутым, насколько крутым могло бы выйти, но оно окончательно расставит все точки после первых двух игр и заставит вас лишний раз убедиться в том, насколько восхитительно детально проработана эта вселенная и насколько она вообще неописуемо крута.

38294901.review:
Mysterious killing trip detective anime just finished.

Well, well, well.

The game is amazing as a sequel, amazing as a standalone game, and definitely worth the price and time spent on, but as I see things, I believe that the first game was way better in almost all aspects, despite that there are new amazing characters, and the storyline is fantastic.

spoilers ahead

What I liked
- Some characters
- Characters funny appearances
- Characters design
- Great storyline idea
- Approach of killings and crimes
- Chapter 4 and 5 crimes
- Chapter 6 by itself
- New amazing tracks on top of the 10/10 first game ost
- Slightly funnier tone of the game
- Plot twists
- Old characters appearance

What I did not liked
- No logic in ending at all, story resolved by itself
- fanservice 
- First three crimes pretty not interesting, there's absolutely no feeling of logic, deduction, and accomplishment in them
- 6 likable characters out of 16
- Some characters too cliché and exceptionally annoying
- Another word to the class trials
- Another word to the logic, motivations, and common sense
- Another word to the anime sides of the game

Despite those weak points, overall this game was amazing!
It really plays well, and intriguing 'till the very end.
Another shoutout to those likable characters, storyline, soundtrack, and three last chapters.

There's really not that much from the most popular visual novels that can be count fully as the video game, on this level of production, and made with such passion, and just for the sake of story I can rate this game as good 4 out of 5.

Gladly I can look for the continuation!
Because there's Danganronpa v3.

首先是处决不行，处决的目的不仅仅是杀死凶手，更重要的是让凶手绝望而死。比如V3里挣扎到最后的希望出口只是一幅画，以为死亡后可以和爱人在一起却被爱人反戈，用自己的生命为代价换来的真相却难以对同伴开口。二代的几个处刑都没有这种绝望感，甚至第四个凶手很满足以死明志的样子。

第三是辩论环节的某些答案，谁都知道是什么，但因为翻译和文化差异的问题，要试几次才能成功。
第四是后面的剧情NMB啊，[spoiler] 把我老婆写死了[/spoiler]
第五，我多次出现角色名字只显示最后一个字的BUG，重进游戏可以解决。然后调音量只对该存档有效，每次进游戏都是特别大的声音

特别想补剧情的弹丸粉可以在打折买来玩玩，否则就算了。
事实上不管是从一代开始玩，还是从V3开始往前补，到二代都会不习惯，我一度怀疑直接进入了刷好感度模式

38242615.review:
Después de pasarme hace tiempo de psVita el primer juego, pensé que una segunda parte no podría llegar a sorprenderme tanto ni llegar a tal nivel ... me alegro de haberme equivocado xD. Dejando a parte que para mi la primera parte no la puede superar, puedo decir que llega al mismo nivel perfectamente. Desde el comienzo ya empieza a romperte la cabeza con cosas extrañas que viniendo del primero no te esperas... pero en cuanto aparece monokuma yo pensé que todo volvería a repetirse de nuevo.... Pero a pesar de que si, el concepto se repite, el argumento va por otros cauces y los personajes nuevos también son geniales y muy variados, creando situaciones totalmente diferentes. De hecho es gracioso como el guión juega con los fans sabiendo que vamos de listos y nos esperamos lo mismo que en el primero y hasta te echan en cara que no va a repetirse algo tan tipico como lo que pasó en tal momento de la primera parte xD.

No quiero spoilear nada, así que simplemente diré que el guión de nuevo es una maravilla super bien llevada de principio a final, sabiendo dar los giros argumentales de manera magnifíca (me han dejado medio tonto con alguno de los giros que tiene con muchos WTF xD, como me pasó en el primero vamos ) y dar pistas poco a poco para que puedas ir dando tu tus deducciones tanto del caso que toca como del argumento general del cual hay pistas desde el comienzo. Y de nuevo, no te esperas nada. Bueno, alguna cosa quizas si eres tan de tramas detectivescas como yo si que vas notando con tus dotes de observación xD. 

A nivel de gameplay mantiene el estilo del primer juego, con el mismo sistema de novela visual + juicios a lo phoenix wright por decir un simil cercano. También hay lo de interactuar en el tiempo libre con los demas y dar regalos con los que ir mejorando la relacion con ellos. Como novedad, en los juicios hay nuevas habilidades y nuevos minijuegos para ir averiguando las diferentes contradicciones y pistas...y os aseguro que la cosa de complica que da gusto!  Un sistema que ya funcionaba en el primero y que no necesitaba mucho así que simplemente hay algunas novedades que añaden más dificultad y variedad. 

A nivel tecnico es exactamente igual que el primero y es que no necesita de nada más, además que el apartado visual es muy marca de la saga e incluso tiene sentido dentro de ese universo. (Aunque siempre me he planteado que si la sangre es rosa, ¿quiere decir que los que tienen ojos o pelos rojos realmente son rosas? xD) . Eso si, hay un mapa muchisimo mas grande y variado, algo que el primero se hacia algo monotono y lo han solucionado aquí a lo grande. Y con el movimiento han aprovechado para poder hacer un tamagochi integrado con tus pasos xD.

El guión como he dicho es genial y los personajes muy buenos y os harán comer la oya más de la cuenta sabiendo de dónde venimos con el 1. Aunque tengo que decir que el grupo del primero, en conjunto me gustó más. Quiero decir que en este nuevo hay un par que para mi son mas flojuchos(el resto son geniales eso si), en el primero todos eran geniales, hasta la que duraba naa y menos xD. Eso si, en este hay un par de waifus geniales para mi... xD. Aunque es peligroso encariñarse en estos juegos T_T. Peligroso en todos los sentidos, todos sabemos lo buena que está cierta Junko... xD. Ah y el protagonista está muy bien porque es bastante diferente al del primero (a pesar de también ser muy bueno con las deducciones xD)
Y bueno, como es fácil de deducir, es necesario 100% haber jugado al primer Danganronpa, si no esto no tiene ningun sentido. 

¿Duracion deciis? Pues un pelin mas corto que el primero quizás (o no, quizas es simplemente porque sabía más como funcionaba el juego ). Depende la velocidad de lectura por supuesto... ahí está lo unico negativo del juego, que está en ingles.... aunque me han comentado que los fans casi lo tienen traducido ya como hicieron con el primero, así que podreis jugarlo sin excusa del idioma en cuanto lo tengan. Y bueno, me lo he pasado pero tengo que seguir porque al pasartelo se te desbloquean dos extras: una novela y un capitulo extra de hechos alternativos que vete a saber cuanto dura xD. También tiene algun minijuego extra con lo que es de lo más completito.

Por sacar algo negativo, yo cambiaria el sistema de relaciones haciendo algo más profundo... es verdad que es dificil con el tema de los asesinatos pero podria estar bien que al conseguir mas relacion con alguna (o alguno si prefieres tu xD) se notase en las conversaciones que teneis mejor relacion, que te apoyase más, te ayudase en los juicios, luego un poco de jugueteo en el apartamento, porque si mueres pues al menos que te vayas contento... xD.

En fin, no volveré a decir que es imposible que el siguiente mantenga tal nivel después de lo visto... pero es difícil! Tengo ganas ya de coger el 3!. Así que si, recomendadísimo a los fans de las novelas visuales, sobre todo los que os gusten las originales y con más interacción y... bueno, los que hayais jugado al primero y os haya gustado, seguro que no os defrauda esta segunda parte. Solo espero que monokuma me deje un ratito tranquilo... se me está pegando su risa, no se si es algo bueno... upupupu

38226797.review:
- ESTA RESEÑA ESTA LIBRE DE SPOILERS -

Después de ver el anime del primer juego y aprovechando que ya salió el tercer juego, me dije, voy a jugar el segundo para luego adentrarme en el tercero, ya que no tengo deseos de comprar el primero (porque ya se como se desarrollan los asesinatos gracias al anime). Es decir, Danganronpa 2 es técnicamente mi primer juego que compro.
La verdad tengo sentimientos encontrados, me parece un gran juego con una gran historia y excelentes personajes pero las mecánicas de juego durante los juicios NO me gustaron, se me hacen confusas y nada amigables al jugador. Para ilustrar mi queja, y sin afán de presumir, les comento que el segundo y tercer caso se me hicieron muy fáciles, sabia desde el comienzo exactamente quien era el asesino y aunque no sabia sus motivos si sabia como realizó el asesinato.....sin embargo durante los juicios fracasé varias veces.....la razón de esto es que aunque estaba preparado para presentar las pruebas muchas veces fallé por no saber jugar correctamente. El juego no se limita solo a presentar las pruebas tienes que jugar minijuegos (los cuales en mi opinión no son explicados correctamente) ya sea disparandole (literalmente) a los argumentos de los personajes, usando un cuchillo para cortar palabras o jugar un minijuego de "ahorcado" (hangman) medio raro, entre otros, todos estos minijuegos con limites de tiempo. Esto significa que si solo buscas un juego para investigar y pensar, prepárate porque vas a necesitar muchos reflejos también.
Además, siento que los minijuegos no todos son necesarios, por ejemplo, durante un juicio aparecerá constantemente un minijuego de andar en patineta.........andar en patineta........durante un juicio......Porque Dios, porque? En mi opinión siento que los desarrolladores hacen estos minijuegos porque no confían en su historia, quizás sienten que el jugador se aburriría si no hubieran estos, pero la historia es FANTÁSTICA!!!, es interesante, es divertida, puede volverse amarga y te encariñas de los personajes (hasta de los mas odiosos) así que no creo que nadie se llegara a quejar incluso si el juego tuviera menos minijuegos y durara menos.
Por cierto, quizás te va a dar dolor de cuello porque las palabras a veces salen a toda velocidad inclinada o de cabeza y tendrás que voltear varias veces la cabeza para leerlas. De ahí en fuera totalmente recomiendo el juego, te engancha mucho y el ultimo capitulo se me hizo MUY BUENO. 
Sin embargo antes de comprar hay otras cosas que quizás deberías considerar antes de comprar el juego:
- El juego NO está en español, solo inglés y japonés. Además necesitas mínimo un inglés medio porque no solo vas a leer, necesitas adivinar palabras en inglés y necesitarás pensarlas rápido porque los juicios tienen limite de tiempo.
 - Es recomendable jugar el primer juego (o ver el anime como yo hice) porque eventualmente el juego empieza a soltarte referencias a la entrega anterior y a enlazar la trama. No es imprescindible, pero la historia la disfrutarás mas si conoces la trama del primero.

Es una buena compra, con o sin descuentos, disfrutarás la trama, los personajes, hay un montón de referencias a otros juegos y animes, la música es excelente. Solo recuerda que no es solo una novela visual porque hay varios minijuegos que tendrás que jugar de si o si para seguir avanzando.

38214412.review:
Danganronpa 2 has some small quality of life improvements over the first game and the story gets a good bit more interesting toward the end, but on the whole, it doesn't match up to its predecessor.

The single worst offender is that just like the first, Danganronpa 2 gleefully wastes your time as it pads out the game. By breaking the story into discrete days and nights, it forces you to sit through an announcement at night, a dream sequence immediately thereafter, an announcement in the morning, and breakfast after that. You basically have player agency taken away from you for 5-10 minutes of IRL time every damn day in the game. One would've hoped the sequel would drop this practice.

But while even the first game padded itself out like that, Danganronpa 2 distinguishes itself with flatter characters that are a lot harder to care about. While a large-cast visual novel is rarely going to have deep characterization, here we have one-note disappointments like "Screaming man who yells about bowel movements a lot," and "Christ, we get it; you're meek and accident prone," and "Excessively rude girl." When one character dies, the game insists over and over that she was the heart of the group and had an unwavering force of personality to cover up for the fact that the game does nothing to characterize this bland, blank slate.

This is on top of cases that just don't match up to the first game's. While the murders are more complex, key details come up during the trial rather than the investigation, which makes many of them beyond the reach of your deduction. Instead you just sit there and play some minigames to hammer out convoluted details that the writers couldn't figure out how to get the character to realize by way of the evidence.

And the minigames. My god the minigames. They're bigger, more intrusive, and so much more tedious than in the previous game. 

Where I said of the first game that its mysteries were so fun that players might look past the padding and tedium, the math just doesn't add up this time around. With weaker mysteries and a LOT more baggage, Danganronpa 2 never really gets off the ground like its predecessor did.

This, of course, will be lost in the sea of positive reviews, because anime-likers are the worst people.

38192289.review:
Like the original game, this is a pretty solid game. There are improvements with the topics that I complained about in the last game, like repetitive BGMs. The BGMs are now varied! 

The ending of the game could be viewed as a weak cop-out because it contains both of the positives of either option that were given to survivors of this game. Due to the vague ending of this game, it is really up to interpretation, I don't think it is a bad ending because it offers a lot of philosophical life advice. It really gets you thinking about your past and just accepting it. I won't get into much detail because it is a topic that is still getting discussed on the Danganronpa Subreddit/Steam Community Discussions. 

===THE BAD===
The majority of the characters are very weak! Most of the characters that don't get much recognization are mostly the weak ones. However, there are a select of amazing characters that people proclaim as either their husbando or waifu -Chiaki, Nagito, Hajime, and etc. The ones that don't do well is Mahiru, Byakuya(fat version), Hyoko, and fat cooking guy; these characters don't have much to offer but just to be another person to move the plot. That's fine to make them plot devices because you gotta do it somehow, but I just feel that they could have done it a bit better and making us feel bad rather than playing the sad BGM.

The gameplay offers a bad Logic Dive mini-game. I just wish that they just offer something that keep you in the class trial rather than pulling you out because it just kills the pace of the game. The pace does get messed up a lot when Logic Dive comes around because you have to kill time by playing it. 

Overall, it's a good gamme! People need to play this!

38183476.review:
强烈推荐！
这绝对是我最喜欢的游戏！没有之一！
枪弹辩驳虽然是一款纯粹以文字推进剧情的游戏，弹带来的情绪却能超越任何作品，入坑后连原本觉得中二有羞耻的超高校级称号都变得如此帅气
[spoiler] 刚玩一代的时候，黑白熊开始宣布自相残杀的时候，我就开始喜欢上这个游戏了，我就特别喜欢这种把一群人放到一个有限的空间内自相残杀的这种电影或游戏，比如大逃杀和饥饿游戏那样的电影。玩到自由活动开始要送礼物的时候我就想看一下攻略，看看每个人物该送什么礼物好。可是看攻略的时候不小心看到了剧透：盾子是幕后黑手，全员存活结局达成方法。不小心看到后我就以为这个游戏是有很多结局的、每次死的人都是不一定的之类的猜想。于是我就开始疯狂给盾子送礼物，以为把她好感度刷满了就不会有人死了。直到舞园死的时候，我震了一下，舞园是当时我最不想让她死的人，于是我就开始疯狂找攻略，找不让舞园死掉的结局。当然我没有找到，第一章结束时那满满的绝望感[/spoiler]还有就是我感觉叶隐这个角色真的是太废、太酱油了
弹丸论破一代让我玩的这个紧张刺激呀，玩的时候剧情让我一直有新鲜感，并且一直期待下一章的剧情，以至于我在两天之内玩了19小时过了一周目。
一代通关后我还没有满足！立刻就开始了第二代的一周目。
二代是我认为弹丸论破系列里最好的一代，每一个角色都很喜欢，这代的每个bgm都很好听，整代的作案手法我也觉得是整个系列的最高水平[spoiler] 尤其是第五章狛枝自杀那里是我认为最nb的 [/spoiler]我真的是很爱二代的每一个角色，在玩的过程中我会为他们的惨死而心痛，为他们是绝望的残党而感到绝望。但是我每次加满谁的好感度，谁下章就会死，二代也是我最想幹小高的一部作品。虽然在弹丸3未来篇里77期人都活了[spoiler] 看来小高还是怕我给他送刀片了 [/spoiler]
二代玩的比一代更爽，爽到我一口气不睡觉26小时通关一周目，通关后还是没有满足，最床上也是一直想着。
至于绝少就不说啥了，换成了射击游戏，剧情内容也跟前两代比薄弱太多，感觉就是给弹丸粉补全剧情用的[spoiler]但是困妹真的好可爱啊[/spoiler]绝少比起现在的三款正传游戏来说，这代只能算上是个普通的作品。虽然比不上正传作品，但是给弹丸粉丝玩玩还是挺不错的
三代通关后我就开始看未来篇和绝望篇动画去了，虽然有些剧情弄的跟屎一样，但是还是很有弹丸风格的两部动画。[spoiler]但是没看绝望篇之前我一直觉的盾子是一个我超级喜欢的反派，但是看完后我就觉得盾子像一个疯子、神经病一样，而且我一直觉的盾子是一个很NB的反派，但是结果统统都交给洗脑了啊，有洗脑真的可以为所欲为？[/spoiler][spoiler] 当初说未来篇是希望和绝望的最终对决，结果就是未来机构的内战，真的有点MMP的感觉[/spoiler]绝望篇开头很美好，结局很绝望。未来篇开头很绝望，结局很美好[spoiler]我最喜欢的77期同学全都复活了！耶！最后心疼七海小天使[/spoiler]
于是就又去看小说zero，虽然没看太懂，但也算是了结了弹丸的所有剧情了。
玩完游戏，看完动画和小说的我还没有满足，于是发现半个月后v3在pc上发布，发售当天立刻原价买，就直接开始玩。v3是我玩枪弹辩驳系列玩的最爽的一代，尤其是全论破的那个环节，玩的我直起鸡皮疙瘩。v3在玩到最后一章之前给人的印象都非常好，如果你没有玩过枪弹辩驳的前几作，那你玩第六章时就感觉这一章是坨屎一样[spoiler] 虽然玩过前几部的人很多人也感觉跟屎一样 [/spoiler][spoiler]而且到第六章看到剩这几个人存活时，因为前几章跟白银织几乎没有一点关系，我竟然直接猜出了她就是搞事的幕后黑手[/spoiler]但是小高好像说过v3是前几代的平行世界,而且，按照v3的主题，这个结局也有可能是个谎言啊！
真的很佩服小高这个人，能把每个人物刻画的那么个性鲜明，每个BGM都非常的出色，并运用的恰到好处，尤其是开庭前的Under ground和高能神曲New World Order，真的是让人腺上激素狂飙。虽然小高把我很多喜欢的角色弄死了，但是我真的很佩服他，我对小高的爱是一种爱恨交加的爱。
如果要我说我最喜欢的游戏排名的话，枪弹辩驳绝对是第一名。如果说枪弹辩驳系列我最喜欢哪一代，那绝对是二代！
小高说过枪弹辩驳会出新作的，所以我绝对会一直期待着的！

38141954.review:
Monokuma's back in this thrilling continuation of the Danganronpa series. 

This time, sixteen students have found themselves trapped on the uninhabited Jabberwock Island. However, just like before, these aren't just ANY sixteen students. They're sixteen ULTIMATE students from Hope's Peak Academy. Also, like the orginal colourful cast, the new students all are very characterized and fleshed out. Trust me, you won't be dissapointed. 

Solve murders, discover secrets about the island, and learn the truth about what Monokuma is planning this time around (and yes, this plan is full of despair). But that's not all! The story about the Danganronpa universe in this game picks up from where the last game left off, throwing in various elements, old and new. (I won't say anymore about it, as it's best to go into this game knowing as little as humanly possible). 

So in conclusion, I thoroughly enjoyed this game. The murders were engrossing, the characters were detailed and well thought out, and the story was AMAZING. This is a worthy edition of the Danganronpa series, in more ways than one (But I won't spoil!). 

Highly reccommended! I gurantee that fans of the series will love this!

P.S: I'm SO ready for the third volume!! But it's so expensive ;-;

P.P.S: In my opinion, this game was even better than the first (in terms of character and story). My brain exploded in the finale reveal. It was aaaaamazing. LOVE THIS SERIES SOSO MUCH.

37927150.review:
10/10 Soundtrack
9/10 Art
10/10 Storyline
5/7 Waifus

Compelling story, great soundtrack and the art is very good. A good, high quality visual novel about shooting down other people's arguments. You can tell a lot of work was being put into this, unlike most visual novels coming out these days.

It has a sane amount of fanservice, good humor, interesting characters (for the most part) and some interesting cinematics, including some really delightfully cruel executions.
You shouldn't expect great gameplay from a visual novel, but in this regard Danganronpa surprised me as well. Class trials tend to get a bit intense, however the explorations bits can be a bit tedious.

The story had me interested for all the 44 hours it took me to beat the game. I would definitely recommend this to people who enjoy murder mysteries and watching their waifus die.

9/10 overall.

37825800.review:
Powrót do serii i od razu strzał w dziesiątkę - "Danganronpa 2" jest bardziej rozbudowana, w pewnym momentach bardziej absurdalna, a na pewno mocniejsza od poprzedniczki. 

Tym razem kierujemy krokami Hajimego Hinaty, a miejscem akcji nie jest szkoła, lecz tropikalna wyspa, na którą wybieramy się razem z klasą. Zadaniem wszystkich jest zaprzyjaźnienie się z całą resztą... dopóki oczywiście nie pojawia się Monokuma. W warstwie fabularnej mamy kolejną wyśmienitą historię - zagadki są dużo trudniejsze od poprzednich, dowiadujemy się też o wiele więcej o świecie (aczkolwiek pytania pozostają nadal, więcej - mnożą się na potęgę), a morderstwa stają się okrutniejsze. W pewnym sensie zarówno pod względem historii jak i bohaterów "Danganronpa 2" jest autokliszą części pierwszej... i zależy jak do tego wszystkiego podejść. Komuś może przeszkadzać powielanie schematów, ja dostrzegłam tu szansę na wyłapywanie aluzji niczym w Cambellowskim monomicie. Przeszkadzał mi trochę zwrot akcji na końcu - [spoiler]to, że wszystko jest rzeczywistością wirtualną, wydało mi się jakimś słabym połączeniem "Matriksa" z plot twistami rodem z filmów Shyamalana. Acz to, że nasi bohaterowie są/byli "tymi złymi" i co właściwie zrobili w przeszłości - to jest niezłe.[/spoiler]

Skoro o bohaterach mowa, to początkowo nie mogłam pozbyć się myśli, że "to nie są tamci z jedynki"... ale po pewnym czasie poczułam więź i z nimi. Jasne, że nie są tamtymi - bo każdy z nich ma własną, unikalną osobowość. Nie uniknięto oczywiście postaci płytkich takich jak rozpuszczona Hiyoko, ale nadrabiają to inni uczniowie z Nagitem na czele, który moim skromnym zdaniem jest jednym z najlepiej napisanych bohaterów w historii. Nie wiem też na ile celowe wydało mi się stworzenie studentów tak, jakby stanowili połączenie cech poprzednich - Akane to przecież buzia Aoi i siła Sakury... może coś w tym jest?

Gra niestety gorzej wypada technicznie. Wyspy są oczywiście większe od szkoły, więc rozwiązano to side-scrollerem, ale chodzenie w tą i we wtą jest irytujące. Do tego sprite'y zarówno postaci w trakcie rozmów, jak i Hajimego podczas chodzenia są po prostu rozpikselowane i wygląda to naprawdę źle. Może to wina konwersji z konsoli? Do tego nowe minigierki (zwłaszcza logic dive) po prostu irytują... Utwory za to naprawdę dają radę, zwłaszcza te nowe.

"Danganronpa 2" to kolejny tytuł w serii i kolejny wielki krok naprzód. To jedna z ciekawszych historii napisanych na potrzeby gier komputerowych, doskonałe wyzwanie dla umysłu i zwyczajnie świetna zabawa. Nawet jeśli krew tryska tu bardzo często.

Ajoutez-y des moments qui vous ferons mourir de rire un instant, puis chialer comme une madeleine le suivant, avec des plot twist plus surprenant les uns que les autres.

Bref, une perle.

And the cast - the new cast truly was wonderful as well. Overall, this game was pretty great and was very long. If you're up for a game that switches between light and dark, anime, a new and major plot twist at the end, a great cast and more things - if you enjoyed Trigger Happy Havoc - you'll sure enjoy Super Danganronpa 2.

37668842.review:
Po naprosto parádním prvním dílu, který jsem dohrál na 100% (jak základní hru s oběma konci, tak i speciální School Mode), jsem s nadějí vyhlížel druhý díl. Neváhal jsem a opět si jej pořídil za plnou cenu. Bohužel jsem velmi brzy narazil a právě o tomhle budou mé dojmy.

[h1]Prý nejlepší díl z celé série... [/h1]
Ano, tohle nebude má klasická recenze, ale spíše dojmy z prologu a první kapitoly. Berte tedy onen palec dolů a nedoporučení s určitou rezervou. Je dost možné, že časem recenze bude kladná, ale v tento moment hru nemůžu s čistým svědomím doporučit. Popravdě se musím přemáhat, abych se vrátil k jejímu hraní.

Lidé hodně říkají, že tenhle díl je lepší než ten předchozí. Dle některých je to to nejlepší ze (zatím) trilogie Danganronpa. Mě by však stačilo jen vylepšení pár drobností z prvního dílu. Tvůrci k tomu ale měli jiný názor, tudíž tu je hromada změn, které ne vždy dopadly dobře.

[h1]50 odstínů Danganronpy[/h1]
Celkem logicky tu je nová šestnáctka hrdinů. A už zde je jeden z největších problémů druhé Danganronpy. Zatímco u předchozího dílu byly postavy občas ujeté, stále se dalo věřit, že někdo takový existuje. Tady je to ale už přes čáru, kdy někteří lidé jsou totálně k smíchu a moc tomu nepomáhá ani ujetější anime stylizace, která narušuje celkový temný dojem a dělá z toho něco vhodného spíše pro mladší publikum. Hromada vtipů není vůbec vtipných. Zvlášť jedna postava je totálně přes čáru, protože co vypustí z úst, to je prasárna nebo nějaký nevhodný dvojsmysl.

Pokud mi v prvním dílu vadil Hifumi, který sem tam plácl nějaký dvojsmysl, tak zde je to o několik stupňů horší. Tahle postava se mi vůbec nelíbí a kdykoliv jen promluví, mám chuť ho zabít nebo mu minimálně říct, aby už držel hubu, že ty prasárny nikoho nezajímají. Vážně si někdo z tvůrců myslel, že bude vtipné, když jedné holce bude nabízet, aby mu vykouřila péro? A to hned dvakrát po sobě? Kromě tohohle nesmyslného a stupidního charakteru tu je pak taková lehká erotika, i když ona to ani není erotika. Prostě jedna holka furt padá na zem a vždycky ji naleznete v takové póze, kdy jí sukně sjede dolů a vy byste viděli pomalu vše, naštěstí ale tvůrci měli dost rozumu a intimní partie vždy zakrývá určitý předmět (například talíř... vím, zní to divně, ale ona celá hra je v tomhle ohledu zatím jedno velké WTF).

[h1]Školní výlet[/h1]
Druhou věcí, která je dle mě horší, je zasazení hry. Zatímco škola plná prázdných uliček, prázdných místností a bez denního světla je opravdu temným a depresivním místem, zde se naši noví hrdinové přesunou k moři. Na pětici ostrovů, které se vám postupně odemykají. Díky tomu, že venku neustále svítí sluníčko, slyšíte šumění moře a celkově jste na čerstvém vzduchu daleko od civilizace, utrpěla atmosféra. Už to prostě není takové depresivní, ale skoro to působí jako nějaká odměna.

Změna atmosféry jde vidět především u prologu, který je až příliš dlouhý, nudný a nabízí hromadu "co to sakra je" okamžiků. Medvěda Monokumu tu totiž zpočátku nahradí jiný plyšák, který je ale jeho totálním opakem. A vidět, jak moc je onen králík šťastný a všude chce šířit naději a lásku a podobné věci, pro mě bylo šokem. Celkově mi tahle nová postava vadí, protože po příchodu Monokumy na scénu nezmizí, ale můžete vidět, jak tihle dva spolu bojují a mluví a dělají další trapné věci, které působí naprosto šíleně a přál bych si, aby tu byl jen zlý medvěd.

[h1]"Vylepšení" miniher a hratelnosti[/h1]
Hra nabízí i několik zajímavých funkcí, které rozšiřují základní hratelnost. Nyní máte krokoměr, díky kterému levelujete (získáváte tak možnost mít více aktivních schopností). Taktéž máte svého virtuálního mazlíčka, o kterého se můžete starat a pokud dospěje, získáte příjemné bonusy.

Bohužel pokud to vydržíte a dostanete se až k prvnímu soudnímu procesu, budete zírat. Zatímco u prvního dílu vám hra vše vysvětlila a šla na to pomalu, zde se nejspíše předpokládá, že nejste zelenáči. Jako je to dobře, ale aby se tu už od prvního soudního procesu začínalo s více náboji pravdy, tak to je fakt moc. Jako by to ani nestačilo, tvůrci dokázali naprosto zmrvit minihru oběšenec. V předchozím díle jste prostě měli důležité slovo, na střední obtížnost jste viděli pár již vložených písmenek do onoho slova a na obrazovce se objevovaly a mizely další písmenka. Vy jste museli sestřelit ty, které seděly do tohoto slova a to v určitém pořadí. Ve zkratce - byla to zábavná minihra.

Nyní to funguje tak, že na střední obtížnost nevidíte ani jedno písmenko z daného slova, slov tu je vícero a co je největším problémem je fakt, jakým způsobem funguje tahle minihra. Zleva i zprava letí v různé rychlosti různá písmenka, vy musíte spojit dvě stejná dohromady a to písmeno pak použít nebo odstranit. Pokud se srazí stejná písmenka, toto písmeno zůstane na herní ploše. Pokud se srazí jiná písmenka, ztratíte život. Zní to strašně složitě, protože ono to je složité. Až zbytečně. Totálně tuhle minihru zničili a už není vůbec zábavná, naopak je dost frustrující a sledovat, kde co letí za písmenko je místy naprosto k zbláznění.

Ještě se vrátím i k přestřelkám během konverzací. Nově můžete i vybrat, že s některým výrokem souhlasíte. Je to příjemné rozšíření možností, bohužel další novinkou je představení možnosti, kdy vás někdo okřikne a chce znehodnotit váš argument. Tato minihra má dvě části, kdy ta první spočívá ve zvolení správného náboje pravdy a poté "střílení" na JAKÉKOLIV věty vyřčené vaším odpůrcem. Je to blbost a než jsem pochopil, že to funguje takhle trapně, neustále jsem musel restartovat tuhle část hry. Poté nastane okamžik, kdy postava říká určité věci, vy musíte zvolit jiný náboj pravdy a rozseknout tak daný argument. Pokud se vám to nepodaří včas nebo se spletete, minihra vás hodí opět na začátek. Navíc ubíhá klasicky čas, takže může klidně i vypršet.

[h1]Co se povedlo[/h1]
I když to vypadá, že si chci jen stěžovat, jsou tu i věci, které se mi líbí. Minimálně zatím se mi víc líbí hlavní postava, která se chová celkem logicky a rozhodně lépe než Makoto. Tvůrci také naštěstí zcela nekopírují všechny prvky z jedničky a dokonce tu jsou i občasná pomrknutí na předchozí díl. Monokuma je opět parádní. První vražda je dost zajímavá, opět očekávejte zvraty tak typické pro tuhle sérii. Bohužel to je zatím vše, co se mi tady líbí. Budu hrát dál, ale nebýt parádního prvního dílu, tak nevím, jestli bych téhle hře ještě dával šanci. Zatím je to o dost horší zážitek.

37059230.review:
Going to start by making 3 points very clear:
1) This may be the darkest game (thematically) that I have ever played
2) The "Overwhelmingly positive" score is absolutely deserved
3) You really should play the first game before this!


So Danganronpa 2 follows a similar style to the original in that kids are forced to kill each other to survive. After each kill there is a "Class trial" with 2 possible outcomes:
1) You find the killer and they are executed
2) You do not find the killer, the killer can go home, and everyone else is executed

I won't say too much as the story has so many twists and turns that spoilers are far too easy to casually hand out - but this one had my jaw drop on several occasions - especially in the act 5 trial!! The story and, importantly, the localisation is absolutely fantastic!

Both games are on sale at the time that I write this, you really do owe it to yourself to give both a try. DO NOT be put off by the visual novel connections... I am not a fan of that genre, but these two games have had me absolutely hooked throughout!

36299412.review:
通关一周目来写写评价，希望对你们有点帮助吧。
首先，推理难度和操作难度我选的都是亲和。
评分方面：
音乐：9/10
画面：8/10
剧情：10/10（没有偏心，对比一代和绝绝来说，二代的剧情真的是神作无疑）
整体：9/10
[h1]游戏简单介绍：[/h1]
在度假胜地贾巴沃克岛上，兔兔美老师带领着16名拥有着超高校级才能的高中生享受着修学旅行。作为本系列大boss黑白熊出现并强制定下只有自相残杀才能找回记忆以及离开岛屿的规则。[spoiler]在经历了派对杀人事件、以正义为名的杀人事件、绝望病杀人事件、草莓之家杀人事件、赌上运气的杀人事件等五章剧情内容后，日向创等人终于清楚等待着他们的是绝望本身。[/spoiler]
游戏的几个优点：
[h1]1.极富冲击力的声画表现[/h1]
弹丸系列最为吸引玩家的优点之一就是它那十分具有个性的游戏画面。游戏开始界面的像素风、游戏过程中的2D画风以及人物的纸板风格等等极具特色，结合其中独特的配乐bgm，使得游戏更显个性。游戏整体的画面色调反差高，动画方面也十分具有渲染力，死刑动画算得上整个游戏中最激动人心的部分。
[h1]2.极具个性的人物设定[/h1]
在弹丸论破的几大版本之中，每款游戏都塑造了不少个性鲜明的登场角色。个人觉得弹丸2的角色设定真的是整个系列里塑造最成功的（七海小天使QAQ）。首先，‘超高校级’的设定使得玩家能在短时间内熟悉并记住游戏中的登场角色（即便他很早就领便当）。其次，‘超高校级’的这个设定也很大程度上推进并影响着整个游戏的事件推理进程，[spoiler]在第一~第三个事件中，罪木的‘超高校级的卫生股长’这一才能帮助众人分析死者的死因以及死亡时间，使得游戏推理更加简单；狛枝的‘超高校级的幸运儿’这一设定奠定了第五章的推理结果，使得第五章的杀人事件更加具有神秘色彩。[/spoiler]这些设定也让人物角色更加深入人心。[spoiler]（所以第五章我是哭着玩完的，不敢相信狛枝竟然死了！！！）	[/spoiler]
[h1]3.极具悬疑色彩的剧情[/h1]
我觉得弹丸系列之所以被称为神作，很大一部分原因是因为其中缜密烧脑的推理剧情和其庞大的世界观，与一代相同，游戏的只要节奏遵循日常自由活动--发现杀人事件--进入调查环节--学级裁判。自由活动这一方面主要是送礼物和刷好感。而接下来才是最精彩的部分，从调查尸体、死因、众人的嫌疑等一系列的信息之后进入学级裁判，通过无休止议论、逻辑潜入、灵感闪烁拼字、反驳激辩、最终推理拼图等过程来将事件推理清晰、指认凶手。剧情的结果往往出乎意料，杀人手法也跟‘超高校级’的才能这一设定相关，剧情有点烧脑。
[h1]4.可玩性多样的小游戏[/h1]
对比一代的小游戏，二代在这方面更加用心，增加了逻辑潜入这一玩法，玩家用过滑板运动选择正确的答案，期间会有一些障碍物的阻挡，整个过程像是RAC竞技过程，这一玩法使得裁判过程更加紧张刺激。这里面的小游戏不得不提的是裁判最后的高潮推理漫画，通过填补犯罪过程中缺失的关键性拼图，让玩家清楚整个犯罪事件的顺序，推动游戏进程的发展。
[h1]【总结】[/h1]
总的来说，超级弹丸论破2是超越一代的推理游戏神作，可能一开始的日常生活比较无聊，剧情铺垫也比较多，但是在玩到第一个事件，真正体验到学级裁判的精彩之后，你就会深陷于弹丸的魅力之中[strike]（我一开始玩了序章就搁置了两个星期，在玩过第一章之后就停不下来了，连续通宵3天通关的）。[/strike]
弹丸的时间线是绝望篇--1代--绝对绝望少女--2代--史上最大最恶事件--V3
（建议玩的顺序是1代--2代--绝对绝望少女--V3）
还有就是，[spoiler] 动画里给我一种日向创X七海的CP感真是太可恶了，七海明明是我的！[/spoiler]

36272551.review:
(以下涉及剧透，未通关者勿点遮盖字)
虽然我很欣赏弹丸系列，也对剧情很着迷，但它在我心里却离神作还差一丝。我的理由呢，主要有两点。一是因为[spoiler]弹丸系列最终还是走上了用梦境、实感游戏来解释一切不合理的烂俗老路。[/spoiler]甚至于像毕业考审判，竟然最后不是靠证据而是纯粹的靠信念辩驳。最后的攻破boss心房，只用“才不是这样”这样一句话就草草解决了？这一部略有点烂尾的嫌疑。二，又一部略未来式的作品。不是说略带点未来式的作品不好，而是现在好多作品把背景写玄乎了想写回来又发现不好解释。结果都偷懒似的喜欢用未来式的背景来辅助一笔带过。[spoiler]像alter ego，七海，哪有可能是现阶段科技做的出来的人工智能？实感意识游戏，也远不是现在能做到的。[/spoiler]相比较而言，紧抓这一时代的科技水准，故事早期科幻化魔幻化故事最后合理解释这才是最厉害的。《雷逆》就是一个非常好的例子。当然了，瑕不掩瑜。你看起来好像我都在挑缺点，但其实这是我对于欣赏的作品所提出的高要求。好的东西你当然希望它更好！如果还没玩的，也请不要犹豫，确确实实是个好作品好游戏。也许在你心里，它就是神作。

36220823.review: Sama gra jest bardzo dobrze wykonana, muzyczka fajna, jest klimacik. Fabula jest rozwinieta i ciekawa, a niektore dialogi miedzy postaciami sprawiaja, ze nie chce ich przewijac( niestety tylko niektore). Czesto jednak mam wrazenie, ze postacie w czesci pierwszej byly znacznie ciekawsze i wzbudzaly wiecej sympatii. Nie dosc, ze postacie z D1 byly lepiej wedlug mnie napisane to ich design tez byl znacznie lepszy. Kazdy mial w sobie cos charakterystycznego. W D2 praktycznie zadna z postaci do mnie nie przemawia i nie jestem w stanie szczerze polubic zadnej z nich chociaz na tyle, zeby mi bylo przykro kiedy umiera. Nie jest to moze najistotniejsza rzecz, ale sprawia, ze gra nie jest tak wciagajaca jak jej poprzedniczka. Troche trudno sie przemieszczac jak juz przychodzi do chodzenia i troche trudno zrozumiec po co sa niektore funkcje ( jak te ze sprzataniem kup i krolikiem). Gra nadal jest podzielona na chaptery, ktore sa podzielone na historie, morderstwo, investigation i trial. Czasem trudno przebrnac przez poczatki chapterow, bo sa bardzo nudne, ale chyba warto, bo investigation jest jedna z ciekawszych czesci (pozwala graczowi na zebranie dowodow). Trial jest rowniez ciekawe, ale trudne do przejscia( chociaz to pewnie zalezy od umiejetnosci gracza). Na szczescie jest duzo poradnikow, co jest plusem, bo jesli masz bardzo zly refleks i ciezko ci trafiac w odpowiednie slowa czesci dyskusji, to mozesz zostac uratowany :) Gra ogolnie polecana, bo dla samego klimatu i zabaw w detektywa warto.

36114252.review:
《弹丸论破 完结篇》

灯马牙咬得紧紧的，双手指节攥到发白，死死盯着桌子对面那个粉色双马尾的少女。
“怎么了，被神选中的人？为什么要用这种眼神看着我？”那个名字叫做江之岛盾子的少女微笑着看过来，眼底跳动着不明的火焰。
“被神选中的人？我吗？”灯马被突如其来的话震了一下。
“对，就是你。”江之岛盾子伸出手指点了点，“超高校级的不幸，灯马同学。”
“不要装神弄鬼了，江之岛！”一个男子拍桌而起。他叫日向创，就在刚刚法庭进行到最关键的时候闯进来，自称是来救大家的。当然他也表现出了足够的实力的诚意，获得了几位幸存同学的信任。
“我可不是在装神弄鬼。”江之岛盾子一笑，又对灯马继续说道：“作为这场幸存者游戏的主角，你的推理能力应该是幸存者里最强的，那么你有没有发现一个问题？”
“什么问题？”
“就是这个所谓‘超高校级才能’，它真的是才能吗？”江之岛盾子指着日向创，“那边那个叫日向创的人，他拥有所有的才能。”说到这里顿了顿，“人造的。”
“人造？”
“一个没有任何才能的人，通过人体实验，获得了全部才能。”
灯马瞪大了眼睛：“这怎么可能？”但日向创此时阴郁的表情足以说明，江之岛盾子说的是真的。
“对，那根本不是才能。在座各位所有的超高校级的才能，都不是才能。”
灯马的大脑飞速运转，然后得出一个惊人的结论：“是超能力。”
“超。。。超能力？”其他几位同学惊呼起来：“开什么玩笑！”
灯马摇头：”不是玩笑。你们想想看，我的才能是什么？超高校级的不幸。这种东西怎么可能是才能？”
江之岛盾子已经又变了一张脸，她的厌倦一向如此迅速：“不幸？不不不不不，被神选中的人怎么可能是不幸的人？你的能力，可是高级得多得多得多得多。。。。。。”一个絮叨的人格。
“难道不是我带来的不幸，才让黑羽同学被杀吗？”灯马又回想起了那起逃脱魔术的案子。
“黑羽？超高校级的魔术师黑羽快斗？那可与你的不幸无关，哦当然说有关也没错。之前说过了，所谓才能，就是超能力，所以黑羽快斗的魔术，其实是超能力。而你做的，只是把他的超能力暂时拿去了而已，用你的右手。”
“右手。。。取消。。。超能力。。。”灯马咀嚼着这几个词，突然大脑一阵阵地痛，一些仿佛从未见过但又无比熟悉的记忆出现在脑海中。“我是。。。我是。。。”
江之岛盾子看着痛苦的灯马，突然大笑起来：“终于想起来了吗？灯马，不，上条当麻同学？”
“对，我是上条当麻。”灯马口中喃喃自语。
“那么，被神选中又是什么意思呢？神是谁？命运吗？”趁着上条当麻整理思绪，另一个幸存者，“超高校级的哲学家”佐佐木由理发问了。
“神，当然就是神了。全能的，愚蠢的，该死的，神。”说着说着便开始咬牙切齿，仿佛与她口中那个神有不共戴天的仇恨，“也许你会觉得带给世界绝望的人恨神再正常不过了对不对？但其实神才是带给世界绝望的人。”
“神是人？”
“神想要做人，人偏偏想要成神。神不要做神，才会有神座出流，人想要成神，才会给自己取名叫神座出流。”一串叫人听不懂的话。
原来是这样。。。上条当麻却在这云里雾里的话语中理清了头绪：“世界上存在一个神，祂给了世人超能力，但是祂想要做人，于是放下了自己的权柄。而这个学校的创始人发现了这点，就以学校的名义建立了一个研究超能力的机构，以获得神的权柄。从日向创来看，他几乎成功了。”
“成功？可笑！神的力量怎么会只有超能力？你不会是被亚雷斯塔那个蠢货传染了吧？你可是神选中的人。”
“神选中的人到底是什么意思？”
“前面已经说过了，神想要做人，于是神在创造世界之后就封印了自己的记忆，但还是有力量在潜意识影响下散佚出来，变成了所谓的 ‘才能’。但是这里面隐藏着一个危机，这些才能的产生和具体属性是不受控制的，很可能产生会对世界有重大危害的才能，于是神的潜意识就创造了一个抑制器，可以在短时间内消除才能，这个抑制器也就是你，上条当麻。”
上条当麻眼睛眯了起来：“所以那个对世界有重大危害的人，就是你咯？超高校级的绝望，江之岛盾子？”
“所以我们是天生一对嘛。”
“我可不知道原来天丛云剑和八歧大蛇是天生一对。”
“这个就要问我们的神大人了。你说呢，佐佐木同学？”
所有人震惊地望向佐佐木由理。
佐佐木低着头，身体不住地颤抖，然后蓦地停住，再抬起头时，周身都散发出一种让人不敢直视的气场。
这就是神。
然而江之岛盾子却毫无顾忌地直视着佐佐木，嘴角含着嘲讽的笑意：“神大人，你终于醒了。可惜，你的世界已经完了。即使并非故意，但你的一部分力量已经被人破解，这个世界又变成了世人才能由个别人决定的绝望世界，所以啊，这个世界我已经帮你玩坏了。如何，我这个超高校级的革命家？现在你又该重置世界了，神大人，或者说凉宫春日同学。愿下个世界没有绝望。”
=====================================
时间线：凉宫春日因某种原因重置世界-封印自己记忆变成佐佐木由理（佐佐木+伪团长仲村由理）-潜意识产生超能力者-产生抑制器上条当麻-亚雷斯塔发现超能力与神的关联-建立学校研究超能力-研究成功-改造日向创-江之岛盾子毁灭世界

Le deuxième opus de Danganronpa surpasse le premier à bien des niveaux ! Histoire incroyable avec un dénouement à la fois inattendu et qui permet de comprendre certains points obscurs du premier opus. 
On retrouve ici 16 nouveaux étudiants qui sont une nouvelle fois impliqués malgré eux dans un jeu de tuerie. Dans ce jeu on retrouve un gameplay plutôt semblable au précédent, avec des petits ajouts notamment lors des procès qui compliquent un peu ceux ci. Ces procès sont encore plus durs que celui du premier, donc tu va devoir chauffer tes neurones mon petit ! La bande son est toujours aussi bien, surtout celle des exécutions, qui sont d'ailleurs superbes [spoiler]Franchement celle de Peko, Gundham et Chiaki sont incroyables[/spoiler] et les doublages correspondent très bien aux personnages. Ces personnages sont d'ailleurs bien plus attachants que ceux du premier, avec leurs personnalités et leurs histoires [spoiler]Nagito et Chiaki restent les meilleurs pour moi ! Izuru est cool aussi ! Même si je les aiment tous![/spoiler] D'ailleurs le duo Monomi et Monokuma donne un certain comique aux scènes, Monukuma étant resté fidèle à lui même, ce qui est super.

En bref, foncez acheter ce jeu, vous ne le regretterez pas ! 

PS : Préparez les mouchoirs, la mort de ton personnage préféré risque d'arriver vite (Monsieur le développeur est très fort pour ça!)

35906458.review:
Without a doubt, better than the first game.

The first game was good, but this game was great. It improves in so many areas from the first game, but is dragged down by a few problems. Two of my main problems from the first game were how some things were easy to predict and the ending. In this game, there was never a point where I could predict what was going to happen next. As for the ending, it still is a mind f***, a little cheesy, and a little dumb, but at least it's not as dumb as the first game's ending. This game series has a problem with screwing up endings, where they just go from 10 to 20 in seconds and it is all convoluted as all h***. The majority of the game is gripping and interesting, but the ending just makes me go "What the f***? Did I or the author just drop acid. I mean, it's still better than first's ending by f***ing miles, but how do you go from these complex and intelligent murder mysteries to this?"

The characters in this game are better than in the first game. They had more layers than the originals and they also felt more real than the original characters. I cared about almost everyone and that made each death more powerful than the first game.

Warning: DO NOT GET A WAIFU, THEY WILL DIE! I know that maybe hard because the waifus in this game are far better than any of the waifus in the first game, except Chihiro. #Chihiro4Life. I fell for the trap again and I was hurt really badly.

Some problems I had with this game were with the game's presentation and the very beginning. You need to endure the beginning in order to get to the good stuff. Your time from when you arrive at the island to when Monokuma makes his appearance, is utter painful. I would have quit if lasted even 30 minutes longer. As for the presentation, when you are walking from place to place, Hajime's walking animation looks like s*** and doesn't mesh well with the background and foreground objects go behind him too. And don't forget about that Tamagotchi s*** who's only purpose for existing is to lock two skills and a trophy behind it.

All in all, a great game with some problems.
9/10 Would get traumatized again.

35808882.review:
Danganronpa 2 was honestly a very thrilling experience. 
If you were a fan of the first one, there's a possibility that you'd love this one even more.
Storywise, the game expands upon so much of the Hope's Peak Academy ark that was introduced in the first game.
The game gives you a brand new cast of characters, which you'll quickly find yourself getting used to and before you know it, feel emotional towards. In fact, this cast is far more exciting than the last one. They have various characteristics, which make them anything but dull. As you can already tell, they have funkier and edgier designs. You may or may not forget you're playing a cast of high schoolers. The twists in turns that are provided by revelations and plot twists are still there. In this game, the plot twists are even more exciting. 

There is no anime to watch before playing this game, however i do recommend watching the second season of the anime (Danganronpa 3) to see what happens before and after the game.
This game is a visual novel, but unlike  most visual novels, there are a lot of immersive experiences in the game. There are about 30 hours of gameplay in my opinion. I took a long time to finish the game due to falling asleep and having the game run in the background. I'm also a slow reader, but this game kept me interested more than any book ever could.
The advancement in production level of this game compared to its predecessor  is exponentially noticeable. Especially in terms of visuals. I played the game in Japanese so I can not speak so much for the English dub.

The game was an overall great experience and I'd recommend it.

Only complaint is that the minigames can be pretty annoying in the later trials.

35574673.review:
This is probably my favorite Danganronpa in series thus far. The story was very interesting and won't spoil too much of the story but I will say I really love the ending. Unlike the first Danganronpa, this time it takes place on an island then a school. The island has 5 different islands and each of them are unique in their own way. 

 As chapters go on you learn more about the island and learn the truth behind it. It's very fascinating, the class trials are even better and the minigames are tons of fun. Logic Dive being my absolute favorite amongst the other minigames. Really loved answering questions while avoding obstacles. The new improved Hangman's Gambit imo was a littler better compared to the first ones mostly because the first ones Hangman's Gambit had me confused. This one I can tolerate.

 Rebuttal showdown is also really cool too. This mostly happens when one of your classmates tries to refute one of your arguments and you must slice there arguments in half mostly the white text. During the second phase of it you have to pick one of the arguments to back up your statement. If you slice the wrong one then the student can have an advantage I had to quickly pick the right bullet or i'll go back to the first phase.

The class trials in this game are way more fun the previous one just because of the variety of minigames it has. The characters as always are colorful and cool to be around with. Mikan and Fuyuhiko being my favorites. The other characters are great in their own right. 

The only negatives I can think of is the free roaming is still the same ol same ol from the previous with little things to do aside from interacting with the students, buying gifts for a said student or looking for monokumas. I really wish there were more things to do in such a colorful enivornment like an island. Maybe a few minigames that are only exclusive to free roaming and some of them in specific islands. But that's just me. 

The soundtrack as always is a killer to listen too despite some of them being reused from the first game and some new tracks. In conclusion Danganronpa 2 is a great game and a worthy sucessor to the first one with a very great story and characters. The class trials are a blast with variety of minigames. I recommend this game to anyone who loves mystery solving, visual novels and waifus.

和弹丸第一代差不多，强大而又有节奏的BGM和新奇的油画水彩画的画风，对话模式有改变，声效也是随着对话时而起伏，尤其是高潮时候= =这点和第一代也是一样，做的很用心！

【难度推荐最难！！】此游戏最大乐趣就是难度！！

新添了一些系统，貌似是善与恶的= =没仔细注意，休闲时间都撩妹去了，感觉地图比上代还麻烦，上代至少能大部分第一视角探索，这代也有，不过切换到像皮影人物在岛的边缘跑着有点接受不了。

剧情！这个是重点，本人刚打完第一章，用的最难难度。剧情比上代精彩，比上代还长。推理难度比上代难多了，我玩最难还挂了两次QWQQ新增反驳系统

怎么说，也是低成本游戏，卖点靠着剧情和推理，和上代也是一样，靠着剧情不断推进发展，带着脑子收集证据，配合剧情逐渐揭开真相！！说实话，难度真的比上一代难，上代第一章单纯收集证据辩论就过关。这代有干扰，还有反驳机制，还有引导假凶手的剧情，容易让人中招！！打完第一章花了我四个多小时，脑子不动的话根本过不去。

=========================================================

现在已经通关，难度最高，用了25小时QWQ，太难了。尤其是逻辑深入，还有言弹变多了，容易让人混乱。第六章，也就是最后一章。没想到BOSS还是江姐，江姐依旧辣么萌辣么可爱，最爱江姐=W=不愧超高中校级绝望！！

游戏关键词就异姓同名的“希望”和”绝望“最后一章槽点：日向居然是赛亚人2333（连续按A键，聚气爆发小宇宙2333变成超级赛亚人）这段笑死我了！黑白美变成魔法少女大雾对付巨人版江姐好燃！经费也爆炸！！

和上代一样也是好游戏，很好的推理游戏！！给好评！！

==================================================
PS：澪田唯吹就是轻音少女里的四位妹纸每个名字的一个字！！

这代很工口，相信米娜都见识过罪木妹纸的艺术摔跤！！七海妹纸和罪木妹纸是俺的！！

35520718.review:
Ohoho.
Questo si che è un gioco signori.
La storia è la stessa del gioco precedente [spoiler]una classe di ragazzi della prestigiosa Hope's Peak Accademy viene intrappolata in un luogo,che non è più la scuola come nel primo capitolo,ma su un'isola tropicale[/spoiler],ma il finale a parer mio è molto,ma molto meglio con [spoiler] il ritorno di vecchi personaggi del primo capitolo[/spoiler] ed è molto più emozionante,sotto ogni punto di vista.
Parlando di meccaniche ci sono nuovi minigiochi [spoiler]Logical Dive,Rebuttal Showdown,P.T.A(Panic Talk Action,che sostituisce il vecchio M.T.B) e l'aggiunta di un elemento nei mass debate del nuovo "Agree Point" [/spoiler] ma anche cose inerenti al mondo di gioco.
Potremo teletrasportarci su determinati punti della mappa e potremo vedere la posizione di ogni personaggio,rendendo più facile potergli parlare.
I personaggi come nello scorso gioco sono molto particolari,caratterialmente parlando.
Le possibilità sono due:
Un personaggio o lo adori o lo odi [spoiler] Komaeda sto guardando te [/spoiler].
La modalità principale ci farà scoprire tutta la storia e procedere durante gli omicidi,ma avanzando sbloccheremo nuove modalità come [spoiler]Magical Girl Miracle ★ Monomi,Danganronpa IF/Novel Mode e la Island Mode[/spoiler].
Le ost sono stupende,e potremo trovarne sia di nuove che di vecchie,con remix o meno.
Inoltre potremo raccogliere [spoiler] peluche di Monokuma [/spoiler] per ottenere MonoCoins,achievement o solo per collezionismo.
In definitiva,questo gioco sembra decisamente una versione migliorata dello scorso capitolo,solo con un'atmosfera meno "creepy" e "dark"

Voto Finale 10+/10


P.s
Consiglio da un giocatore che ha finito sia Goodbye Despair che Trigger Happy Havoc.
NON,E RIPETO,NON AFFEZIONATEVI AI PERSONAGGI A MENO CHE NON VOGLIATE SOFFRIRE.

35484972.review: It's good, but it needs more Chiaki

35463081.review:
Other rewrite

Danganronpa 2 is largely the same verse as the first. Plenty of things that applied to the old game in terms of being terrible apply to this one too. Aside from that, there's notable differences.

Pros:
1. There's actually one memorable case that's well written.
2. The (female) characters have more sex appeal this time around.
3. The game has two memorable and fun characters, pushing it from zero from the last title.
4. The characters become wittier this time around and actually contribute to the class trials besides asking the main character to solve the mystery for them. 
Cons:
1. Hajime's japanese voice sounds godawful.
2. The rest of the characters are so forgettable even the writers forgot they existed. See: the loli, the photographer girl, the swordgirl, and the survivors who weren't Hajime. I'd imagine all of their stories were written after they had an idea of the main plot and they couldn't fit them in without either killing them, having them kill someone else, or having them survive.
3. Plants the seed of the meta story that accounts for why Danganronpa 3 was so poorly written.
4. """"""""""""""""""""IMPROVED"""""""""""""""""""""" hangman's gambit

Other than that the plot is the same series of silly red herrings that are used to jab the audience. Sometimes they even spoil the plot for you in an obvious matter and expect you to never notice it: see the very start where everything looks like a computer simulation, clearly this entire game isn't inside of a computer or anything.
The red herrings I mention are: There's a doppelganger but he never does anything, pink-despair bear also does nothing other than arbitrarily open up access to the islands and act as comedic relief, the entirety of the second case's motivation is a red herring because the killer had absolutely nothing to do with it and the whole thing is never brought up again, not even when you actually get context behind the machine.

I guess there's also more gameplay stuff. Not like anyone cares. Not treading over previous ground:

1. "Improved" hangman's gambit: Actually the worst thing anyone could've ever created. An absolute cluster of garbage fills your screen and mashes into eachother while you can only hope the right letter appears and that you're spelling it correctly.

2. Cross-Swords Rebuttal or whatever it was called: Interesting for story purposes and actually takes a bit of thought to it.

3. Logic Dive: Breaks up the pace so Hajime can spend what seems like hours deducing a simple point.

Aside from the fact that it treads old ground with the way the plot is handled, the plot is also written in pretty much the same way on its key points. Normal guy goes to an ultimate highschool and then faints. Afterwards he meets some sidekick, but the sidekick won't be there because if you had a sidekick then you could actually trust somebody (the difference between 1 and 2 largely being that the sidekick doesn't die). There's then a super smart girl and a social pairah who basically write the entirety of the main plot with their existences (even after Nagito and Chiaki both kick the bucket, they're still writing the main plot with their actions. Literally the entire cast could be rewritten except for those two and Hajime and everything would be exactly the same as far as it's concerned.) Then you find out that your memory is erased (for 1)/why it's erased (for 2) because Junko (for both games) tells you that she wanted to cause more despair because she's a goddamn hypersue. A pointless argument persists where the protagonist tries to convince himself and all the others that living for hope isn't actually just a pointless gambit because everyone else is dead and our brains have been messed with. They win, Junko kills herself/gets delorted and everything ends before you're able to see what actually happens after your actions.

then you go watch the anime and do the same thing junko does

Of course, I'm not going to say that isn't a bit too generalized, but if you're trying to write a game that's supposed to sideline the player there shouldn't be so many obvious cliches that people can spot and predict the game about from a mile away. Other than that:
1. Most of the music still sucks and gives me a headache.
2. NISA translation means that even if you liked Danganronpa 2 buying this game only makes everything worse for everyone.
3. Most of one of the cases is spent in eye-searing land, where you will soon learn how to walk with the blind men.
4. The more the plot attempts to be funny the stupider and more cringeworthy it gets. japanese people can't into humor who knew

tl;dr Danganronpa 2 is too stuck up itself about being a meta commentary for Danganronpa that it forgets to actually make a good story in the process.

35364849.review:
Dangan Ronpa is a series notorious for spoilers. If you’re interested at all in the series, this means that you should definitely start with the first game. Dangan Ronpa 2 more or less is the same game as far as structure and mechanics, so it’s not anything like “The definitive Dangan Ronpa experience” or anything. However, if you’ve already played Dangan Ronpa 1 and are looking to see if this is worth it, well, like I said above, it’s more of the same in a way. So if you liked interacting with characters and going through the steps of investigating a murder and doing a class trial every chapter, then this is an easy buy. Things like the characters and murders may or may not be as good depending on how you feel, but you’re still getting the Dangan Ronpa experience from this one and a plot that hands you off into the next game. If you DIDN’T like Dangan Ronpa 1 and are wondering if this game is different enough for you, then I would say it isn’t and you might be better off without. 
Before I go into a bit more detail about the game that people who are super spoiler-sensitive may worry about, I think it’s important to note that each chapter took me ~7 hours (the Prologue took 2 hours), with the trials themselves taking 2 hours because I would let the narration play. I say, for remembering what happened during investigations, the best way to play is spend an hour or two exploring the new area and doing free time, then take a break, then return to do the rest of the chapter. Doing it all in one go was pretty draining after a while. Otherwise, the main game took me 39 hours to complete, with the post-game Dangan Island (to get all of the Hope Fragments) taking an additional 6 hours. It’s definitely not a small game.

As for the game itself, I’m going to not spoil any details here. However, if you’re rather not have a general idea of how the game and characters go, I understand. So if you’re pretty sure you want to play this yourself, I’d say you could stop here and get it. But if you want to know more, let me tell ya about the game by splitting it up into its main parts.
Characters: I would say that Dangan Ronpa 2 has a weaker character lineup than the first game. They aren’t bad by any means (in fact, Teruteru and Hiyoko are the only two that were below middling to me…but they were pretty far down there), but they suffer from two things. First, when they’re introduced, there seems to be a two-dimensional running gag with a good amount of them and it completely envelopes their character. Things like eating all the time, needing to shit, being overly wimpy, being a pervert, obsessing over another character, etc. I think the writers didn’t quite make them feel like actual humans with these quirks until it felt too late. At least by that point you get to understand who they actually are and get to like them, but it makes me wish they were like that since the beginning. It’s only a handful of character and the rest are actually really good, but when that handful starts talking it made me think, “This again, huh?” The other problem is that I feel like a good amount of character archetypes are shared from the cast in the first game (sporty girl, buff person, ruse dude, etc). It’s not THAT bad; you get to know the characters more and they feel more distinct. However, it’s still something you have to get over. Though, ultimately, it is really good that a lot of the characters end up moving up the rating scale the more they show up/you talk to them. I definitely recommend Dangan Island in the postgame for any Free Time dialogue you missed.
Environment: Dangan Ronpa 2 taking place on an open tropical island is a nice difference from the first game’s enclosed building. There are plenty of interesting areas that are great eye candy, plus they serve as good places for murder scenes and finding clues for said scenes. My main problem is that it feels like a wide-but-shallow sea. You visit a lot of the areas once and that’s it for literally the entire game. It felt like wasted potential a lot of time, but at the same time didn’t really hold the game back.
Motives: I’m not gonna say anything about the motives themselves, but I feel like they’re weaker than the first game’s. Dangan Ronpa 1 had pretty interesting motives where the reveal twist as to why the murderer did what they did made even the odder of motives believable (at least, from what I remember years ago). This one kinda felt like they either weren’t strong enough for murder or just were nonsensical. Motives per chapter aren’t really THAT big in the whole scheme of things. But if you’re like me and kinda looked forward to what dastardly thing Monokuma would pressure the cast with every time, I wouldn’t get your hopes up too much.
Murders and Trials: This game was very good about keeping you on your toes when figuring out what REALLY happened during a murder. After a point, you realize that anything is possible with the absurd things the murderers pulled off that, when explained by the end, actually ended up being believable. Granted, the class trials aren’t free of some outright stupid solutions that end up feeling like guess-and-check for some segments (and I found myself not looking too forward to minigames what weren’t Truth Bullets…especially Hangman’s Gambit…). However, it was fun looking over the clues before a trial, formulating what I think happened to cause that clue, then seeing if I was right and tweaking it with each new development until the real answer was clear. Also, the regenerating health perk really helped with letting me feel free to figure out the right answers, so I definitely recommend that.

I’d say Dangan Ronpa 2 is an enjoyable and lengthy experience, but it has some noticeable flaws as well. As far as being a Dangan Ronpa game, it excels in retaining the formula that works and having great murders and class trials that define the series. It stumbles somewhat with making a chunk of the characters interesting, but eventually they do end up growing on you. Despite being self-contained for the most part, the plot and its little mysteries about the character and island keep an added interest on top of the murders that have a huge payout in the end. So yeah, I’d say give it a go if you liked the first game (and be careful when looking things up for it)!
