32350478.review:
To be frank, I can't for the life of me comprehend why this game has so many positive reviews. I mean, maybe I'm not that qualified to give my opinion on this, because I was already not really a big fan of the first game; but even though the first one had quite a few flaws, like the ridiculous story and a few irritating characters, overall it was still enjoyable to me. The sequel on the other hand takes all these flaws and turns them up to eleven:

- The story and murder cases this time around are utterly retarded and nonsensical.

- While the first game had a desperate and isolated atmosphere, truly fitting for the overall theme of despair, everything in this game just feels so goofy, exaggerated and overblown, that I couldn't take half of it seriously. Oh, and expect lots and lots of 4th wall breaks and self referential humor. Gotta love those, right?

- Somehow they managed to make the minigames even more annoying and unintuitive.

- The various characters, arguably the heart of these games, are so much worse than its predecessor, that it's not even funny. They are way too over the top, to the point that they just become grating to deal with. It goes way beyond being one dimensional or stereotypical; you just can't imagine these lunatics ever existing or functioning in real life. Everyone is crazy, everyone has a messed up past and strange values. One person is a glutton, she will think about nothing but food even in life and death situations. One character is sad someone turned out to be a murderer, the next moment she happily forgives him and recites the catchphrase of this game: "We gotta do our best, for his sake!" It all just feels so artificial.  It's a flaw a lot of japanese media has IMO: style over substance.
Even if you bother to spend time with them, some character may reveal a superficial character flaw after a while, wich will never be brought up again and doesn't really matter. Oh, but you get their underwear as a reward. Aren't you glad you wasted time on this?

- The characters motivations for doing stuff and especially their motives for commiting murder dont make any lick of sense half of the time, which doesn't really help with endearing them to the player. It's probably not a good sign, that, while I was often saddened by the death of characters in the first game, I couldn't care less when someone died in this game. On the contrary, most of the time I was glad when someone finally bites the dust.
It's fair to say I was pretty much on Monokuma's side the whole time.

-As for positive things: music is still enjoyable, graphics are alright and I encountered no bugs or glitches while playing.

Damn, that turned out longer than I wanted. So in conclusion, if you are like me and already had to massively strain your suspension of disbelief and tolerance for anime tropes during the first game, especially in regards to characters and story, avoid this one. Seriously, it feels like a different dev-team worked on this game. If you don't give a crap about this, get it on a sale, because that price is ridiculous for a VN.

七海真是可爱又善良，游戏中还给玩家提供了大量帮助，perfect girl

没玩过弹丸系列的新玩家也可以享受剧情和推理
针对弹丸系列的整体感觉：弹丸系列最吸引人的还是学级裁判的游戏系统和自相残杀的基本设定。在裁判时手脑并用，舌战群雄，抽丝剥茧，解决一个个案件后越来越接近真相的过程是弹丸的最亮点。希望学园系列的世界观，关于希望与绝望的战争，反而处理的并不是多么高明，有很多逻辑上的硬伤和不现实，这也是大家对待游戏原作和改编动漫的态度截然不同的原因。大家看动漫时因为缺失了参与的过程而是全程旁观，会把注意力集中在剧情发展上，就更容易挑剔弹丸系列世界观的不真实。黑幕明明在现实中如此成功，动漫里又没有什么铺垫说明ta绝望的原因，这实在令人不解。16年的未来篇和绝望篇同样有些让人无法接受的设定，让人怀疑弹丸世界的人全是些白痴又乐天的理想主义者。不过在游戏中，这些并非大问题，游戏性上弹丸是顶级的视觉小说作品。此外，弹丸系列的音乐非常赞，人设又可爱，这大概是人气超过极限脱出系列的主因吧。

31990438.review:
Incroyable.

Je ne connaissais pas le genre Visual Novel. Je me disais que se fader des heures et des heures de textes était forcément chiant, que j'avais passé l'age du manga japoniais, que de toute façon ce n'est que du fan service et jamais je ne succomberais à ça.

Et j'ai été foudroyé.

Une pépite, un joyau, un tour de force, un chef d'oeuvre.

Abandonnez vos préjugés et ouvrez votre coeur, et surtout votre cerveau, à DanganRonpa.

Pour cerner un peu la chose, c'est un mix de Phoneix Wright (pour les phases investigation et procès), de huis clos à la Battle Royale, pitché autour d'un jeu de survie à la Saw (le coté malsain en moins), le tout emballé dans une ambiance complètement chtarbée et WTF. L'expérience proposée est parfaitement unique.

C'est intelligent, tordu, bien écrit, loufoque sans etre grotesque. Les énigmes sont brillantes et vous bousilleront le cerveau, c'est garanti.

Il n'y a pas points négatifs, si ce n'est de maitriser l'anglais, et d'accepter qu'il n'existe pas de machine à faire oublier ce jeu pour pouvoir le refaire encore et encore.

31966240.review:
It is possible to enjoy this game without playing the first, but there are some plot points that will probably make more sense or hold more significance if you play the first one.

If you enjoyed the first game you will probably enjoy this game as well. It has the same dark bizarre humor and over the top characters, and clever murders. Although honestly I found the humor could be a little obnoxious at times as opposed to bizarely amusing, which wasn't a problem I had with the first game. 
The gameplay adds a couple new elements, but gameplay is still obviously not the main point of the game, the main draw is solving the murders, particularly putting together small clues to form the whole picture, and of course, plot twists! There are very clever and intriguing mysteries in this game, and a couple I didn't even begin to figure out until the middle of the class trial

There are two main criticisms I have with this game, 1. There were a couple times where I knew the answer or clue I needed to trigger the next section of a trial, but the wording sequence needed in game was very counter intuitive. There were definetly times where the trial mini games just felt like chores

2. This was a criticism I also had for the first game: You can build relationships with characters, but those relationships don't matter. They don't make any difference when it came to the trials or the overall plot. It would have added so much more depth to the game and the characters if characters could decide to help or hinder your clue gathering based on how close you were to them. I was very disapointed that the developers chose not to add any more depth to this part of the game

Overall I enjoyed Danganronpa 2, and if you enjoy mysteries and story driven games with very morbid off the wall humor, you likely will too

31945295.review:
Though I do not currently own Trigger Happy Havoc, I watched both the gameplay and the anime version. As expected, the game was better. A little fast paced, but it was not like how the anime rushed it. With this in mind, I was curious on what more there was of the series. Low and behold, I found the sequel. Honestly, I lowered my expectations when I purchased it. I considered the sequel may be inconsistent to the storyline, become dull in comparison to the first game, and I would chuck it in my library to never see the light of day, buried alongside a handful of visual novels covered by my crippling disappointment.

Holy crap, was I wrong about that assumption. 

This was actually a really awesome game. I was beside myself by how invigorating all the concepts and development turned out to be. I wondered if the characters would be watered down by the large casting, but there was honestly a lot of thought put behind them. They had minor roles, but not enough to not make them at least somewhat interesting. Each had a quirk of their own, making them all lovable.

Oh, and did I mention there is a Yakuza boss with a Napoleon Complex?

... That's just hilarious. XD

Here's a quick rundown of what to expect:

~Story mode~

Consists of:
-Doki doki moments
-You're on a beach! Splash around to your heart's content! (Wtf?)
-The talking maniacal teddy bear returns
-Double the trouble with a fluffy version of that maniacal bear
-Fuyuhiko Kuzuryuu
-Moments when everyone questions their sanity
-In turn, you question your own sanity on purchasing the sequel. You wonder why you would ever think the story could not become more traumatizing. Was it worth paying this much-Hey, midget yakuza boss. Cool. 
-Fuyuhiko Kuzuryuu

~Free Time~

Consists of: 
-Quality time with the husbando or waifu of your choice
-Cheating is not applicable
-Obtain your own harem as fast as possible
-Don't leave behind your personal Fuyuhiko Kuzuryuu
-Hope your waifus don't end their laifus
-You have the opportunity to create beautiful bromances with the men of your choice
-Put on your yaoi goggles for one choice in particular...
-It's basically Pokemon: We "gotta catch 'em all"

~Trial Mode~

Consists of: 
-Epic rip off "Objections" like the first game
-Interesting mechanics with ear splitting gunshots
-Constant argumentative characters all up in your grill
-Fuyuhiko Kuzuryuu will be the most notable nemesis
-You will be overwhelmed by the "tsun tsun" train of Fuyuhiko Kuzuryuu
-Fuyuhiko Kuzuryuu achieves the title of "most consistent pain in the ass edgelord"
-You will find this strangely endearing
-If all else fails, find ways to counteract characters being all up in your grill
-You can play Hangman
-Surf the deep web of your mind
-Hysterical teens
-Rainbow button mashing while 1v1ing hysterical teens
-Feel like you're taking a trip through Caramelldansen town all over again

Husbando/Waifu potential? Are they worth it?

Abso~freaking~lutely. Now throw away those body pillows, you weebs! This is going to be one hell of a trip filled with hysteria, epic storytelling, and most importantly

... Fanservice *_*

31840928.review:
;This game keeps the charm and good writing from the first, but makes use of it a lot more. To the point where Monokuma gives huge spoilers to the first game, and pokes fun at it being cheap that the reveal was saved until the final moment.
;Compared to the first, characters are way more fleshed out.  I actually found myself liking everyone in this game, and relating to a lot of aspects of each of them. (Especially Nekomaru's obsession with shitting.)
;There's a lot more humour in this one, which makes the sad moments much more sad (but that's also thanks to better writing too).
;The story overall is pretty much the first game but on an island, and with a new protagonist as well. The traitor reveal was heart-wrenching, especially learning the events of the Danganronpa 3 Anime shortly after. But, there is also another plot twist in the ending that made me facepalm, though a little less than the first game thanks to being prepared for something cheap like that but also it just not being as bad.
;The trials are better, having more gameplay styles and a lot more to look forward to when it does come trial time. Older elements have been improved and the new additions are pretty well implemented.
;Killings and investigations are vastly more interesting than the first, creating scenarios that are a lot more creative than the first (and as a result, a little more of a challenge to figure out.).
;Free Time is pretty much the same, and this is actually pretty fine.
;Island Mode is like School Mode, but with a lot easier of a premise to grasp. More believable because it actually follows the plot this time instead of breaking the fourth wall constantly. Pretty much the same crafting and seaching game and the same great character building through Hanging Out and Trip Tickets.
;Monomi's Adventure Supreme can go fuck itself, the sidegame itself is pretty lackluster and I was so unhappy having to spend about 5 hours unlocking all the items for 100%ing it. They're all random drops and you have to rely on pure luck for that shit to go faster.
;Finding the secret events was difficult, and finding the secret monokumas were also pretty difficult (there was only one I had to google, the one in the hospital room).

I'd recommend playing the game through, maybe gathering all the hope fragments and possibly beating Island Mode if you like the game. 100%'ing the game becomes boring and borderline frustrating. However, the base game is very solid and I'd probably even play it through again in the future. There is also Danganronpa Another Episode, as well as the Danganronpa 3 and 2.5 Anime series which I almost instantly watched as soon as I knew it even existed in the first place. I didn't expect for this game and DR1 to kickstart my love for this franchise, because I wasn't actually aware of how much I'd be into it. So I would recommend this game if you played the first and liked that, and would recommend this if you want to give it a shot too. It's worth it, but possibly not if you dislike the first game. It might be a VN, but it's not a bad VN, and actually tries with it's gameplay.

31656139.review:
Tl;Dr at the bottom.

God damn this game was a blast to play, gorgeous art, great soundtrack, better writing, far better ending and more importantly a lot of issues I had with the first are fixed in this... however it also creates its own set of problems which I'll talk about in a bit. Lets go in order of how I structured my review of the first game.

The Good - 

First the art. I praised the first game for its artstyle in the sense that its a single setting but no two rooms looked alike (despite the class-rooms of course), so given a setting like multiple ISLANDS to explore you'd expect even better right? Damn right, and damn right did they deliver. Each island has a theme to follow and the express each theme beautifully. For real, this is probably one of the best anime styled games to look at out there, for its pop-up book artistic style matched with all the vibrant colours and props, every island and area was a joy to look at.

The story was something I both loved and hated with the first game, and its a similar love hate relationship with this. However, the story is FAR superior to the first with only a few flaws in comparison. For starters, the writing is so much more well polished. Its not perfect, but its much more solid. Nothing feels overly stupid which the first did a lot, so thank god for that. More importantly though the ending actually felt satisfying. The big problem with the first game was not only was it poorly written but the ending felt sudden, rushed and unfinished. Even after finishing the second game we STILL don't know what truly happened after the first, some more questions have been answered sure but at the same time even more question arose. But thats the first games problems not the second. The second game did truly have a satisfying ending to the point you wouldn't mind it ending there all together. But because of Ultra Despair Girls and the Danganronpa 3 anime we know that doesn't happen.

Again, the Voice acting in this game for the most part is great, you still have your irritable voices but go figure, its anime its gotta happen. However two big issues arise in this game compared to the first. Why can none of these voice actors do good crying? Every time someone cries in this game I wanna pull my hair out. This could come under the issues with writing but... the other problem I had was when a Blackend was found out, a fir portion of them had accent/personality shifts which became really dull after the second time it happened. 

The soundtrack again is great, there was a fair few reused tracks which is disappointing but all the original music was great.

Gameplay wise... comes my biggest issues with the second game, but the positives are that exploring didn't feel like a chore anymore. The awkward first person stiff controls of the first game are still here but they aren't used nearly as much. Instead they opted for a 2D scrolling style exploration of the islands which felt much more fluid. The free-time events are still present although they felt a tad bit longer in this which kinda dragged out after having 4+ free-times in succession. This time around you also get mini objectives like finding hidden Monokuma's throughout the island... more to explain in the cons. You also get a Tamagochi style pet which after caring for it will reward you with currency and gifts for the other students and even a skill used in trials. The Trials this time around, while following the same basic format are... interesting, you still have your non-stop debates, panic talk actions and final arguments but a couple new additions made it... less enjoyable.

The Bad -

The story for the most-part as I said was a huge improvement over the last. However its the investigation before the final trial that really killed it for me. Its long, there is a TON of info you need to absorb and overall you kind of shut out only skimming over the text because it became a chore. Other than that, its was pretty decent.

I said In my last review the characters were generic and stereotypical of their 'Ultimate Talents' and I said how from what little I knew of this game the problem would still persist. I wasn't wrong. While the characters certainly have more personality in this game compared to the first game again, you had generic looks for what their talent was. I also said how some characters took too much inspiration from the first game. Again, I wasn't wrong, A good portion of characters shared the same characteristics with characters from the first, though a couple had good reasons. Though props to the writers for having a female 'Ultimate Gamer', nice break from the norm. 

Now the gameplay. The Hidden Monokuma's I mentioned earlier? Yeah there are 30 of them. Again not a probelm. Wanna know something though? YOU ARE NOT REWARDED FOR GETTING THEM ALL. No Skills, No hidden story, No Hidden CG, NOTHING. Its such a waste of time and potential it makes you wonder why they bothered. Now, the class trials were butchered in this game. The standard features and writing were still solid don't get me wrong. But two things nearly ruined it for me. Hangmans Gambit and Logic Drive. Christ what made them think this was a good idea. While yes I complained Hangman's Gambit was far too easy in the first game and its difficulty is improved in the second for sure, but the mini-game itself is an absolute bore and a complete mess as well as being literally UNFAIR at times making some letters IMPOSSIBLE to avoid clashing. I wanted HG to change, but I wanted it to be fun, not a cheat. The new Rebuttal showdown... its definitely the best of the new modes and I would even go as far to say it should have fully replaced Panic Talk Action (which yes still suck). But the game didn't do the best job in explaining how it works and all around just felt clunky, not terrible, but still a pain. And Logic Drive, oh boy where do I start. Its basically a Q&A with a Third-Person... Skating? Segment in a cylindrical tube. Your forced to avoid objects, jump gaps all to get to a checkpoint where you answer a question which even makes the Hangmans Gambit from the first game look difficult. If there was ever a mini-game that felt out of place it was logic drive, easily the worst mistake they made with this game. 

And yes, still hate the pink blood but sometimes there is red blood nonsense.

Tl;Dr, the game still suffers from some annoyances, but I think we all come to expect games to have those. But overall it is a much stronger entry in the series compared to the first and I highly recommend playing it if you haven't already.

31440998.review:
弹丸系列，曾经被称为扛起新时代推理解密游戏大旗的游戏，而2代更是弹丸系列的巅峰。移植到pc后我又入了，虽然psp坏掉的存档让我心疼好久……

虽然很多人被3的TV版恶心到，但是抛开了TV来看2代游戏，还是相当优秀的啊。所以如果纯冲着游戏和剧情而入，还是很值的。而且，2代没有TV啊！里面有那么多福利！那么多软妹！！怎么能错过呢！（尤其是七海小天使！！）

———兔———美———老————师———分———割———线———

关于剧情：延续一代希望和绝望的战争，这回舞台是在贾巴沃克岛，一个南国的小岛。然而，原本是愉快的校外教学旅行，结果，主角日向创一行人被迫展开自相残杀的游戏（通关后依然可以在爱岛模式体(gong)验(lue)原来的模式）。每一章的搜查，每一章的案件比起一代更加精彩，而且各种小系统的加入，可玩性高了很多（黄段子和玩梗也多了很多）。

玩到后期，你会发现希望和未来不是那么简单，绝望，也不是那么单纯的恶质boss。到底谁才是代表未来的希望？谁又是绝望？只能靠玩家自己去搜查，去发现了。

关于推理和解谜：在搜索完所有线索才能展开学级裁判，对于刚接触的人来说还是很亲切的。还有字谜、逻辑潜入、机关枪论战、高潮推理等等精彩的小游戏，只是，我很想吐槽，键鼠玩反驳论战有时候好反人类啊！！

尼玛，控制方向不好控就算了，键盘总是不小心多划一下，就不能过了！简直吐血。逻辑潜入倒是用键鼠好控制得多。另外，在推理过程中，七海的话要听进去，狛枝的话挑着听或者反着听，就行了（笑）。

不过，第五章的案件真心超神，而且处刑伤透无数玩家的心，不知道多少人跟我抱怨说以后不想玩俄罗斯方块了。

关于音乐&画面：虽然纸片人有点寒碜，但是，音乐也是超神级别的。各种风格切换自如，甚至还有调皮的电子音，第六章的bgm真好玩好想调戏。
还有各种隐藏剧情和CG，不管是男性玩家还是女性玩家都能看到福利，以及各种过场动画，让人忍不住就打完这一章啊。

所以在我心目中，综合评分9.5/10。

不说了，我要继续刷全成就和爱岛了。

（神座姐姐prprpr七海小天使prprpr）

——但是千言万语凝聚成一句话就够：

游戏好玩，小高上天。

31394015.review:
단간론파 1을 구매하면서 자연스레 번들로 구매하게 된 작품입니다.
1의 우울했던 시작 분위기와는 달리 꽤 발랄한 분위기로 시작합니다.
배경 역시 학교가 아닌 남국의 휴양지 섬과 같은 공간입니다.
이번에도 낯선 공간에 초면의 상태로 모인 초고교급 학생들이 있습니다.
1의 주인공들과 닮은 듯 닮지 않은 이번에도 개성 넘치는 매력적인 친구들입니다.
그리고 여전히 낯선 곳에서도 비현실적인 살인게임은 시작됩니다.

팬덤 내에서 슈단(슈퍼 단간론파)라는 명칭으로 불리는 이 작품은
전편에 비해서 더욱 비현실적이고, 동화같은 연출이 더 많이 등장하며,
그런 비현실적인 서사 속에서도 살인을 저지르는 계기와 동기들은 전편에 비해
더욱 세밀하고 현실적으로 묘사되어 있습니다.

또한 재판에서는 로직 다이브와 같은 새로운 액션 요소들이 추가 되어,
더욱 다양한 연출과 서사를 만나실 수 있습니다.
(개인적으로는 이 액션 요소의 난이도가 꽤나 높다고 생각했습니다;;
어쩌면 추리보다 더 어려울 수도... 범인을 알고 있는데도 곰손이라 밝힐수 없는 슬픔)

그리고 1편에서 차마 다 서술되지 못했던 '키보가미네 학원 사상 최악의 사건'과
'인류 사상 최악의 사건' 등의 이야기도 등장합니다. 단간2만으로도 사실 이해가 조금 어려울 수 있지만,
단간 2를 플레이하시고 애니메이션 단간론파 3을 보신다면 확실히 이해하실 수 있습니다.
또한 단간론파1에서 등장했던 요소들이 스토리의 중요요소로 등장하며 반가움을 느낄 수 있습니다.

희망과 절망, 그 속에서 다시금 희망을 피워내는 새로운 주인공과
반가운 얼굴들을 마주하며, 즐겁게 플레이 하시길 바랍니다.

    再说说最后一章。这个最后一章简直就是整个游戏的败笔，又长又臭，说起中二台词来就不带完的，人物情绪变化多端，忽然绝望，忽然希望，强行绝望，强行希望，[b] 真鸡巴扯！	[/b]
    当然优点还是有的，可爱的女孩子变多了，上一作我感兴趣的妹子只有两个，这一作加到了六个，有进步。

31322469.review:
额，作为一个弹丸的老粉，在steam上看到弹丸很高兴，价格也不贵。
又重玩一遍， 虽然距离上一次玩的时间比较久，但玩的感觉总体不错，情节上具有较好的推理性，小高做的游戏剧本还是蛮不错的。
相对于弹丸一，弹丸二的学级裁判系统性与可玩性上有很大进步，新加入的玩法也使这款游戏的动作性有所加强；
人物上设计理念与弹丸一一脉相承，随着游戏的深入，其实你会发现这些形象与人物性格十分契合[spoiler]（PS：索尼娅的某些立绘其实转化的有点生硬，不过可能就是要做出这种效果）[/spoiler]；
主角上，[spoiler]呆毛依旧（笑~~）[/spoiler]；
该作剧情对话中有不少[spoiler]黄段子[/spoiler]，第一次玩可能会有些不适（其实也没什么），请做好心理准备；
更多的请自己去体验。。。
因为比较重要，所以说三遍，这是一款动作推理游戏，这是一款动作推理游戏，这是一款动作推理游戏！
如果你追求动作的话，强烈建议买手柄，模拟器键盘操作的话动作性大幅降低（虽然逻辑深潜还是比较难玩QAQ），即使是欺负人模式下难度也不是太大，如果追求高难度，高体验性，建议买手柄！
不足，中文翻译的很多地方出现问题，不论译名改变，在很多篇章人物名会变成重复的单字（而且好像不同篇章出现的字不同Orz），这个bug需要修复；
系统某些时候（未知）会出现迷之卡屏（应该不是我电脑的问题），相似情况可参照Linux下播放需解码视频（使用开源解码器），
额，对游戏体验影响倒是不大，但可能影响心情。
其他下次再说。。。

31295809.review: i just died from the cringe

31293663.review:
第一想吐槽的是剧情
第二想吐槽的就是……在岛内横板移动好粗糙……感觉像是flash小游戏
玩的时候还一直安慰自己这是特别风格，是一种艺术……现在想想根本就是4399风格……
还有那几个放大到失真的黑白兽，我不明白这里为什么做的这么粗糙，仅仅是放大了图片，还失真了。感觉没有用心


游戏性的话
破案的感觉是有的，揭开谜题的感觉也很棒，这是真的
学级裁判新增加那些小游戏，用言刃那个还不错，有动作推理的感觉。新的拼字游戏也行。
思维潜入滑滑板真的好无聊，太墨迹了，只是躲障碍物，没有丝毫爽快感。和蜗牛竞速比差远了



剧情……
那些案件设计的有些确实比较巧妙，尤其最后那个狛枝的案件，真的是意料之外情理之中的惊奇
但是这游戏讲的故事我真的是无语
下面是有剧透成分了
[spoiler]也不知道他们怎么做出的杀人决定。动机设计的很随便。我个人感觉就是，编剧随便挑了两个人出来，然后再编好作案手法，就完事了。也不管为什么这人想杀人，为什么那个人会被杀。
不像弹丸论破1，杀人有很强烈的动机。
边古山为什么要杀人我理解不了。按黑白熊那个游戏，怎么想也应该是小泉杀九头龙才对呀，然后小泉那么善良绝对不会杀人，最后事情就这么解决掉呀。结果变成现在这样，莫名其妙。还有那个球棒。。。看到少爷在吵架就瞬间变出了一个球棒吗……构思犯罪计划一气呵成，真是杀手中的豪杰。
罪木就突然被恢复记忆，然后三个我挺喜欢的妹子就这样死掉了，我也接受不了。这么随便就能控制记忆，还要这么麻烦干嘛，把苗木他们引进来之后直接洗脑剩下那五个人呗，不就能顺利毕业，实现人类江之岛化
罪木知道被日寄子发现之后，瞬间就能到她背后干掉她吗……日寄子就不能跑两步、喊两声或者写几个数字当作信息吗……就这么因为巧合而死，她去那里的理由还那么令人感伤（因为小泉死了没人给她穿和服，为了学会自己穿才去那里照镜子）……  真的很烦啊

最后主角莫名其妙就开启风纪委员那种热血模式……贼尼玛热血就通关了。
boss只靠热血和嘴炮就能干掉，太那啥了吧
害死那么多可爱的角色，结果最后剧本说你该死了，然后你就死了。这感觉就像对待一个战犯，不处决他，反而让他寿终正寝。
什么嘛。
合着2代里这帮可爱又迷人的反派角色们就是帮弃子，要不就是江之岛计谋得逞，他们变成江之岛出去，要不就是苗木诚计谋得逞，他们和江之岛一起被抹杀掉。绝望，真他娘的绝望啊。
死的毫无意义。
不如苗木你们别进这程序来了，直接电脑插头一拔就完事了。

[/spoiler]

总之，剧情给我这样很生硬的感觉。

从来没写过评测，清明节玩了两整天玩通关，结果到现在嘴里的屎味还是回味无穷。所以还是写了很主观的评测
找不到好评的理由。

31275732.review:
居然38小时就完成了！！！开心！[spoiler] 虽然因为不是很喜欢二代众所以基本全程是Ctrl键全程加速，除了苗木小天使出场的时候，我耐心听完他说完了话，然后继续加速...	[/spoiler]
[h1] 关于成就	[/h1]
社区里有中文的指南，很全，基本上照着来就没问题了，除了几个小小的地方。
一个是隐藏CG有两个在第三章Day2的，我是完成了第一个后手贱保了存之后才继续下一个.....结果又重新玩了一遍第三章开头....
另外一个是黑白美的全装备收集成就，可以看下社区里那个Full 100% Achievement Guide，里面详细的说明的装备在那个关卡，用什么难度刷，我就是对着这个一个一个找，找到最后几个在哪里，然后不停的刷，就刷完了....终于...刷完了，都快吐了....破烂成就，和养宠物，到等级99和走路成就一样无聊又浪费时间...[spoiler] 而且，每个的最后一个简直了！！！“希望”的装备果然是最厉害的一个，而且名字合在一起是“七海千秋”，详情里面分别是我诚哥（不愧是【超高校级的希望】，是法杖啊！），雾切同学和十神[/spoiler]，终于能理解为什么黑白美每次打完黑白兽以后受的伤越来越多，后来满头都是血...那都是我们吐出来的啊...我终于理解您了，黑白美老师！
海岛模式里，希望碎片和刷好感度是分开的，用外出券并不会得到碎片，不过外出首选是沙滩啊，大部分人都是这里最佳，刷好感度和碎片，照着指南里的图片来就行了。
[h1] 关于游戏	[/h1]
2代玩法更多，加上了1代没有逻辑潜入，赞同系统，激辩也不太一样了，果然每一代都会进步，杂音的吐槽也很犀利啊。而且，我玩完了还记得旁白的玩法解说里的一句话，叫我体验真正的绝望....真是醉了...
第五章以后感觉我的电脑就像是出现了问题一样，第六章更是厉害，Bug满天飞啊，厉害啊，而且地图和1代一样，我都可以背下来了，虽然加上了Bug滤镜，但是依旧是那熟悉的宿舍，而且还出现了熟悉的人，话说你们直接把1代的人物直接照搬过来，一点没有改真的好会偷懒啊，动作啥的都是1里见过的，好歹换身衣服啊。
[h1] 关于剧情	[/h1]
2代在1代的基础上完善了整个世界观，解释了“史上最大最糟糕的绝望事件”，“预备科事件”等等一系列的事件，居然是2代引起的....那个胖胖的十神同学吓了我一跳....话说这个别人认不出来真是见了鬼了吧...而苗木小天使又有戏份了，不愧是真主角，玩到第六章以后，我就一直在等。果然，一出场我就快原地爆炸了！居然！！居然！加入了未来机关！！！！变得可厉害了！！又帅！又高（？？）！！最后的穿正装好帅！[spoiler]而在3的希望篇里更帅！可惜最后一集当了一把假主角...被二代抢了风头，[/spoiler]好像有点跑题，毕竟这里是2代专场，不过依旧是1代小天使最棒！其实我还挺希望看见狛枝和苗木的对手戏啊，希望厨和希望的会面，CV又都是一个人，结果在3里面也就几句话....失望啊。
要补的好像还有很多，绝对绝望少女我估计是不会买的吧...但是剧情貌似还挺重要的，我得去B站找找，然后基本上都知道了。

31258627.review:
My personal recommendation, if you liked the first game is to just avoid this sequel. DR2: GD goes a bit too far on the silly side, the game suffers from arbitrarily complex and overly complicated trials. As a continuation of the previous game's story it's dreadful. 

However, the characters are more likable and better written (except [spoiler]the queen of despair herself, who unfortunately traded in her wacky split-personality humour for lame jokes about how her jugs are big in this installment[/spoiler]), and despite what I've said before about the complicated trials, the developers got a bit more creative with the motivations compared to the previous game. Gameplay wise it's more of the same as the previous game, there's slight differences but nothing major. Overall it's a sequel that everyone seems to like over the first game despite that it retreads old ground and has a plot that would of fared better if it was it's own thing and wasn't a continuation of the first game.

Also, [spoiler]Chapter 3 is garbage, that whole case is full of holes I'm sure of it[/spoiler]

31181009.review:
Danganronpa 2 improves much of DR1's problems while still inheriting some of its flaws. WIthout spoiling too much, the game is structurally similar to DR1 in its premise and execution, but with quite a few differences in the details.

The first difference is an improvement in characters. Characters are much less one-note in this game.They are heavily-defined by their talents, but those talents are a small part of the characters and their back stories. If I do have one critique, there seems to be an over-reliance on sexual assault as a comedic plot device, as I've not finished every character's arc, but two of the handful I've done already have some form of (serious) sexual assault against them played up as really unfitting comedy.

Much like DR1's localization, DR2's localization has some issues. It feels like it's worse in the beginning, but there are a lot of just really weird dialogue moments that have some pretty unnatural sounding speech. It's not a deal-breaker, but I hope they continue to improve upon moving the game from East to West, as there are many more moments in this game where I felt like the localization team made some good strides in translating a character to Western audiences, and I hope to see them improve with each iteration.

The problem with the game's writing, much like DR1, comes at the end. I've got to say that the ending plot sequences are just the worst kind of anime crap. They are cringey, and throw in so many "plot twists" that the mystery sections they make you solve are nonsensical and and just end up tainting the better parts of the story.

The gameplay itself is quite similar to DR1. You get free time to spend with characters and do some side activities to pick up presents. There's a mini-game now also that lets you use up un-wanted presents to get bonuses, which is a welcome feature. Eventually, someone will get murdered, you'll have to find every clue, and then start a class trial, using logic and mini-games to solve the mystery. The mini-games are a mixed bag. Some like, the truth bullet system from the first game are alright, but others are a miss. 

I'm especially not fond of the Panic Talk Action, which simulates you trying to shout through an opponent's flimsy defenses by winning a rhythm game. Unfortunately, there seems to be no actual sense to the rhythm as it doesn't really mesh up with any sort of tempo in the song, and seems to be more of a visual thing, which is incredibly distracting and hard to pull off without a power-up the game eventually throws you later in the story that almost completely breaks this. It's like the developers knew it was poorly implemented. Beyond that, there's a clunky snowboarding-esque minigame called Logic Dive that's a mixture of boring and badly made, but I didn't find too many other mini-games too offensive. 

The mysteries themselves are part of the main appeal for me as I enjoy games like Phoenix Wright, and the only complaint I have is that the last trial, like in DR1 is a sort of plot deconstruction one where it feels like you have a dozen clues that are the exact same thing and the challenge is trying to figure out what the hell the developer's logic for the answers are.

Beyond the main campaign, there are some bonus modes. One of them is kind of like this task simulator that's mostly there to give you a chance to max out character arcs of characters who may have died too early in the main game or you just didn't get around to finishing. The other is a manga detailing events of the first game, and the other is a pretty boring and bad arcade action-adventure thing that gold old really quickly.

Despite those complaints, I really do enjoy DR2. Its story up until the end is engaging, the mysteries are creative, the characters are largely much improved over DR1, and I didn't spend 30 hours plowing through this over a few days for no reason.

31069925.review:
Where do I begin?

Personally, I think this game is a masterpiece. After watching Danganronpa The Animation and got into this crazy fandom, I thought it was aight. But after seeing the games for the first time, I was simply blown away. Unfortunately, I didn't get the joy of playing it blind since I watched a playthrough of DR2 before I played it (NicoB, btw). But the fact that I got so many good reactions out of just sitting and watching sold me on this game and instantly made it my favourite.

Enough backstory tho. Let's talk about the things that this game does well.

-Characters-

For a game where you know way more than half the characters are gonna die, the characters here are really well made. I will admit, some more so than others. Now I could spend hours talking about all the characters and why I love or hate them, but for the sake of your potential uninterest, I won't. We'll cover this quickly.

The character variety in this game is pretty damn neat. There are some easy to love, and some easy to hate, and some you're not quite sure. And although there is only one character here that I hate, that's not a bad thing at all. I don't hate him because I think he's a bad character. Far from it. I hate him because his character was designed to be hateable. This goes to show that they did a good job at making this character. But at the same time, I know a lot of people who love him, so there's a lot of different ways that you can interpret each character, which I think is really nice and it helps keep the fandom alive. Of course no one's gonna agree. My favourite might be someone else's hated Mary Sue. And of course you won't get to know each character fully in the main story because they'll die before you get to. Luckily, there's a bonus mode after you complete the main story that lets you do so. And, trust me, you'll most likely get very attached to at least one of them. Just hope that they don't end up dead.

-Plot-

Much like the first game, the plot in this game rarely, if not ever fails to go into the perfect amount of detail. And at the same time, it leaves a lot of mystery. It's a really good balance of the two. This doesn't just go for the overall plot, but for each individual trial too. Admittedly, some have more questions left to answer than others, but that doesn't mean any of them are bad. 

As for the overall plot, everything just seems to fit together so well, and that includes some details from the first game. It truly succeeds as a sequel by developing the series more and more with each chapter, and bringing it all together for what would have to be my favourite finale in any video game. And yet there's still more. But let's not get off track by talking about the other games.

-Challenge-

Now, if we're talking about this like it's an action game, I can't say that it has a huge difficulty level...or even a relatively high one for that matter. Rather than being challenging on the hands controlling it, it's challenging on the mind. It took me a while to figure out some of the solutions to some of the cases, but the feeling of satisfaction when you finally get it is awesome. There are a few minigames that require some action gameplay, and they can get quite difficult. Sometimes not because it's meant to be. But I'm not gonna sit here and tell you that this game is flawless. Luckily, you can set difficulty between 3 levels with both action and logic.

-Follow Up-

As I've already said, this game really succeeds as a sequel. I feel like it does almost everything better than the first game. The plot is more interesting, the characters are better, the trials are longer and more engaging, etc. Although this is the case, it is really worth playing the first game first if you're worried about spoilers. 

-Waifus-

Okay, let's be real for a second. This game...no, this series as a whole has some great fuckin' waifus. Like oh my god. Like I can name 5, maybe 6 from this game alone. Sure, it's a silly point to make and coud've easily gone in the Characters section, but my bebs deserve more.

Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair is my favourite game of all time as of right now. And I don't think I'll be finding anything better any time soon. This game will keep you occupied for hours whether you're just in it for the plot or if you're an achievement hunter.
And as I've said, it's not perfect. I definitely has flaws. But the good points outnumber the bad points by a landslide.
For £23, this game is definitely worth the purchase, and that's true for whatever currency you might be using too.

10/10
Would murder my friends again.

Chiaki is best girl, don't argue.

先ほどクリアしました。
１を直前でクリアしていたので、１ほどのインパクトは薄れていましたが、後半の怒涛の展開に一気に飲み込まれてしまいました。推理物って、ラストになると大体先が読めてくるのに、このダンガンロンパはラストになっても先が読めません。常に緊張感があり、何が起こっているのか先を知りたく止め時がありません。
特に今回のダンガンロンパは、後半戦で愛（？）と切なさを感じる展開となり、より感情移入します。１であれだけのストーリーを書き上げながら、更にここまでの話を作り上げたスタッフにはホントに脱帽です。
直近で、ゲームの世界観にこれほど感情移入したのは、ウィッチャー３以来です（発売はダンガンロンパの方が先ですけどね）。
真の名作とは、ここまで人をその世界に惹き込んでしまうものなんだと、しみじみ思いました。
最近では数少ない日本産超名作です。

30798722.review:
When I first started playing the sequel to Trigger Happy Havoc I was initially put off. It took a while for the new characters to grow on me. I missed the characters from the first game. A friend pushed me to keep playing and am I glad that I did.

Danganronpa 2 explores a lot of the backstory behind the first game and sets up the plot for the anime series excellently. They continue to hit all the same notes the first game did, as well as introduce some new mechanics. 

If you enjoyed the first game, this one is a no-brainer. If you've only watched the anime adaptation of the first game, you owe it to yourself to go back and play the first game before jumping straight into this one.

30708582.review:
Sometimes more is less.

Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair has the unfortunate job of having to say "How do I follow up that?" The original Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc, had final relevations that would, without spoiling, make further installments tricky. Danganronpa 2, therefore, sidesteps the larger narrative already set up to tell a smaller but still engaging story. This one isn't really a standalone - though you can probably go through it without playing Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc, I would urge anybody interested to play the original first. While for the most part this stands alone, the parts that don't are pretty vital.

So, D2: GD keeps with the blend of visual novel text and minigames established in the original. There still isn't any signficant branching other than what students you choose to bond with during a given playthrough, though there's seemingly a hidden scene or two I may have missed, looking at the gallery. Instead, it relies more on the murder mysteries and minigames to engage, and those felt relatively strong, though one case left me rather cold. In general, those who have played D:THH will feel at home again. The core gameplay of "meet friends, watch them die, solve the mystery" remains the same, but there are a more few new distractions.

In keeping with sequelitis, some of the minigames have been changed and a new one has been added, but sometimes not for the better. The core debate mechanics are still strong and remain the core. A new debate style where you "cut" words is a middling addition - it's difficulty seemed to wander wildly to the point I felt one sequence was nearly impossible on Hard, but thankfully only nearly so. Hangman's Bluff gets a unnecessarily obtuse addition of moving letters that can crash into each other, which I just felt was distraction. A new minigame, Logic Dive, has you hoverboarding down the tube of... your mind?... and selecting different conclusions by boarding down different paths. To me, it felt like an unnecessarily reflex-and-memorization version of Ace Attorney Investigations' logic mechanic. Ultimately, though, they still fulfill their purpose of adding tension to the trial segments and breaking up what otherwise would probably be a tiring wall of text. Mystery deduction remains engaging for the most part, with only one mystery that had me squinting at how the player was supposed to puzzle a thing or two out.

Also new to the series are leveling and a virtual pet mechanic, which is easily the worst new addition. You can warp between locations quickly, or you can walk slowly from area to area on the new island environment. Walking levels your character, but also there's a virtual pet you get you can grow by walking as well. However, your virtual pet will shit itself to death if left unattended, so you have to enter a menu, select the pet option, and occassionally press "X" to clean its shit up and allow it to grow. Leveling can be done other ways as well, mind. Your level controls how many skills (gained by making bonds with others, still) you can equip for trails, and the pet can be given gifts to raise its "hope" to get it to evolve into different forms. It's all a bunch of fiddly bullshit to reward people willing to play a Desert Bus-quality minigame that hopefully won't make a return, because it's real, real bad. The pets don't do anything interesting but shower your in monocoins, which are used once again to buy gifts to make bonds with the other students and unlock stuff in the gallery.

If that wasn't all, there's a fairly average arcade "magical girl" side-game to play, as well as a alternate story mode and novella that are unlocked upon finishing the game - I've played the former but not the two latter games yet.

As an aside, just get guides for gift-giving or pet raising in that regard. It's not worth sussing out on your own. Similarly, the random gacha machine tries to trick you into spending more than on monocoin at a time, but it's only worth it if you're buried in them and you're down to that last 10% or 5% of items to unlock. It retains the bad mechanic of just throwing in tens or hundreds of coins one at a time to get the best result.

This may sound all really harsh, but I still enjoyed it. And it's hard to talk about why, because the biggest elements of D2:GD are the relationships, reveals, and a deeply Japanese sense of humor and wit. If you've played D:THH - which you once again should have before playing this - you should already have a pretty good idea of what you're in for. The new characters are generally interesting and entertaining with only a few misses, and I wouldn't mind another go-round to see more once I have the time. It's unfortunate to have some of the albatross-like mechanics added to what otherwise is a fairly strong narrative, though hemmed somewhat by the relevations of the original. There are some handwavey portions that disappointed me somewhat, but overall it left me wanting to poke some more through the bizarre pile of questionable quality that is what the Danganronpa *transmedia franchise* at this point. Is it good? Hmmm. Is it fun? I think it's pretty fun so far.

Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair remains a relatively clever visual novel with just enough spice of minigame and adventure game crossbreeding to keep me entertained, A lot of whether people like this depends on your tolerance for visual novels, Japanese quirk, and some degree of monkeycheese, but it's not the sort of experience you'll get much of anywhere else save perhaps the Phoenix Wright games, and those games aren't on Steam.

Played through with both difficulties on hard. Had to resort to a guide once to get an answer and once to get a clue that led me to the answer. Leveled to 99, god help me, and pretty sure I raised all the pets but the pet achievement never triggered. Finished the magical girl minigame. Bonded with 3 other students to maximum.

TL;DR: Easily worth your time for the narrative if you enjoyed the original, but it's not without some annoyances to put up with, so if you're easily bugged by some garbo mechanics or time-wasting elements it may not be for you. If you haven't played the original, don't play this.

30672045.review:
Danganronpa 2 is a game i've already completed on both the PSVita and PS4. I've yet to complete the pc version but i think i've played enough to be able to write a review about it. Despite being a sequel Danganronpa 2 can in fact be played without playing the first game, although doing so isn't recommended. For this game a new cast of characters find themselves in a new setting, but the concept is largely the same. To escape from their island paradise/prison you need to commit murder and get away with it. If they do not then they face excecution. 
The gameplay is very similar to the first though some changes have been made to the exploration and trial minigames. While the trial changes are welcome as they make some of the more boring minigames less worthless, i'm not to fond of the exploration, as i much preffered what was present in the first game instead. However, there being a fast travel feature alleviates this somewhat. The story itself feels like it takes a while longer to get going compared to the first one and i really wish it would hurry up a little bit in the beginning, the prologue especially. Thankfully the pacing is a bit more to my liking towards the end, and i do like the story quite a lot. Though, again, i didn't like it as much as the first. the trials are still as fun as they ever were, and its still a great feeling putting together the pieces of the cases.
Speaking of things not as good as the first game, let's talk about the characters. As i said before we get an entirely new cast of characters for this game(well, for the most part, at least). I do enjoy a lot of these new characters, don't get me wrong, but in equal regard, some of them irritated the crap out of me through the course of the game. Granted, i was annoyed by a couple of the characters in the first Danganronpa as well, so when i say the characters in the first game were better, i mean the ratio of good to bad was higher. Also dissapointing was that there was no character in this game equal to the person who would become my favorite character of the franchise, who i'm not going to name because i'm not sure if that would be counted as spoilers or not.
With all the important bits out of the way, i'll wrap things up. The music is good, nothing i'd want to buy and listen to by itself, but stil good. Some of the character designs look a bit weird to me, but they're pretty good for the mostpart. I played the game in english and the voice acting was both pretty good and pretty consistent.
So in this review i may sound like i think that Danganronpa 2 is an inferior product to the first and... yeah, i kind of do. But i don't think it's a bad game, quite the opposite. It's a great game, just not as good.

30651310.review:
犹豫了很久不知道该不该写点东西，最后还是决定要对这么长的游戏时间负责。
无论如何这都是一款让人通关以后百感交集的游戏。
尽量不涉及剧透吧。
估计很多打算玩《弹丸论破2》的玩家都是从1过来的，再不然就是12合包。无论如何想必是对这个世界观有了一些了解的：男男女女为了生存不断猜疑，套路，而绝望中的希望就此诞生。
嗯，很哲学的命题，听上去也很好，只是当你将自己代入游戏，不再用超然的上帝视角看待生死，也会这么想吗？
你倾注了感情的一个个角色就这么简单地死去，你还能保持古井无波的心境吗？
费劲心思的推理被更加荒诞的事实推翻，你会不产生无力感吗？
寻求真相的结尾，是谁也不想接受的噩梦，你不会后悔一系列的过程吗？
算计与被算计，套路和被套路结合勾联，造就了这一场推理盛宴，但同时这也是一场对你内心的拷问。

游戏本身是各种矛盾产物的结合。希望与绝望，杀戮与被杀，理智和欲望，真实和虚幻，友情与绝情，你所知道的“真相”和事实。
加上本身大量玩梗（尤其是礼物，柱男好评）有些死者也因此成了虚幻世界内套路产物[spoiler]比如欺诈师[/spoiler]，当然，妥协与妥协背后的亮点并存，反套路的地方更多，毕竟逆转才是推理游戏的精髓。
创造性的戏中戏剧情为本作添色不少。最后的毕业，一切的牺牲，将你导至一场游戏的噩梦之果，游戏外的游戏外，游戏后的游戏里，混乱的记忆，过往的噩梦，指向名为真实的另一处深渊，结果无人愿意承担，但总有人要为之买单。倘若细品，这是种颇残酷又饱含深蕴的剧情刻画。到最后，思维与现实的限界仍不曾明朗，这个世界的真相也未曾彻底暴露在玩家之前，但无数混乱的碎片与妄想，交织出了一个未见其貌已知其势的宏大世界，工未至而势已成，俯芥子而见须弥，弹丸论破用其高屋建瓴的描画方式，用模糊的笔锋，把一个幻想与现实参半的世界勾画得如此清晰，从这意义上来讲，弹丸论破值得很多空有世界没有灵魂的所谓3A大作学习。
莎士比亚说，悲剧是把好的东西毁灭给别人看。好的悲剧有两个精髓。一是被毁灭的东西够好，二是反抗毁灭的抗争恰有分寸。上面两点弹丸论破做到了：塑造的人物大多有血有肉，而非单纯的形象与象征，绝对的压力下，名为奇迹的光芒屡屡升起，却无力刺破绝望的黑幕。牺牲被付予了微不足道的价值，但量变足以引发质变时，就是希望的曙光彻底散发的前奏。
所以，也带来了好的悲剧的影响：倘是用了心的玩家，怕是也会与我一样，在结尾怅然若失。
这就是钢铁般的事实。逝者不会复活，罪行无以偿还，内心的痕迹不会弥合，当初的选择不容更改。
如果能重新选择，比起在黑暗中开创以生命的厚重点亮的未来，让一切不曾发生，是更好的选择吧。
只是没有如果。我们能做的，就是别在现实重演这场恍惚又确实发生了的恶果。
因此，对于贯穿弹丸论破2始终的悲剧，不妨用一场实力不对等的战争形容。
当我们的爷爷辈冲向敌人的坦克时，牺牲微不足道，只有手雷的烟火向他们致敬。但就是这万万朵烟火，改变了亚洲的格局。如今我们仍然震惊于奇迹般的胜利，讴歌着历史长流中的死者，却不会有谁，希望再有下一次用血肉掩埋铁骑的战争。
是的，凄美而让人心碎，就这么去给这部作品做个简单的诠释吧。
9／10
未来自死者的白骨中向前延展，骨路两旁的花，是生者向他们致敬的咏叹调，
希望从向阳的躯体中源源创生，躯干之下的影，是死者为现世书就的羊皮书。

Last night I beat this game, it's one of the best games I've ever played, the story is awesome, the plot twists are mind  blowing, the pacing is a bit weird at times but is fantastic at the end, the way they set up the class trials and the subtle clues of who did it is good, the characters are just as memorable as the Danganronpa 1 characters, however they look extremely similar or act similar to some of them (Nagito/Makoto, Akane/Aoi, Nekomaru/Sakura) it starts to feel like a parody of itself at one point, especially at the begining, which is the worst part of the game. besides the Monomi minigame, I hate it. it's extremely tedious and pointless, it's also really boring, but danganronpa IF was a decent read and Island Mode is also really fun, so it makes up for it. so in conclusion Danganronpa 2 is a fantastic game with a few small flaws, I would reccomend it to fans of Phoenix Wright and Persona 4, or just people searching for a good story! 30299370.review:
Oh hey... What a fancy-mancy game judging from that desperation-free title and that cute little picture... No it's not apparently.
Have you ever wanted to test your talent of being the detective or your knowledge in psychology, perhaps criminology, and solve cases, also jerking off with others relationship? You can do it here.

It had come back for more.......

Danganronpa series is one of that daing-detective-sims game that gives you good plots in the series in self with a tasks that gives you headache, class-trial especially. This is the game that require a good bit of vitamins you ate to process certain tasks to be able to continue the game (Well there's always "Save'n'Load button" to rewind mistakes). It's not just single category though. Logics, humans behaviour, friendship, romance (girls), emotions and satisfaction (That feel when you complete a complicated case) they give you all, as much as you are capable to handle. I personally feel it that way

== WARNING, THE CONTENT IN THE NEXT PARAGRAPH MAY CONTAINED (LIGHT) SPOILERS ==



Enough of brain-harming, Danganronpa series had a prequel and sequel for players to enjoy, I personally recommended you to check the others product of Danganronpa as well. Also there's an "Anime" of this series for you to watch and enjoy too, Danganronpa 3 it's named. It's both prequel and sequel stories of Danganronpa 2. If you're one of those in the early days who anticipated the consequence of an event in Danganronpa 3 when the episode are not released yet, then it's would be an exciting predict of what will happen next (For me, I find this quite entertaining).

The plots and stories and actually interesting, it's quite enjoyable, If you liked Danganronpa Trigger Happy Havoc, then you would find the the story and the gameplay quite addicting. The characters had their own stories and their unique personality. The background has (somewhat) improved. New functions and gameplay mechanics, minigames inclusive. The soundtracks are glorious, mysteriously glorious.... and last but not least, there is a character that signatured this game, "Monokuma", well everybody love how villainous he is right? ....... right?

So, does it worth for the money you paid? Absolutely, for person who like mysteries and visual novel + dating sim

10/10 would be grabbing more vitamins for this game

30067960.review:
[h1][u]1) Interest of the game :[/u]

I personnally prefered the concept of the first game which was more realistic and trash ( Mainly because of the story of Mukuro + Junko ). But, this sequel brings something quite essential about what happened before and during the first game : How the world ended, why etc ... I will let you discover that :P

[h1][u]2) Atmosphere :[/u]

Unlike the Despair dimension in the first one, we have a different approach of the killing game here and for other reasons. [spoiler]It was really interesting that it was inside a game and to restore the Ultimate Despair itself ![/spoiler] Here, it's on an island and kind of open, it was somehow refreshing compared to this creepy school o_O There's a paradox between the murders and the "vacation" ambiance of Jabberwock Island. An other way to make things awful x)

[h1][u]3) Lack of charismatic people :[/u]

Concerning the characters, they were mainly boring :/ The only decent characters were Ibuki, Nekomaru, Nagito, Gundham and Fuyuhiko ... Where are Byakuya / Naegi / Kyoko / Sakura / Mukuro / Genocide Jack and all x) I was excited when people like [spoiler]Mikan[/spoiler] or [spoiler]Teruteru[/spoiler] were killed, they were annoying !! 

[h1][u]4) Verdict :[/u]

Overall, the game was surprisingly well orchestred and I wanted to know what would happen after each class trial :) All we need now is to have Danganronpa 3 on Steam for the conclusion of this masterpiece story made by our fellow Spike Chunsoft !! :D

30056143.review:
Что же...
Я должен описать эту игру, иначе буду частью следущей игры на убийство Монокумы.
(Специально коверкаю название)
Возможно будут присутствовать спойлеры, а если и будут, то скорее всего не сильно влияющие на прохождение.

 Эта игра несет в себе жанры детектива, новеллы, триллера, психологии, а так же противостояния Зетсубо (Отчаяние) и Кибо (Надежда).

 "Надежда и отчаяние - это как две стороны одной монеты..." - и это основная мысль всех 4 частей игры (На момент конца февраля (Одна портируется для ПК, другая вышла 12 января на японском)). Так же присутствуют трупы ваших будущих вайфу, хиккикомори.
 
Сюжет в этой части игры похож на сюжет первой игры, но в большей степени он отличается. К примеру, 16 учеников с самого начала, 2 протагониста, а так же Мономи, которая плюшевый зайка. Что бы без спойлеров, сюжет про то, как 16 учеников пытаются выжить на островах, отделенные от остального мира, просматриваемые этим самым остальным миром. А также сверхтайна всего этого сюжета, которая будет похлеще, чем в Дингли Ронпез Триггер Хэпи Хавок. С каждой новой смертью, и с каждым завершенным классным собранием вы получаете возможность исследовать новый остров, а также получить свое свободное время для получения фрагментов надежды.

 Раз уж выше коснулся персонажей, то они следующие на рассмотрении. Все они такие милые и прекрасные, что прямо таки деться некуда, и кажется, что никто из них не способен на убийство. Но! гадкий и прекрасный черно-белый, как поле шахматной доски, Монокума, дает самые простые мотивы, которые в любой ситуации могут быть мотивом для убийства.
Затрону опять Мономи\Усами, которая пытается противостоять со всеми этими выживающими Абсолютами Монокуме, в этом школьном туре по белому пляжу с песком без единого камня, с постройками без рабочих и простых третьесортных мирных жителей, без прописки и денег.

Геймплей. Геймплей заключается в том, что большую часть игры тебе надо нажимать на ЛКМ. Но это естественно для новел, так что сразу идем к классному собранию. Там вам нужно будет нажимать ЛКМ, когда надо, и кричать "Соре ва чигау ё!" (Это не так!) и потом опять кликать ЛКМ. Дальше - лучше. Нужно будет уже нажимать ПКМ, чтобы взять буковку, потом кинуть ее к другой такой же буковке и будет счастье. А может и боль. Кто знает? Ах, точно, потом можно будет нажимать ЛКМ под ритм музыки (А точнее, тогда, когда будет нужная черная кнопка на экране). И с момента второго классного собрания будет открыта новая игра - Логический драйв! Там нужно будет использовать WASD. Ура, хоть немного разнообразия. Но главной особенностью классного собрания будет то, что вам нужно будет думать. Так что те, кто не ладят со своей думалкой, прошу к руководствам!

 Также в этой игре множество различных режимов игры, которые, в основном, открываются после прохождения игры. Волшебная Сияющая Девочка Мономи, новелла с бэкстейджем "Дингли Ронпез ИФ", "Мирный режим" и все открытые эпизоды игры. 

 Графика, которой нет, не оценивается, поэтому скажу иначе - Визуализация! Игра в этом плане на голову выше первой игры, в которой на некоторых иллюстрациях присутствовали следы фотожопа. А если вы не самый ярый графотребователь, то игра вам будет по душе.
 
 В общем, игра хороша, и мотивация ее пройти через год есть. Плюс саундтрек, который идеально подходит для нее, создают атмосферу противостояния Добра (Надежды) и Зла (Отчаяния), а так же атмосферы желания выбраться и выжить.

9 из 10 любителей устроить махач на словах\мечах.

一代二代一起入的，整体感想就先写这吧。
各位，捆绑包买了吧！一百多买这俩游戏完全不亏啊！相信我！[u] 我这么爱钱的人，很少说这种话的！[/u]

OK的话，先说一代，因为一代动画出来的时候就觉得应该是神作，而且有了解到是游戏改编所以就没看动画……做的太对了T^T还好没看，因此体会到了游戏的乐趣。玩的时候没被剧透，所以玩的很爽。一代主要还是被剧情和玩法吸引比较多吧，还有可能就是雾切大大quq

因为二代绝望篇刚玩完所以对二代印象比较深啦，这里要提到一个人，狛枝凪斗，我玩游戏之前就知道这么个人，但是对他的性格不是很了解……开始玩的时候很喜欢他，后来第一章学级裁判的时候“黑化”我就很？？？兄弟你是这种人设的啊？
那都还好，然后大概是第四章？？就是乐园那章，他知道真相后对日向一行人的态度改变让我好不爽，[u]最后还说自己能不能成为希望，我当时读完他那句话实在是没忍住回答他：做梦！[/u]

29879781.review:
This game is a masterpiece and you should definitely get it if you're even remotedly into mystery. It's very visual novel like, with a heavy focus on the amazing story, while being very linear. For me, that didn't matter though since I got sucked into the immersive setting right from the start - the story never gets boring and has a ton of twists, and the characters are great inthemselves, each with their own very distinct personality. Don't get too emotionally attached to your favorite waifu though, chance is high that she'll die at some point. 
The only minor negative point about the game for me are the unnecessarily long tutorials (especially during the class trial phase) and some of the trial minigames, as they are sometimes hard to follow and make sense of.

Lastly, if you want to play this game, I'd highly recommend you  to play part 1 - Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc first, as Goodbye Despair ties closely into the overall story with lots of references and major spoilers to the first part.

29860249.review:
Spoiler-free thoughts about the game, TLDR in the end
This review expects that you have already completed the first Danganronpa.

The story is bigger and better, but after the opening scenes it progresses quite slowly until the midpoint of the game: Danganronpa1 had a steadier flow going thorough the game, but the last half of D2 beats the ending of D1 hands down. To avoid spoilers I'm not going to say anything more about that.

Compared to D1, the main cast is much more eccentric. While the first game had pretty colourful characters set in a relatively dark athmosphere, D2 goes all out with the character designs, which might be off-putting to some people, especially if you're not used to Japanese style of humor. I personally would've preferred if the cast wasn't as weird as it was presented, but this wasn't a huge deal because:
a) There's actually some character development this time around, so some characters will grow as persons.
b) More information about the characters can be gained during the free-time conversations, which will help you understand the cast better, therefore they become more tolerable.
c) There's a good chance that the character you despise the most will die at some point lol.

While the main cast is mostly more one-dimensional than it was in the first game, the villains this time are just awesome. Instead of having arbitrary motives linked to the despair theme like in the first game, the reasons of the killing game and character actions become very clear. The case and story twists are huge and twisted af, I loved it.

The game had some of the best murder cases I've yet to play in any game so far (5th case omg). Most of them focus in small areas, usually just in the room or the house the murder took place, so the investigation, trial and logic proceedings stay more cohesive. Because of this there're less of those far-fetched moments where the player finds possible plot holes or logical near-impossibilities.

The trial mechanics are improved, tho I still dislike the action based logic games.
When it comes to the logic puzzles, the pieces of the puzzle should be the key to the solution, not vice versa, where the player already knows the answer, but the artificial difficulty of the puzzle makes him waste time and effort just for submitting the answer.
The best example of this is the Hangman's Gambit, where you have to shoot down flying letters to form a sentence to answer a question. The intention of the game is that the letters would act like helpful hints, but usually the player can figure out the answer after inputting a couple of letters. After that you're just waiting for the correct letters to appear on the screen, and the game becomes a time wasting formality. There is an option to turn down the action puzzle difficulty, but as I'm aware it doesn't really shorten the time you have to spend in those games.

The trial mechanic where the game really shines, Make Your Argument, is improved even further. The time limits are stricter, time bonuses have been nerfed, and because of the more compact theme of the murders the logic flows more solidly. There are still some moments where you struggle submitting the answer just because you can't figure out which statement to shoot down, but those are rare now, I had to dig a hint from a walkhrough only once during the whole playthrough.

The graphical detail and style are again excellent: the visuals have aged really well considering this was originally a PSVita title. There are some minor but very glaring issues though; I don't understand why the 2D hub world was put together so sloppily, because you'd figure that kind of solution would be easy to execute properly. The character movement animation is terrible, the sprites are jagged and pixelated, and the texture layers between the foreground and the character overlap incorrectly. Also when the background sprites happen to overlap each other, there're occasional graphical errors that are mostly caused by bad object cropping. Texture popping is also a thing, which is probably a remnant from the Vita version, it could've been removed from this PC version.

When it comes to selecting the voice acting language, I recommend Japanese due to practical reasons. This allows you to read the dialogue more fluently when the characters are speaking virtually gibberish, and moving to the next text box in mid-sentence is also less abrupt. 

TLDR
The writing and dialogue are again excellent outside some "Japanese" moments, which this game has more than in D1. Especially the ending and the murder cases greatly exceed the first game, this stuff is wonderfully f*cked up.
The character designs are more eccentric and one-dimensional, but there's more character development around this time.
The villains on the other hand are superior, the motives and character actions are rock-solid, which was very satisfying.
Trial minigames have been changed for the better, tho they are still just artificial time-wasters if you don't like their core mechanics.
Play with Japanese voices, and be not afraid to max out the logic difficulty.

29772119.review:
Well, after a somewhat "meh" experience with Danganronpa 1, I can definetely say Danganronpa 2 is indeed much better in pretty much all aspects. 

The setting is more interesting, the story is much more engrossing and, most of all, the cast of characters is much more carismatic. Quite a lot of them actually have some full-fledged dramatical, humanizing moments, which is great when you consider how whacky they are designed to be. Not that the characters in Danganronpa 1 were bad, but they weren't really interesting to me either. 
The creativity and convolutedness (in a good way) of all the cases is also very much improved, with most if not all cases having their fair share of plot-twists and intense moments. Danganronpa 2 clearly wanted to play with players' expectations a bit, and I think it was well done.

Mentioning expectations, whereas I found the plot of Danganronpa 1  to be pretty standard and heavily predictable (I pretty much predicted the central plot twist from the very get-go) that is thankfully not the case with 2. Most of the major twists were cleverly hidden and not obvious at all, which is always a plus.

It still carries over some major faults from 1, though: first, the "free-time events" are way too few and far between, meaning you either give attention solely to a few characters (and pray they last long enough for you to complete more of their events) or you pretty much lose quite a lot of character development, especially from the ones that bite the dust early on. Just like 1, there is a post-game mode meant for you to complete all the events, but it would've been much better to get more opportunities in the actual story mode. 

Second, some mini-games feel like padding or are just not really that fun to play. The improved Hangman's Gambit is just a pain in the ass to go through (since the English words use more letters than Japanese ones, you can expect your screen to become a chaotic exploding mess that drains your life-bar very quickly), and Logic Dive, while kinda neat, felt pretty pointless since hopping through flying lanes with a hoverboard doesn't seem very connected to logic-thinking. The tamagotchi raising game that counted your steps was also kinda lame. The word cutting game is pretty good though.

The sound-track is good, but not much in my particular opinion. It does it's job, but nothing sticks itself to my mind aside from perhaps the Danganronpa theme-song.

Also, while the port is solid, it's a bit annoying it doesn't feature a mouse-clicking option for going through menus. Screen-tearing is also an issue. While I no longer got it during the class trials, they were still around on the pre-rendered cutscenes and there was nothing I could do no matter how much I messed with the settings or nvidia control panel.

All in all, a great experience that had quite a few surprises, a nice cast and some interesting mind-puzzles.

29742691.review:
Hát nem hittem volna, hogy sikerül az egynél elborultabb játékot csinálni, de megtették. A folytatásban nemcsak olyan grafikai elemeket használnak amik rettentesen közel vannak az "ez meg mi a bánatos franc"-hoz de zenében is sikerült olyanokat letenni amik vagy véresre karcolják a füled vagy a játék végén új csengőhangokon gondolkodsz. 

Minden bővült, a sztori még nyakatekertebb lett, a helyszín immár a Jabberwock sziget, Monokuma mellett most már van egy plüss nyuszink is aki a Monomi névre hallgat. Nemcsak új minijátékaink lettek - pl. hack&slash Monomival, tamagotchi nevelde, de a játék végén még egy gyűjtögetős, kraftolós point clicket is kapunk a mi lett volna ha címmel. Ha ez nem lenne elég a játékban is lettek újítások, a tárgyalásokon megjelent a logic drive nevű runner játék, illetve a meglévő módok is tovább változtak pl. a hangman shooter funkcióval bővült illetve lett egy kardozós cáfolat verzió is sőt még az alkotók PSX-re megjelent játékára is van utalás amolyan játék a játékban. 

Bár a végén szinte minden a helyére kerül, és hiába több a 2 mint az egy nekem az első rész jobban tetszett. Kezdjük ott, hogy az újítások nem minden esetben tettek jót a játéknak pl. a tárgyalások sokkal nehezebbek illetve frusztrálóbbak lettek főleg hogy a végén vannak olyan dolgok amikre baromi nehéz magadtól rájönni. Az új karakterek sem nyerték el feltétlen a tetszésemet, sokukat alig vártam hogy eltegyék láb alól, az is igaz, hogy pozitívabb szereplők is vannak. Legalább az egyik gyilkosságnak baromi homályos a motivációja - értem én, hogy Ő volt, de akkor ne ezért - de talán kettő is van ilyen. Bár menet közben is van ilyen helyszín, de a vége teljesen szürreális. Ez most olyan mintha teljesen lehúznám a játékot, de persze ez nem igaz, mert vannak ebben is azért epic pillanatok és élveztem ezt is, de nem nevezném jobbnak mint az első részt. Több, nagyobb, bonyolultabb, de nem olyan jó csak az alatti jó.

29726293.review:
An in depth review with a few small spoilers:

Overview: So I watched someone else play the DGRP 1 becuase I was stupid and watched the anime first without knowing. When I learned there was a DGRP 2 I was hyped. But in the reviews there were people who didn’t like the characters as much and thought there was too much fan service. This made me sceptical since cutesy and anime aren't my style. Like how could they recreate that sense of despair the first one did beautifully on a bright tropical island? Would the characters be boring or too stereotypical?
But I bought it and was proven wrong. I honestly liked this one better than the first, although that might just be because I was playing it myself. 

HOW IS IT: It does everything the first one nailed and more. It has hard and interesting trials with better gameplay, great characters, perfectly unnerving music and chilling ambiance. And The first one was mostly focused on the trials and trying to get out of the school, but the story in Danganronpa 2 is 100x more devastating. There’s so much lore and so much actual plot in addition to the killing school life.
This is the kind of game that can toy with your emotions. My actual least favourite character at the beginning was Fuyuhiko because he was rude, grumpy, didn’t care about anyone and was ready to let everyone die. A few chapters later all I want to do is talk to him during free time and he’s my favourite character.
And the boring characters that I didn't like (there were only about 3) were either short lived or evolved and grew as the story went on, EXCEPT FOR  *SPOILERS* [spoiler]  HIYOKO I COULDN'T STAND HER EVEN UNTIL SHE DIED [/spoiler]
Also warning it's just as annoying as the first in that your favourite characters WILL DIE, ridiculously crazy plot twists will arise, you'll probably cry a lot if you're me and you'll second guess absolutely everyone. 

PROS:
Gameplay
Characters
Soundtrack
Huge plot
Complex Trials 
The setting
Everyone you love dies
Graphics
NAGITO

-
CONS:

Executions aren't as unnerving
Monomi pet gets annoying
Monomi and Monokuma's english voices are annoying
Hangman's Gambit
Everyone you love dies
Slightly confusing intructions
NAGITO

Anyway everything unfolds perfectly by the end. Coming from someone who isn't an anime fan and hardly plays video games BUY THIS GAME it's worth it. 

11/10 would wanna kill nagito again

因為是看完了未來篇和絕望篇兩部動畫再來玩的二代，所以中間有點混亂我拿到的到底是遊戲給的線索還是動畫的記憶，不過由於二代沒有出動畫所以中間階段還是玩的很開心的，除了第二章的殺人事件和第六章黑幕被動畫影響到了。【早知道先玩了再看動畫】

有些謎題還是比較模糊的，會糾結卡關不得不上網去找攻略，差點覺得自己的智商被欺負了。有些時候卡關的不是謎題反而是操作，尤其是邏輯遷入好容易摔

最後居然有一代客串，兩個主角同框的時候差點笑死！

心疼自己，喜歡的角色都死了導致好感度沒能max，強迫症還被收集全隱藏失敗而狠狠虐了

最近聽說三代出了，希望趕緊出中文登錄steam吧！

優點：

2.反轉劇情引人入勝，說實話很多地方我都被震驚到了，尤其是狛枝的詭計，簡直贊爆了
3.詭計十分驚人，作案手法什麼的需要極大的腦洞，第四章的驚奇屋想了好久都沒想到是怎麼搞得，多虧狛枝啊
4.第四章有一個密室逃脫的小遊戲，好感度+10000000
5.遊戲性和故事性都極強，玩了很長時間，玩完還回味無窮，根本不想結束啊！

缺點：

2.萬萬第六章想寄刀片【這根本不是缺點只是你自己失戀了而已吧】

29643430.review:
46小时通关。玩通结局看着字幕的那一刻心中不禁对制作组肃然起敬，很高兴自己有幸能成为这个系列的粉丝。
超级弹丸论破2在剧本上比一代更加优秀，南国的热带风光之下被迫进行的这场血腥残酷的自相残杀，直到最后找出真正的幕后黑手以及揭露所有真相，每一章的内容都无比引人入胜。弹丸2剧情承接前作，从正面和侧面的各种线索对一代的背景设定作出补充，更完整地构建了弹丸论破的世界观。人物塑造更为优秀，乐观、直爽、毒舌、疯狂……每个角色都给人留下深刻的印象，因此处刑过程也格外揪心。游戏在一代的基础上加入更多玩法，包括逻辑潜入、反论等（言刃的设定简直时髦值爆表），学级裁判的过程惊心动魄，案件真相的揭露百转千回，各种伏笔的展开也极具冲击感，让玩家充分体会到抽丝剥茧解开谜团的那种顿悟的快感，结局更是呈现了一场精彩绝伦的赌上未来的最终对决，让人大呼过瘾。弹丸系列的音乐风格也一直独具特色，开场OP配合画面就完全听不厌，还有黑白美登场、学级裁判中的各种节奏感极强的音乐，都赞到不行。
弹丸2的综合素质之高，既使作为续作的三代动画令人失望，也完全无法掩盖其光芒。
期待新弹丸论破V3中文版的推出！

29641872.review:
You liked Danganronpa? Then you won't been disappointed with the second installment. 

Art: 8.5/10 – The art style feels a little more refined in this installment. The game continues to deliver on many unique character poses like the first. They certainly didn't leave the funky character designs at home for this installment either, lots of crazy characters.

Story: 9/10 -  More excellent murder mysteries delivered in the same context as the first. A vicious school battle show down. There is also a nice twist at the end that you might not see coming.

Music: 8.5/10- Great like in the first installment, I love Monomi's funky theme along with Monokuma's. The one downside is that there aren't nearly as many new tracks on the sequel so you might get bored with the repeats. 

Game Mechanics: 7.5/10-  Great mysteries again. Nice that they changed up the mini games from the first. The only thing that made me angry is being unable to skip some of the minigames. I hate the platformer part and I just wanted to answer the questions without all the bs minigame.


Positive: Had to exercise my brain muscles again on the mysteries in this game. Kept me on my toes with twists and turns like the first. I also felt that there was more depth in the characters this time.

Negative: Again I wanted to have multiple endings with different characters.

29631972.review:
Acho que vou fazer a primeira review negativa desse jogo em PT-BR mas vamos lá. Primeiro, NÃO jogue, EM HÍPOTESE ALGUMA, esse jogo se você não jogou Danganronpa 1. Isso vai afetar sua experiência e entendimento do jogo de forma bastante relevante. Também não recomendo essa franquia se você não gosta de anime/mangá.

Eu sabia que DanganRonpa tinha semelhanças com um dos meus jogos favoritos, Ace Attorney. Tinha ouvido várias recomendações e elogios de amigos a DR, então, quando saiu na Steam, resolvi comprar os dois jogos numa promoção. Não gostei tanto mas vou começar com os pontos de SDR2 que gostei:

- Minigames dos Class Trials: Apesar de me incomodar um pouco como esse jogo se importa com minigames e inovação de jogabilidade (sendo uma VN, isso é desnecessário, mas ok, tem coisas bem divertidas), achei a maioria dos minigames nos trials aprazíveis, principalmente, na minha opinião, o Logic Dive. Eu me entretia nos trials.

- Pet: Bem, eu gostava de ficar olhando o Pet, experimentando os níveis de esperança e desespero e de ficar andando por aí para fazer o Pet crescer. Era melhor que fazer a história.

- A trilha sonora é, no geral, muito boa e os gráficos também. Dá pra ver que teve muito empenho nisso.

Agora, os contras:

- História: Segue a mesma ideia do primeiro jogo, só que DR1 tinha uma atmosfera mais séria, com algum fanservice e umas piadinhas. DR2 é basicamente um fanservice tentando ser engraçado com, às vezes, alguns momentos sérios, constratando totalmente com a proposta e os fatos in-game. O humor é totalmente deslocado, a Monomi e o Monokuma tentando ser dupla de sitcom são simplesmente irritantes e o jogo confia muito que você vai achar divertidas as referências à cultura nerd pop oriental e ao jogo anterior. A impressão é que a produção tentou tanto fazer algo engraçado que acabou matando o clima do jogo. Os casos não fazem muito sentido e são forçados até dizer chega, parece que a produção primeiro pensava em "plot twists muito maneiros que a galera vai pirar" depois tentava juntar tudo num caso ao invés de montar um caso bom e consistente e aí pensar em como dificultá-lo. Todo assassino nesse jogo é quase um serial killer, pela forma como planejam as mortes, não é nem um pouco compatível com a idade/maturidade dos personagens, mesmo considerando o final, [spoiler]mesmo sendo parte do Ultimate Despair e mais velhos, eles ali são apenas os adolescentes que eram antes de entrar em Hope Peak então realmente não faz nenhum sentido[/spoiler]. Até quando matam alguém "no calor do momento", o esforço que fazem para encobrir a cena do crime é tão absurdo que não dá pra engolir. Se fosse assim em um ou outro caso, até vai, mas em todos? Pelo amor. Por mais que não esteja claro quem é o culpado no começo, as respostas durante os trials são, na maioria das vezes, fáceis de supor, mesmo quando elas não parecem fazer sentido lógico no mundo real. O jogo dá uma volta toda num papo maluco sobre esperança e desespero para terminar com frase clichê de anime.

- Diálogos: Simplesmente péssimos. São mal-escritos (ou mal-traduzidos), desinteressantes, repetitivos e não acrescentam em nada. Quando tentam ser engraçados, geralmente falham. O personagem principal faz monólogos preguiçosos quase o tempo todo e quase toda hora tem alguém para falar coisas como "I'll do my best" ou "Let's do our best", enfim, esse papo batido de personagem de anime. Se fosse uma vez ou outra, tudo ok, mas o tempo todo disso é extremamente chato. Como é tudo mal-escrito ou mal-traduzido, esses diálogos não servem nem para imersão ou para criar qualquer vínculo com os personagens ou com o jogo. Você facilmente pode terminar esse jogo pulando pelo menos metade das falas e não vai perder nenhuma informação importante ou interessante.

- Personagens: Bem, ao longo da história principal, não há como desenvolver todos os personagens, já que são muitos, mas, imo, isso não justifica eles ficarem tão presos ao esteriótipo animesco que representam. Alguns personagens representam esteriótipos que parecem paradoxais aos seus respectivos talentos, para propósitos de humor, porém, como é tudo bastante forçado, não tem graça nenhuma. Apenas nos Free Times conseguimos conhecê-los melhor, mas não é possível, jogando apenas uma vez, conhecer todos. Bem, dos Free Times que vi, não havia nada demais nos personagens, eles não eram tão interessantes, havendo algumas promissoras exceções. Mas a maioria é irritante, fora que quase todas as personagens femininas parecem ter sido feitas para ser algum tipo de "waifu". Uma delas parece existir apenas pelo fanservice. Existe  um maior desenvolvimento de certos personagens, principalmente os que vão sobrevivendo mas, no geral, não me convenceu.

TL;DR: Na minha opinião, esse jogo parece ter sido feito pensando primeiro no público e, depois, no roteiro ou experiência do jogador. Para alguns, tudo isso funciona muito bem e, realmente, não há nada de errado em gostar de DR. Mas, se você não faz parte desse público ou não gosta desse estilo narrativo, não é um jogo muito interessante e o botão CTRL (skip) é o seu melhor amigo.

2代相较于1代，CV阵容相当豪华，人物塑造也比1代更加鲜明，但剧情设置相对欠缺，尤其是游戏中期的部分杀人事件简直就是为杀人而杀人，杀人动机太牵强，这一点就不如1代做得好。不过总体上仍然是一个出色的推理游戏，值得深入。

Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair is (obviously) the second game of Danganronpa. First to say there is no Anime Adaption like Danganronpa: The Animation for this title (The Anime was bad tho). 



There is again a Killing Game out of 16 students. Like in the first one. In my opinion the characters in this title have more variety and some even remind me of characters in Danganronpa 1 (Asahina - Akane). The trials are more difficult and have lots more of gameplay. The main roles are all sympathic and the game has a BIIIIIIG Plotstwist.
In my opinion one of the best games that i played but sometimes I had enough from reading so there is no much gameplay. But doesn't care. It's great. So everyone one who played the first game should play this too and watch Danganronpa 3 Future- and Despair Arc.

29404319.review:
Olha, o estilo do jogo pode cansar quem não estiver acostumado onde vc mais lê do que joga, mas vale muito a pena jogar este jogo.
A história é bem bacana, seguindo a mesma linha  do primeiro de ser um local onde para sair dele é necessário fazer um crime perfeito, e só a partir da 2ª metade dela que vc começa a ver a relação entre os 2 jogos. É recomendável ter jogado o 1º danganronpa porque tem muitas piadas que são referentes a ele. 
A jogabilidade tá melhor, com mais tipos de minigames (apesar do Hangman's Gambit ter ficado bem difícil) para resolver cada mistério.
Só o lance dos Tamagochis e level que pode acabar irritando porque tem q andar MUITO pra evoluir os dois, e o capítulo final é algo peculiar já que é impossível vc não sentir nostalgia ao mesmo tempo que fica confuso com as reações do jogo na hora.
Mas, mesmo com essas coisas, vale muito a pena jogar essa história macabra com 16 alunos Ultimates (que são os melhores em alguma característica), porém muito azarados por ficarem numa ilha com o monokuma kk
