29331088.review:
《Danganronpa 2》繼承前作成功之處，再次拓展文字冒險遊戲之可能性，希望會隨著章節進度步步邁入絕望，本以為一切將要告終，劇情突然來個峰迴路轉，找回希望的同時也開拓眾人的【未來】。本作故事劇情仍然環繞在一群擁有【超高中級】專長的高中生身上，他們來到與世隔絕的賈巴沃克群島，自稱是導師的神祕布偶【兔兔美】從一團混亂中登場，告知學生們必須結交好友獲得希望的碎片才能成功畢業，不過想也知道事情沒這麼簡單，當學生們換穿泳裝到海灘揮灑青春時，天色突然暗了下來，看不慣和平景象的【黑白熊】召集十六名學生到群島中央，奪走了兔兔美在此處的控制權，不僅重新制定校規，還說出了令人絕望透頂的畢業條件：『殺死同學並在不被發現的情況下騙過其他人。』

不得不說，剛開始看到二代登場超高中級學生的專長設定時，還是不太習慣那些莫名其妙的設定，甚麼『超高中級日本舞蹈家』、『超高中級飼育股長』、『超高中級公主』從現實角度來看，這些專長根本毫無實用性可言（好吧，飼育股長其實出乎意料的強大），反觀其他幾位同學『超高中級衛生股長』、『超高中級機械工程師』、『超高中級廚師』都是對未來大有幫助的實用專長。經過一輪自我介紹後，最吸引筆者的兩名人物分別是『超高中級遊戲專家』和『超高中級名門子弟』，會被吸引不外乎就是因為遊戲專家〝七海千秋〞是難得一見的女性玩家，其次名門子弟是前作登場主要人物之一〝十神白夜〞，藉由對這兩名角色的好奇心，馬上就順利融入劇情，一口氣玩到第一次班級審判結束。


《Danganronpa 2》整體難度遠遠超過前作標準，從第二次班級審判開始，謎題一次比一次困難，第一次忍不住上網尋找提示的段落是尋找用來殺死女子高中生的【凶器】，到底是要腦洞開多大才可以把【那個東西】跟【那些東西】組合成殺人凶器，每一次討論還會保持五顆言彈數量，如果沒有專心閱讀證言及證據相關資訊，可是會卡關卡到惱羞的呢！然而，難度上升確實對整體遊戲性有著加分效果，可惜的是本次殺人動機都過於薄弱，薄弱到令人啼笑皆非，其中一章更是用【飢餓至死】作為殺人動機，幸好最終班級審判提出動機的角色一如反常的丟出了爆炸威力接近核子彈的爆點，順勢將故事劇情拉升到最高潮。

比起前作主角總是有一群可靠夥伴在旁邊提示你，《Danganronpa 2》出現一名總是在班級審判亂帶風向的問題學生『超高中級幸運』〝狛枝凪斗〞，筆者沒有被事先劇透，所以見到他搗亂班級審判的瘋癲行為，腦中除了憤怒還是憤怒，完全想不出來他的存在意義為何，對他的好感度已經遠低於歷代所有人物，恨不得馬上讓他領便當。當全破主線劇情，開始反思狛枝凪斗從頭到尾的行為模式，發現他才是最遵守自我原則的人，絲毫沒有隱瞞的對待大家，也成為繼『超高中級遊戲專家』七海千秋，個人最喜歡的角色之一。


除了擊出言彈突破盲點以外，本作還融入了新的系統，當大家討論到一半時，偶爾會出現的與事實相符的藍字發言，玩家需要擊出言彈去【贊同】這項論點，比起前作 NPC 胡亂說話讓玩家找錯誤，這項設定更像是大家同心協力在討論案情。舉例來說，某一名學生提到兇手殺人方式是毆打，我們就要提出能夠證明被害人是被毆打致死的證據去強化這項論點，不過要注意的是，黃字發言跟藍字發言幾乎在每次討論都會同時存在，要如何分辨行為模式，選擇【突破盲點】或是【贊同論點】成為考驗玩家邏輯思考能力的一大挑戰。

要說服大家認同你的論點沒有那麼容易，就算玩家用言彈突破盲點，偶爾還是會有不識相的同學跳出來【反駁】你的論點，這就是二代新推出的【言刃系統】。言刃主要用途是斬斷對方反論，持續斬除字句到一定程度，事件會進展到自己有利的位置，對方也會開始動搖，不再堅信原有立場，當對方露出黃字發言的瞬間，拔出正確言刃消除矛盾即可終止反駁，由於揮出言刃斬斷字句次數有限，玩家在揮刀之前最好是等待字句重疊或是在同一直線再切斷它們，如此一來便可透過最少斬擊次數斷光對方所有反論。


《Danganronpa 2》毋庸置疑是款成功的續作遊戲，請問它有比前作優秀嗎？論遊戲性來說，班級審判增加了多樣玩法，案件複雜度也勝過一代，角色個性塑造可說是青出於藍，就連處刑動畫都更加戲劇化，唯有兇手殺人動機大多意味不明這項缺點，其餘幾乎是完勝前作。儘管如此，還是建議大家先行玩過《Danganronpa》再接續遊玩《Danganronpa 2》，銜接劇情和揭穿幕後黑手身分時會更有感覺，接下來讓我們一同期待苗木誠之妹〝苗木困〞主演的外傳作品《Danganronpa : Ultra Despair Girls》正式於 Steam 平台上架吧！


優點：
+遊玩總時數超過二十四小時，從開始到結束彷彿像是看完一整季動畫作品。
+整體難度偏難，想像力就是你的超能力，部分案件對死腦筋的玩家很困難。
+改善前作登場人物眾多，戲分卻分配不均之缺點，作中每個人都非常重要。
+全面支援繁體中文語系，不會因為看不懂他國語言，影響到完整遊戲體驗。


缺點：
-前幾起案件的作案動機不太合理，得知真相後的感觸沒有前作來得震撼。


結論：青出於藍更勝於藍，完美續作的最佳典範，期待 V3 移植到 PC 平台。


網誌圖文好讀版：
http://mgrim214.blogspot.com/2017/01/danganronpa-2-goodbye-despair.html

29319001.review: Not as good as the first but it has its momets and if you enjoyed the first one you will certainly enjoy this as well.

29318401.review:
A solid sequel to Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc, although I feel like the change of setting, while nice, made the game less tense than the first game, being locked in Hopes Peak Academy was part of the tension and stress that the first game provided.

This time youre stuck on a tropical Island, and Monokuma is up to his old tricks again.

The Characters are great once again, youve got your lovable characters, and then you have the characters that cant get killed quickly enough, but seeing how varied peoples favorite characters is, I think they did a really good job.

Once again, you must kill someone and get away with it to get off the island.

There are some new minigames, which are decent fun, they "improved" Hangmans Gambit, which is now even worse than before, and for non-native english speakers, some of the words can be pretty hard to figure out, as they tend to chose pretty obscure words.

A solid sequel, which again will destroy your emotions with 10 pound of murdering your favorite characters, and leaving you with the feeling of despair, as people get killed again in this Happy Fun Time Island Vacation.

I highly recommend this game to people who arent afraid of darker subject matters, and would like something different, because this game is certainly different

玩了一个星期总算在昨天通关了，这个游戏也总算可以暂告一段落了。虽然玩这么久，想刷个全成就，但太累（爱不够）就算了，那个宠物和岛屿结局都好费时。
之所以玩了这么久，主要是在刷好感度 _(:3 」∠)_，早知道通关后可在岛屿模式刷，之前就不折腾了，弄得我S/L多次。看完动画后过来玩游戏的，所以第一部游戏暂时也不打算玩，看以后心情了。第一次玩这种类型的，所以也不好评论，毕竟没啥对比，就说下个人感受。
[list]
     [*][h1] 优点 [/h1] 
剧情真心不错，虽然人物较多，但稀奇的是名字都能和人对上的记住了，不然学园审判时就尴尬了。[spoiler] 刚开始就试过拿错证词去反驳╮(╯▽╰)╭ [/spoiler] 推理环节个人觉得很不错，通过大家的讨论和收集到的言弹，一步一步的逼近真相。第五章狛枝那里真的很精彩，既喜欢又痛心的一章，毕竟[spoiler] 七海 [/spoiler] 我选择的是轻松模式通关的，多多尝试就好，不难，个人不擅长的是用记忆言弹。还有很重要的一点是有官方中文。玩通后再看动画会有各种感慨，啊，原来这样，会有种发现彩蛋的感觉O(∩_∩)O
    [*][h1] 不足[/h1] 
[olist]
     [*]老是莫名卡顿，优化不算好。
    [*]人物经常在说口头禅，不把话说完整（非重要场景），你要他发音就完整一句话呀，真是的。
    [*]不能像galgame那样跳过已读文本，对于我这种回档刷碎片的，真够蛋疼的。
  [*][strike] 老是死角色，有点痛心，特别是喜欢的角色死时 [/strike] 
[/olist] 
[/list] 
暂时就这些了，以后想到啥再来修改。

29286110.review:
Y'know how some people believe that sequels are often lesser versions of the previous iteration? Well, guess what?! This game proves those skeptics wrong in a MULTITUDE OF WAYS!

For those of you who've already played Trigger Happy Havoc, you should have a general idea of what Goodbye Despair is about: Students at the upper-tier Hope's Peak Academy are forced into a Killing Game, where victory is only possible if you kill one of your classmates and not get caught. The difference here? You're on an archipelago called Jabberwock Island, there's a rabbit version of Monokuma that's more obsessed with Hope than Despair, and things got a little bit MORE complicated in terms of gameplay... And all of this is wonderful.

Like the previous game, gameplay is split between three main segments: Daily Life, Deadly Life, and the Class Trial. Daily Life and Deadly Life are more-or-less the same as in Trigger Happy Havoc, however the new mechanic of Hope Fragments as a form of currency to buy skills for the Class Trials AND the addition of the Level System allows for some more diversity than just talking to someone and hope you get either a good skill or a boost to your PP limit. 

Class Trials have kept their normal finding the contradictions, hangman's gambit, Bullet-Time-Battle (now called Panic-Talk-Action) and the Closing Argument Recap, but a few newer events appear, alongside revamped versions of previous events: Including the Rebuttal Battle (engage in one-on-one arguments with your classmates to cut through their beliefs with your blades of truth) and the Logic Dive (an obstacle course-like trial in which you evade various obstacles to solve the trickier questions). The new additions, as well as the old spins on the classics, are a welcome bunch to the hectic and dramatic Class Trials.

Lastly, but CERTAINLY not least, the characters are phenomenal. While the Trigger Happy Havoc cast were enjoyable, many of them fell into character archetype pitfalls that made them feel predictable. The Goodbye Despair cast, although also being archetypes themselves, feel even more real than compared to the previous cast, each one bringing something new to the table that you probably wouldn't expect, including a few surprising choices like the Ultimate Yakuza and even a returning face nobody really expected (and surprisingly thought they wanted). Of course, Monokuma is in full-swing, and as much as he is a despicable bastard of a bear, he's still too much fun, especially when using his little sister Monomi as a foil.

My review wouldn't do this game justice, all I can say is that Goodbye Despair is definitely a must-buy for anyone who enjoys mystery, comedy, and above all, enjoyed Trigger Happy Havoc. So, I give this game a 9/10 "Must Play" recommendation, and hope you all give it a play. 

Otherwise Monokuma has a very special Punishment prepaired just for you! Puhuhuhuhuhu!!!

29247619.review:
Definitely a great game. I was a bit reluctant at first, but this game really is better than the first Danganronpa - even though it was also excellent. The story in itself is kind of similar to the first game, except that the killing game occurs on an island. This is so excellent that I don't even know where to start.

First, this game is funny. Yes, even though there are murders, creepy murders and all.. it'll make you laugh. It's all thanks to a certain Monomi. To begin with, put japanese voices ! I don't know how english voices are like, but I can assure you that japanese voices couldn't be better than they already are. In fact, even if the entire cast but Monomi had bad voices - which is not the case, I'd still suggest you to put them. You'll probably understand what I'm talking about as you progress in the game later on.

Now, let's talk about something more important. Is the plot really that good ? Well.. of course it is, but how good is it ? Like I said, Danganronpa 2 really is better than the previous game, in every aspect. I have to warn you, though. Don't play this game if you expect a ""realistic"" story. You'd better play games where you play the role of a spiky-haired lawyer in blue suit, which fits better your expectations. Just like the first game.. I have my doubts as to whether or not the writers took some illegal drugs before writing the plot. Anyway, if it doesn't bother you, then I can assure you that you will enjoy this story, it can't be otherwise. There are so many good mysteries, murders..

As for the music, they're not exceptional but still enjoyable. If you've played the first game - and you should because this game is full of spoilers - then you'll probably be happy to rediscover the "Closing Argument", a bit better than it already was. In fact, pretty much all sequences from the Class Trials have been improved since the last game, but the Closing Argument is by far my favorite.

In conclusion, this is a must-read. Don't lose any more time and just take the plunge.

And now, New Danganronpa V3 is waiting for me... :-)

29205807.review:
[h1]강력해진 '절망', 맞받아치는 '논파' [/h1]

매력적인 세계관과 캐릭터, 강렬하면서도 충격적인 스토리를 갖춘 클로즈드 서클식의 추리 어드밴처 게임인 단간론파의 후속작. 단간론파1을 클리어 하고 난 뒤 과연 단간론파2가 단간론파1급의 충격을 줄 수 있을까 기대 반 걱정 반으로 구입했습니다. 그리고 그 결과는...


[b][u]김빠지는 첫인상[/u][/b]

사실 단간론파2를 처음 1시간정도 해 본 감상은 실망에 가까웠습니다. 이전 리뷰에서도 언급되었지만 제가 단간론파에서 가장 인상적이고 맘에 든 것이 '사이코틱'한 배경 표현입니다.
하지만 단간론파2는 남국의 휴양지라는 배경 특성상 그런 느낌이 없었습니다.  이동이 간략화 된 것도 마이너스 요소였습니다.


[b][u]하지만 단간론파란,[/u][/b]

첫 인상은 별로였지만, 사망자가 나오고, 챕터가 점점 진행되면서 위의 요소는 점점 신경쓰이지 않게 되었습니다. 점점 현 상황에 대한 껍질이 까지지만, 전작과는 비슷하면서도 확연히 다른 방식으로, 캐릭터들은 더욱 동적으로 게임 몰입에 훌륭한 서포트가 되어 줍니다.
그리고 그 몰입은 궁금증으로, 놀람으로, 경악으로, 이해로, 감동으로. 확실하게 보답시켜 줍니다.


[b][u]핵심을 강화하다[/u][/b]

전작의 추리 난이도는 솔직히 너무나도 쉬운 편이였습니다. 증거만 들고 있으면 플레이어가 따로 추리하지 않아도 주위 캐릭터와 플레이어블 캐릭터가 진행을 떠먹여주는 수준이였다면, 이번 단간론파2는 그런 요소는 꽤 줄어들어, 플레이어가 어느정도 생각을 가지고 추리하지 않으면 생각보다 고전하게 됩니다.
액션 파트도 어느정도 보강되었는대, '동의'라는 새로운 언탄을 구성해 캐릭터의 보강과 난이도 상승을, 반론 쇼다운과 로직 다이브의 추가로 더욱 다채로운 액션을 즐길 수 있습니다. 다만 난이도가 은근히 있는 편이니 주의하시는게 좋습니다. 그 외 다른 액션들도 조금씩 보강되어 한층 더 심도 있는 플레이가 가능합니다.


[b][u]다시 해 보자, '논파'를[/u][/b]

여러가지로 전작을 만족스럽게 하신 분이시라면 이번 단간론파2도 필수로 구입해서 즐기시는게 좋습니다. 다만 전작을 안 해보신 분이시라면, 꼭 전작을 하시길 당부합니다.
또한 지난번 리뷰에서도 언급했지만, 구글링이나 위키 등으로 자세한 정보를 찾는것은 이번에도 자제하시는게 좋습니다. 등장인물이 줄어드는 게임 특성상 일상 파트의 작은 스크린샷 하나조차도 중대한 스포일러가 되기 때문입니다. 

저의 이번 단간론파2의 감상은, 역시나 어처구니 없는 게임. 시리즈 자체에 관심을 가지기 시작했습니다. 조만간 절대절망소녀 단간론파(Vita판)의 구입 계획도 가지고 있을 정도입니다.
그럼, 재버워크에서의 휴양을 즐기시길 바라겠습니다.

   [*]The investigations and trials are very engaging and were at just the right level of challenging in my opinion (I was playing on mean level logic difficulty). [b]Extremely satisfying[/b] when you can connect the dots together. The trials also progress in a way that helps you understand all the details of the murders.

[*] Although some of the characters were not particularly interesting to me, I did have my favorites. Some of them made me laugh, some annoyed me, others made me cringe. Voice acting is also good (English) as well as soundtrack. 
[/olist]

Last thing I would say is...if you buy the game, you may be turned off by the ridiculous fanservice in the earlier parts of the game. But! I assure you that fortunately, the game doesn't really continue to do that, at least not at that level. So worry not!

29079650.review:
~*~The most important thing is that you play this game before watching the 2016 anime!!~*~

Okay. Now that that is out of the way..

This game is truly a worthy sequel to Trigger Happy Havoc. The new little mechanics (quick-travel, running, the ability to MOVE THE DAMN CAMERA WHEN YOU HIT "TAB" INSTEAD OF BEING LOCKED IN PLACE FOR A SOLID 4 TO 5 SECONDS EVERY TIME) make gameplay much more enjoyable. The courtroom minigames are engaging (though at times near the end of the game, the Revised Hangman's Gambit killed my no-damage streaks... I probably just need to Git Gud) and the new ones are pretty cool! 

As for the characters; wow! What a colorful and cute cast! I was afraid I'd forget half the characters by the time I was done since I'm really quite awful with names, but much to my pleasure, I was able to remember everyone's first and last names, their talents, their personalities, and all that good stuff! (By the way; Chiaki is the only GF that matters. I'll fight anyone that says otherwise.) 

Aaaaand Monokuma is a lovable pain in the arse as always! The quips and throwbacks to the previous game all really make dealing with his presence again worth it.

Then there's the storyline. I've made my way through a handful of visual novels with crazy twists in them, and this one's twists... Well. I won't say much for fear of spoiling the end, through there is a lot of foreshadowing (and thinking back, it all should have been obvious from the beginning) and the shock factor is constantly raised so every time you think you've hit the climax and you try to breathe for a second it turns out that something more dramatic was lurking right around the corner! I don't cry easily, but my vision got all blurry during the ending credits because my silly self was teary-eyed!

Ah, I almost forgot! The other minigames! Island Mode and the Usami side game! Because of these minigames I am still not done playing this game to its completion. I will probably be investing another handful of hours while I try to hunt for achievements (and while I read the included novel; Danganronpa IF!). Not that that's bad!! I am very pleased that this game includes good post-game content. The more hours I can invest in this game; the better.

In conclusion! If you enjoyed the first game, I can guarantee (with 97.3%* certainty) that you will enjoy its sequel!

(The remaining 2.7% is for the people that may be unsatisfied with the ending since [spoiler]it follows the whole "it was all a ~dream~ (or in this case; a ~simulation~)" trope that lots of people see as a cop out, lol[/spoiler]. I think it suits the story well, though, seeing as how the creators of this wonderful series love to pull stunts like these often.)

29077764.review: Danganronpa 2 is one of the few sequels to be better than the original. The art style is unique and the music is atmospheric. On the other hand, the voice acting is lazy and the sound effects are generic. The end is mind-blowing, far more so than Trigger Happy Havoc, but still wraps everything up nicely and even manages to throw in some emotion. Unlike the first game, it actually matters when someone dies and characters don't instantly move on when their best friends are killed. It's not as good unless you've played the first game, but still works fine by itself. If you're an established fan of the franchise or a newbie, I certainly recommend this game.

29076994.review:
I just got to say, i think this game is not only awesome, it is my most player game. I love the story and the mechanics too.

But in all seriousness i'll give you a rundown of my thoughts for the game.

1. Amazing storyline with many twists, turns and shocks that are going to leave you on the edge of your seat.

2.At first, unless you've played the previous game, the trials will prove to be quite difficult, especially on the rebuttal 
instances. The game will get much easier after you get used to the controls and how to play the game.

3. I recomend you play the first game or watch the anime first before you play this game.

4.There is a LOT of reading to do. When i say a lot, i mean, a lot. Unfortunately this is one of the reasons i got bored in certain parts of the game, The storyline is completely worth all of your spent time reading the dialogue.

5. After you complete the game, there is still more to do. You not only get a whole story,which ties into the first one, it's pretty exclusive, beware though, unlike the main story, its all just reading, no artwork or people to look at other than the background. You get several other games to play as well, along with artwork of all the characters, music and a cutscene theater. Of course these cost monokoins(in game currency that you can get through doing certain things throughout the game.)

6, Finally the characters. One of the greatest things about this game is the diverse characters and their personalities. Not to long after starting the game i got attached to the characters and enjoyed seeing them interact with each other. Each one has a unique personality and are all different, from the weird, to the funny. or from the completely physchotic to the outright annoying.

I will definitely replay this game soon, on a harder difficulty that is.

I personally recommend this game to anyone who is wanting a game that has a great story and is guaranteed to keep you entertained.

29055701.review:
TL;DR It is Danganronpa, but MUCH Lazier, MUCH more tropey and MUCH more sloppily done


I was a big fan of the first game, but I am extremely disappointed with this title. Nearly every aspect has been downgraded. Some of the characters are more annoying ripoffs of characters from the first game, including what is obviously an older, crazier version of the first game's protagonist and what is literally a character from the first game, but REALLY fat. Some of the new characters are tropey as shown by the pervy cook and the baby face with a napoleon complex. They even introduce a female Monokuma counterpart which simply cries and gives an excuse for monokuma to hit something.
 
The new setting feels very sloppily made with the character running animation having lower quality than your average flashgame and foreground art acting like background art when the character walks past it. New gameplay elements are lackluster variations on ideas presented in the first game, including a frustratingly slow paced take on Hangman's Gambit.

Dialogue is filled with plodding exposition and internal monologues, which to some extent was a part of the first game, but here much of it feels lazy and unoriginal with people droning on about doing their best and not giving up. It's the kind of dialogue where every character in the room always gets to say one small snippet about doing their best, but in their own words. One of the major twists from the first game is just casually mentioned to everyone and people accept the idea of the killing game pretty quickly, with one character threatening everyone else not long after a motive is set.

even the item system seems to have somehow gotten a downgrade. many of the presents from the first game are still here, but everything has turned 8bit. I have to assume it is supposed to go along with some kind of tamagotchi type subgame they have, that works by running from place to place, but it is still an odd change.

29050555.review:
A great sequel to the first game. The basic premise is the same as the first, but it intorduces a whole new set of characters (which are even more eccentric), provides more gameplay variety in the trials with new mechanics, has better designed trials with more depth than the previous game, and even more awesome music. It's essentially more of the same, so there's plenty for fans to enjoy, but likely won't convert anyone who didnt like the other game. As I'm drawing many comparisons to the first game, you definitely want to play is before diving into this one. It's a new cast of characters, but there's definitely connections to be made.

I can't recommend this franchise enough if you can tolerate the puzzle/visual novel gameplay and anime style. The writing is top notch, the story remains compelling, and it has a great mix of emotions thoughout.

29043543.review:
Danganronpa is something of a mixed bag of different mini-games and modes, so I find it a little too weird to write about it as a whole. I'll split this into chunks:

Story: The main story is a mildly interesting framing device explaining why so many different people (from a jerk of a little girl dancer to a trenchcoat-wearing man who speaks of how evil he is and is utterly devoted to his Four Dark Devas of Destruction-his pet hamsters) have been brought together to try to kill each other to escape. The story reuses some general themes and devices from the first game, and although there's something of a justification in some later-game twists, I would have rather they came up with something more original. The story really shines when it comes to each murder mystery, however; I have never seen mysteries written this well in a game. Even when the answer is obvious, it's usually a trap or things aren't quite what they seem. Attentive players can pick up on some of these thanks to choice foreshadowing and less obvious clues, but plenty caught my trope-overdosed brain by surprise.

Gameplay: Gameplay consists two parts: visual novel/investigation segments, with standard "talk to NPCs, find clues, etc" that anyone who's played a game in this genre should be familiar with. I have little to say about this save that it's straightforward and doesn't waste your time with much backtracking or pixel hunting for clues. And then there are the trials, the other half of the gameplay, which consist of a mixed bag of mini-games and logic puzzles to determine who killed the latest victim, and these range from excellent (Nonstop Debate) to inexcusible (Panic Talk Action) to perfect in every way (Closing Argument). On the whole, they make for an enjoyable experience, and I have to say no game like this has given me quite the sense of accomplishment that Danganronpa 2 gives when you piece every little bit of the case together and lay every mystery bare to shove it right in the villain's face, all to haunting yet upbeat music.

Sound: Voice acting is on point here, even in the dub. Special mention should go to the VAs for Gundham, Nagito, and (SPOILER) for really owning the characters and going the extra mile to drive home the lines. I usually skip ahead in games like this because I read much faster than the characters speak, but I found myself often letting the lines play out with the game's Auto mode. The music is also fantastic, suiting the mood from calm exploration to tense interrogation.

Extras: There's a surprising amount of unlockable content the game hands to you. There's the expected art and sound gallery, along with cutscene theater. However, the game has a few side stories that are completely optional, some of which don't relate to the game at all and expand on the greater universe of the franchise. Unfortunately, these to me felt unimpressive and lackluster compared to how tight and rewarding the base game feels. Although, being able to get everyone's visual novel sections was appreciated.

On the whole, this game is well worth your money for the core experience. If you like solving mysteries and can roll with the game changing up gameplay with some action in your sleuthing, this game will be absolutely perfect for you. Highly recommended for any fan of murder mysteries.

28958787.review:
If you didnt play danganronpa 1 and are only reading this to get a look at both games reviews, i will just say this game is as good if not better than danganronpa 1. For those who already played danganronpa 1, let's start by saying what is worse because that list is much shorter. 

-->We start with the ambiance of danganronpa 2, which is different than the first game. The game feels much more open because of the size and the way you move between places and islands, that doesn't mean it's worse, but you feel much less claustrophobic which in my opinion is worse because of the nature of the game. 
-->The second aspect of the game which is, again, subjectively worse than the first one is the balance of the characters personalities. the characters are just as good or even better than the first game, but the balancing is off in terms of seriousness, that means the cast become much more silly or serious ( not gonna spoil) and doesnt achiev the same cool balance of the first game.

With that out of the way, we can go to the pros. The game is absolutely fantastic, you can feel improvments in almost every aspect of the game execpt maybe the tutorials for the minigames of the class trials. The story manages to also impact the story of the first game in a very positive way, shedding light in a lot of elements that the first story left pushed aside. The game immediatly throws you 2 very mysterious characters, that forces you to think about the characters in the first game, and with that you are left with not even knowing if the events of the second game are after or before the events of the first game at the start. This time, in a tropical island, you are going to feel much more connected with the characters because of the better balancing between the plot and the social events, you will feel even more part of the group, and, therefore, feel much more despair as things go ugly. The class trials are better in a lot of ways, the main aspect is the difficulty. The game feels like it knows you played a full game already and its much less kind with the difficulty, making the trials much more challenging in a good way. The minigames are, imo, better but still it's subjective, aside from that, the trial shows quality of life improvments, only the tutorials are bad.

TLDR: the game is better in almost all aspects but the ambiance is less claustrophobic and the cast has problems with the personalities balancing throughout the story. Overall, the game is a must have for who played danganronpa 1 for sure, and the majority will probably like the second game even more.

28928934.review:
My favorite character died.
0/10 
Worst game ever


But in all seriousness this is one of the most enjoyable games that I have ever played.  After making the fatal mistake of only watching the first season of Danganronpa, I did not have high hopes for this game.  However, after my roughly 30 playthrough, I am extremely happy that I was able to experience this.  I liked the cast of DR2 much more than the original DR.  I actually felt upset on multiple occasions when characters were killed off unlike the first season (again, this is probably because I only watched the first season, but I felt it's worth mentioning).  There were many brain-wracking moments that had me constantly coming back to the game, no matter how much I struggled at some points.  


As a story/experience, this game would probably fall into my top 5 games: however the one gripe I have with this game is that I do not see any replayability value in it other than achievement hunting.  Whether or not this plays a heavy role on your decision to buy this game is up to you, but I highly recommend that you get this game, regarldess of the replayability!


Overall, I am extremely satisfied that I played this game, and I cannot wait to start watching DR3!

 이게임에 등장하는 모든 캐릭터들의 개성이 뚜렸합니다. 그리고 이런 캐릭터들을 사정없이 죽여버립니다. 사망플레그 같은건 없으므로 다음에 누가 죽을지 예측하기 어려운데요. 어떤 장르의 스토리를 봐도 이넘은 딱 죽을상이다 이런 감이 오는데 이게임은 그런게 없습니다. 그래서 누가 죽고 누가 범인인지 밝혀질때마다 충격적이죠.

28730595.review:
Danganronpa 2 is one of those sequels that defies expectations. Rather than coming across as bland regurgitation, this title offers a few new scenarios to the already developed Danganronpa universe. New characters, new tribulations, and new puzzles all add the the elaboration of what has quickly become one of my favorite story-telling, puzzle-based, dark-themed games. Would I recommend this to everyone? No. I would suggest this game to those who loved the first so much that they are eager to delve deeper into the twisted universe of the evil teddy bears. Delightfully, there are extra bonuses in the sequel that really help to construct a complete world full of subplots, secondary characters, and delightful twists and turns within a plot that is original despite the clear spinoff qualities of a sequel.

Four Stars

28241177.review: I really enjoyed the first Danganronpa, but I held off buying this one for a while, as I wasn't convinced the same kind of story would work a second time. Fortunately, Danganronpa 2 still manages to pull off plenty of surprises. While I didn't find it to be quite as good as the original, as the cases are not quite as mind-bending, it still managed to effectively hold my attention by telling a very compelling story. If you're a fan of the original, then there's no doubt that you'll enjoy this one as well.

28240252.review:
Danganronpa is one of few times where a despair-fueled experience comes highly recommended. THE FIRST GAME IS VIRTUALLY MANDATORY in terms of narrative, so pick that up first.
PROS:
+Great characters, with plenty of potential waifus - just don't get too attached. One character who started as a total A-hole turns out to be one of the biggest bros as time goes on.
+Plot makes twists and turns at varying levels of 'bonkers', and at a constant high of despair.
+Incredible blend of Persona and Phoenix Wright, as written by George RR Martin (not really, but the way characters die...)
+Investigations and trials are compelling, with surprising turns that change how you look at a character you THOUGHT you knew.

CONS:
-As is usually the case in games like Phoenix Wright, there's a specific chain of logic you have to follow in trials; it can be frustrating to understand where the plot's going but not know how to progress. Which piece of evidence do I present? Who do I accuse?
-Get ready for LOTS of reading - but considering half of this game is a visual novel, that's par for the course.
-So many dead waifus... :(

28217416.review:
Since I played the first game, I've been eagerly awaiting for the localization of Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair.
I knew that fans who already played the japanese version were stating that this sequel was even better than the first episode - and after playing it myself I can easily understand why.

As usual with Spike Chunsoft games, Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair is essentially a visual novel.
Expect lots of reading, but despite a not exactly "top class" translation the dialogues and writing is captivating and definitely interesting.
The pacing of the story is great, gradually ramping up until a finale that left me with my jaw open. The last part of the game is really something that must be experienced. The first game is known for its plot-twists, but the sequel blows that game out of the water. You will not expect what's going to happen, and this is good.

Having played the first game, Trigger Happy Havoc, is requirement if you want to fully understand and appreciate the whole storyline. The developers are expecting the players to be up to speed concerning the plot of the series, so do yourself a favor and get both games if you can.

28061425.review: I have always loved a good mystery, especially when it's a dark as possible. That's why I loved the first Danganronpa game as it fufilled that and even more, but Danganronpa 2 takes what the first game built on a takes to a whole new level of despair and hope. I honestly never really expected for a PS Vita game to make to the Steam store, let alone for it to one the best ports out there as you can hardly tell that it was originally on another game system, unlike some ports. COUGH! COUGH! Tale of Symphonia. COUGH! COUGH! This game is great for those who love game like Ace Attorney, but want a little more than a visual novel with no gameplay mechanics that couldn't be done by a 3 legged turtle. It's also nice that it has a difficultly setting so you do not have to worry about being too stupid or not being able to use logic like you want to, and before you say I'm calling anyone except myself an idiot, I am directing this comment at myself. I can be very stupid at times and an essential idiot handicap is almost always appericiated with me because I do not know when my moments of sheer "why isn't my brain thinking the bestest" will happen. Now while it is not necessary to play the first game and be able to understand this game's story, I would highly recommend playing the first game before this one as it will make the storyline the last few chapters a LOT more clearer. Playing the first game is also a good way to understand if you really will like this game as the game mechanics are a bit easier to learn and you'll get an idea of what you're getting into by the end of the first trial. It's really incredible though because *insert spoiler here*! Overall, if you're looking for a good visual style novel to get into on your day off or you'd like something that'll make you question the state of the world and why aren't you doing anything about in the wee hours of the night, then Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair (and goodbye any peaceful dreams after beating it) is your horror story to play through!

27979364.review: Яркая, эксцентричная, захватывающая, полная интересных и крайне харизматичных персонажей, внезапных сюжетных поворотов, которые способны превратить надежду в отчаяние и наоборот. Описывать то, насколько хороша эта игра можно долго. Совершенно замечательная визуальная новелла, и отличное продолжение первой части - лучше практически по всем пунктам, при том что и первая часть была отличной. Тут есть идеальный баланс между юмористическими моментами и серьезным, даже жестоким сюжетом, контраст между этими двумя составляющими сильно поддерживает интерес на протяжении всей новеллы. А учитывая то, что жертвой или убийцей может оказаться даже ваш любимый персонаж, за происходящим начинаешь следить с двойным интересом.

27712513.review:
最开始接触弹丸论破系列是从《弹丸论破1 希望峰学园和绝望的高中生》动画版开始的。最开始由于画风和人设不适合自己的口味差点弃番，却又被绝望之中跌宕起伏的故事所震撼，一口气补完后意犹未尽，尴尬地发现2代的故事并没有被动画化。于是不得不顺便连同一代一起购买了2代的游戏。
在入手之前，我一直怀疑自己是否真的有必要再去尝试这款游戏。且不说暴雪山庄+大逃杀的推理游戏套路之前就被别的游戏用过无数次，和一代基本一样的游戏模式也难免会让人产生一种“啊，怎么还是这个”的强烈的即视感。将故事背景从密闭的教学楼换成温暖的南国小岛，更是让一代的压抑感与紧张感带来的刺激大打折扣。
但事实证明这款游戏远比我当初想象得更为优秀。比一代更成功的人设、更加合理的案件推理、与更加令人惊讶的反转，使得这款游戏无论是故事性还是游戏性都成功地超越了前作，而不是沦为简单的狗尾续貂。处刑环节带来的心理冲击虽然已经大打折扣，但是却和人物自身的故事背景有了更深的联系，转而具有了别样的象征意义。
如果说1代的绝望是阴森密闭的校舍，那么2代的绝望就应该是刺骨的黑夜与南国燥热空气里的疫病吧。正是因为从心底想要去信任和自己一同在海岛中相互扶持着度过日常与非日常的伙伴们，精彩的推理结束后的指证凶手环节才会那样让人无奈到绝望，而不是如释重负的冰冷的成就感。一遍又一遍地听着《Re:処刑に願いを》，眼前也涌现出[spoiler] 七海千秋	[/spoiler]面对着那名为绝望的希望面前绽露的微笑：
[spoiler]    私の方こそ、ありがとう。
　　　　みんなのこと、忘れないよ。	
　　　　ずっと、ずっと、忘れないよ。[/spoiler]
9.5/10。

27344691.review:
Ah. Danganronpa. One of my absolute FAVOURITE series.

I have absolutely LOVED this series since I first watched the fan translation of Danganronpa on youtube. Mind you, this was WAY before an official English game was announced.

On Danganronpa, I explained my feelings on the anime and English VA. Compared to the cast of DR, I don't mind the VA for DR2. I feel they're much better, but I still much prefer the Japanese VA. There's more emotion put in than the first, but it still just doesn't compare to the Japanese VA.

One example is a scene in the first trial. One of the characters has a bit of a psychotic moment, laughing maniacally. Watching the scene in Japanese just blew me away.  The moment I watched the same scene, but in English, I felt so... underwhelmed. They just... sounded like they were trying to laugh with a sore throat. It just... I couldn't continue.

Yet again, as much as I love this game, the downfall for me is the English voices. And I believe, even if you LOVE the English VA, the Japanese VA is a MUST, even just once.

TL;DR
One of my FAVOURITE games.
Slightly better English VA than before.
Don't like the English VA? Try Japanese.
Like the English VA? Still listen to the Japanese, even if only once.
ESPECIALLY FOR THE FIRST TRIAL.

27341275.review:
Rating of the game: 9.5/10

Amazing character design and an overall intresting story makes Danganronpa 2 an unforgivable piece of art. Every person you meet in the game has a unique personality that you either hate or love which makes them kinda realistic in my opinion. The story has the same premise as the first game, while still providing the player new informations about the world that Danganronpa takes place. Also, did I mention the plot twist at the end? What else makes this game awsome? Oh yes, the music. Every song has a vibe which conveys a feeling perfectly matching with the scenes they are paired with. The visuals are also gorgeous, well drawn, and stylish. 
Overall Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair is a fun game with loads of stuff to do (after you finish the game new gamemodes appear), loads of chracters you can love, fantastic storytelling and catchy music, with only one problem of the puzzles sometimes making no sense or somebody being just too anoying. These are the reasons behind my rating.

27046077.review:
I find it hard to really say much about this game without spoiling things, so, I'll keep this review as short as possible for me.

Danganronpa 2 is an amazing game, even more fun than the first. If you're a fan of detective-type games, you'll surely love this. At first glance, it really doesn't seem like anything too special, but the more you play it, you get wrapped into it and get even more entranced with the story. While the gameplay isn't anything too special, it's quite unique in its own way as well. 
This game is quite lengthy, so, if you do get it, make sure to set some time in your schedule to get in at least one chapter. In my playthrough, each chapter was roughly 11 hours, including the 5 or 6 hours of the trial at the end of each chapter. The trials in this game are even better than the first as well, for they touch up a bit more on the debates and even introduced some new mechanics on top of the old ones that the previous game gave us, and even revised some of the older mechanics.
The music of this game is amazing, but if you're not a fan of the musical style, you may end up getting tired of the same loop you hear in the various areas of the game.
This is probably my most favorite game I've ever played, because it worked itself inside of my very being, and struck the heart strings that games generally cannot reach inside of me.

26980888.review:
Like the first game, this is very hard to talk about without spoiling anything.

Like the first game, a group of high school students are trapped in a location (now an island as opposed to a school), and cannot leave unless they get away with murder. That is, kill someone and then not get caught in the class trial. In terms of the murder mysteries that occur, think Ace Attorney on LSD. Especially with the final murder.

I feel like I'm just copying and pasting my review of the first game, but the gameplay really hasn't changed at all, and it didn't need to because the narrative and characters were what you played it for. And, really, this game does both of those well.

The characters in this game are (almost) all better than the first game's cast (my avatar may give an indicator as to potential exceptions), and this makes up for the story not being quite as good. Where the first game had people concentrating on trying to get out of their enclosed space, this one is focussing on them trying to figure out who among them is a traitor. As such the narrative really revolves around the character interactions a lot more, which isn't a problem because the characters are all that much better, but it leads to moments of frustration when none of them are trying to figure out an escape.

In between the trials, investigations, and compulsory narrative, you get to spend your time talking to whichever characters you want to. This really brings out the depth in all the characters, but because of everyone's poor survival chances, it makes the game harder to deal with. Especially when in two consecutive chapters they killed off my four favourite characters. And they become your favourite because you spent gametime with them that could've been spent with anyone else, and now they're gone. Though, like the first game, the postgame is quite a nice conclusion despite the torment it put you through.

Nominated for the "I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye" Award.
Honourable mention for being nominated for the "Whoooaaaaaaa, dude!" Award, just because of everything. [spoiler]Especially Nagito.[/spoiler]
Honourable mention for being nominated for the "Best Use Of A Farm Animal" Award, because of Usami's trick right near the start actually being clever foreshadowing.

26809556.review:
Das wichtigste zuerst:
Spielt UNBEDINGT den ersten Teil bevor ihr Danganronpa 2 spielt.

Danganronpa 2 ist eins meiner absoluten Lieblingsspiele.
Zu Beginn erinnert das Spiel noch sehr an den ersten Teil aber ungefähr ab der zweiten Hälfte beginnt das Spiel mit Twists und Awesomeness nur so um sich zu werfen, dass ich regelmäßig mit offenem Mund vor dem Bildschirm saß und mir dachte: "Das is´ grad nich wirklich passiert".

I findet man Danganronpa 2 einige großartige Charaktere, wie Nagito der absolut bessen davon ist den Verräter zu entlarven und damit zur "Ultimate Hope" zu werden. Oder Gundham der "Ultimate Breeder" der sich als teuflischer und bööööser Overloard sieht und mit seinen "Four Dark Devas of Destruction" (seine vier Hamster) die Unterwelt terrorisiert.

Das Spiel steht dem ersten Teil auch bezüglich des Humors in nichts nach. Monokuma und Monomi sorgen immer wieder für Lacher und frischen damit die Atmosphäre des Spiels auf. Zudem gibt es alle Nase lang Anspielungen auf andere Videospiele, Geschichten und Animes zum Beispiel auf den Zauberer von Oz, Professor Layton und Death Note um nur ein paar zu nennen.

Zusammenfassend lässt sich sagen, dass Danganronpa 2 Storytechnisch aus meiner Sicht mit die beste Spielerfahrung bietet, die es auf Stream gibt. Also eine klare Kaufempfehlung an alle, die nicht von Visual Novels grundsätzlich abgeneigt sind.

26513237.review:
Ah yes the sequel to Danganronpa one of my favorite video games of all time. After playing the original game I naturally had a set of expectations going into the sequel. This game exceeded my expectations for a great sequel and as a result I think the sequel is better crafted than the original game.

First off, I think the sequel has a better written story that is just as engaging if not more engaging than the story in the first game. Not only is the overall story better, the cases are so much more complex and better written than the cases in the first game and as a result they feel more satisfying to solve. I also think the sequel has an overall better cast of characters because most of them have character development outside of filling out of their report cards and I became more attached to these characters as a result.

Secondly, I think the second game has a better set of minigames than the first. There are returning minigames that have been improved such as the Nonstop Debate, M.T.B Battles which now go under the name P.T.A, The Closing Argument, and Hangman's Gambit which feel more satisfying to complete than the versions in the first game. The two new minigames go under the names Rebuttal Showdown and Logic Dive. In Rebuttal Showdown a character will usually object towards one of your statements and come up with an argument of their own. You must cut through their words and come up with a counter argument which will prove that they are incorrect. In Logic Dive you must surf through a matrix obstacle course and answer a series of questions and piece them together to form an answer which will help move the case forward. Both of these minigames are very fun and satisfying to complete.

Thirdly, I love how much more expansive the island of Danganronpa 2 is compared to the high school enviroment of Danganronpa 1. I also think that Danganronpa 2 is more visually appealing because of the more varied enviroments of the individual islands. I also like the small features that they added like the ability to raise different kinds of virtual pets, hidden monokumas in each chapter, and Island Mode a mode which is a what if game mode where no murders happen and you can get different endings for each character. As a result this gives Danganronpa 2 a lot of replay value.

Lastly, Danganronpa 2 still has an amazing soundtrack which plays in all the right moments and overall has a better sound than Danganronpa 1.

Overall, Danganronpa 2 is an amazing sequel which I think surpasses the original in every way. 10/10 one of my favorite video game sequels.

26468085.review:
总括：七海マジ天使
【强烈推荐！！】
推荐人群：喜欢解密和文字冒险的人群

感想：
打折的时候入手的，想着喜+1，结果几乎一口气通关了，根本没想到会这么好玩！
虽然很多人说第一部比这一部强很多，但是老朽个人觉得本作在最后的几个裁判中表现的非常精彩，简直mind blowing。
[spoiler] 狛枝的伏笔简直惊艳。根本没想到会反转这么多次[/spoiler]

角色：
角色设计也是非常成功的，很多人带有先入为主的观念来玩了2，发现很多角色在设定和发展上跟1代很相似所以就觉得2代没有1代塑造的好。其实对于没有玩过第一代游戏的人来说，又或者第一代没有特别喜好的角色的人来说，这一代角色个性还是非常鲜明的。至于每个人喜好不同，可能喜欢的角色死了可能就没追的动力了的，这个的话说实话只能找编剧了吧。[spoiler]听说很多人喜欢罪木和田中，但是个人并不是很喜欢啦。老朽喜欢的是终里，澪田和七海。话说老朽喜欢的黑皮妹子不论1还是2都活到最后啦，哇咔咔[/spoiler]

还有吐槽说本传中没看完别人的故事不懂谁谁谁的魅力。老朽打到最后也只clear了2两个人好吧，每个人喜好不同当然会去选第一印象不错的角色咯，不要太主观嘛。当然不否定有些角色故事里有加料，有些会被路人化，但是真的是喜欢那个角色的话这些都无所谓的吧。[spoiler] 没错，老朽说的是七海和终里。七海后半段剧情真心给的比较多，印象分直线上升。而终里到后面几乎没有表现的机会[/spoiler]

剧情以及游戏性：
剧情跌宕起伏，前半段看似平凡无奇，后半段高潮不停。汝绝对想不到最后几章节的巧妙构思以及之前的种种伏笔，让人大呼过瘾。强烈建议去玩第一代游戏只后再来玩，实在没时间的可以用动画将就一下，不然理不清人物关系和一些背景知识。没有这些基础的话后面对于刚接触这个系列的人来说很难懂，会对剧情造成比较大的负面影响。

游戏性的话，有些裁判用小游戏简直有点那啥……技巧要求比较高，刚接触的时候描述也是全文字的，结果似懂非懂进去被搞得气急败坏的。建议多练习几次比较好。有些线索和选项不是很严谨，也有可能是语言/文化关系，总感觉不是非常到位。这一点第一代游戏做的比较好，逻辑连贯性要高一点。处刑还是一如既往的疯狂，但是好像变态程度比1代低嗳！？这个可能要伤一部分人群的心了。但是如果是自己喜欢角色被处刑的话，心里还是非常不是滋味的。[spoiler] 看到七海被处刑那里，真的跟主角一样视线没有离开过，恐怕看到那个悬挂了很久的方块的时候也曾抱有一丝侥幸吧……七海真的是个好女孩啊啊啊啊[/spoiler]

背景音乐及其他：
有人吐槽音乐没有第一代带感，老朽觉得好像都差不多吧。高潮的时候能把气氛炒热，搞笑的时候能把气氛舒缓，悬疑的时候能表现出那种压迫感就够了。况且兔兔美那个BGM确实好听233

本作的小礼物和各种收藏品也很有意思（少女的贴身物品汝想不想要啊？）。通关之后会有其他的一些剧情，算是给YY人群的一些福音吧。看到熟悉的场景和不一样的剧情，不知道大家嘴角会否一笑呢？

结语：
以上就是老朽的一些碎碎念和感想，估计也没几个人看，主要还是想写个玩后感。如果大家觉得有参考意义的话就太棒啦！
那么，咱们Danganronpa V3再见！

26443220.review:
[h1]Моё авторитетное мнение: игра полностью себя оправдала.[/h1]

 В целом, на этом можно было бы и закончить, но не могу не поделиться теми впечатлениями, которые я получил от прохождения. 

Ну, давайте же по-полочкам.

[b]Плюсы:[/b]

+ [i]Интересный, продуманный, обработанный напильничком, до тошноты сладенький сюжетец.[/i] Danganronpa 2 показала то, что можно сделать нечто ещё более загадочное, чем то, что было в первой части. Неожиданная развязка, и до нельзя интригующее начало помогли обрести те не передоваемые ощущения от прочтения.

+ [i]Геймплей.[/i] Геймплейная составляющая мало в чём изменилась с первой части, разве что добавились новые элементы споров во время суда. Суд остался таким же динамичным и на редкость волнительным, ибо всякий раз мы боимся потерять любимого персонажа, или же отомстить убийце за его смерть. В целом, вне классного суда, мы продолжаем разговаривать с персонажами, узнавать их истории, интересы и мысли по поводу текущей ситуации.

+ [i]Графика.[/i] Вот тут довольно-таки спорно, ибо не всякий прочувствует истинную мощь спрайтов персонажей и многих объектов игры, но тем не менее, рисовка меня устроила, художники проделали качественную работу над анимациями и сценами игры.

+ [i]Саунды.[/i] Саундов по истине много, и самое главное пожалуй то, что разрабы не кормят нас однотипными музыкальными жанрами, а наоборот предастовляют нам огроменное количества на любой вкус и цвет, что сильно передаёт настроение игры в определённые моменты.

+ [i]Текст.[/i] Тексты диалогов персонажей пропитаны их душой. Каждая реплика разделяет их образ и стиль ведения разговоров. Благодаря этому, и персонажи выглядят уникальными, и история становится более колоритной и наполненной.

+ [i]Персонажи.[/i] А вот за это Кодаку боготворить я готов вечно. Ни одна игра не поставляла мне такое количество вайфу и вайфанов, как эта. Благодаря тому, что нам дают много свободного времени, мы успеваем прочуствовать каждого одноклассника, что в свою очередь, заставляет нас переживать за их судьбу.
 
Но не смотря на это, у игры есть и парочка минусов, на которые стоит обратить внимание. Их можно расписывать много,нудно и долго, но никакие из этих минусов не смогли испортить впечатление от игры, в конце-концов большую часть времени мы просто читаем, а визуальная состовляющяя является, скорее, приятным дополнением ко всему этому.


- [i]Спрайты.[/i] Как я и говорил, визуальная состовляющяя сией игры не идеальна и придётся по вкусу далеко не каждому. Как и наши бурятские братья любят, в игру добавлены элеметы 3D, которые смотряться крайне убого, как и во всех подобных играх с онемешным уклоном. Также, из-за тех же спрайтов, персонажи выглядят слишком картонными, что опять же не позволяет мне назвать игру идеальной.

-[i]Линейность.[/i] Да, это очевидно, ибо всё должно было закончиться так, как и планировалось, но всё равно, почему я не могу исследовать улики не зависимо от стадии расследования? При этом, никакие дейтсвия игрока не влиют на концовку - пройди наши пазлы и всё тут.


[u]Вердикт : 9/10[/u] , не смотря ни на какие минусы, игра получилась крайне добротной, по скидке-грех не взять, хотя за такую игру, я бы даже отдал в два раза больше, не смотря на свою рассовую пренадлежность. Очень годно, стильно, молодёжно.

26421641.review:
This is the first visual novel I've ever played (I skipped danganropa: trigger happy havoc because I watched the anime already) and man was I in for a ride. At first I was a little skeptical about the trials of the game and how difficult they would be to figure out. For every trial I thought I knew who the killer was, but I turned out to be wrong for all but one of them. As for the story it was unexpectedly of the highest quality, it contained crazy yet reasonable plot twists and dark yet meaningful themes. The characters were very well developed and I found myself being attached to many of them which made things quite emotional for me as this is obviously a game where many people die. Despite the tragic content of the game, I found that the inclusion of humor helped supplement my desire to play it even more as it added more diversity too it. After I finished I even found myself desperate to find more danganropa content. I watched the new danganropa anime and spent hours trying to find info on the new game that is to be released in january 2017 on ps4 in Japan. In other words it was extremely addicting :)

Final Verdict: 8.5/10 (Extremely high quality and addictive)

26418880.review:
肝了三天，游戏时间58小时通关，整个人都绝望了。我玩游戏向来不喜欢看剧情，对galgame没什么兴趣兴趣，所以玩不多。但也不是没打过，第一次看到游戏剧情这么暴走，编剧不停挖坑，最大的坑还是在游戏最后一章才挖出来，然后用两部动画剧情来填上的。

系列第一部我是在NDS上玩，因为实在肝不动所以当时只打了一半，剧情是靠动画补上的，第二部竟然就不出相应动画，然后出了二代的前传和后篇，最后勾结G胖，在动画播放期间打起了折。这招实在是太TM 高明了，我买还不行吗！！！！

剧情是脑洞向的，所以别指望在游戏能体现什么深刻的思想哲理和人生的高度，要这种请出门左转找CLANNAD。

整人难度的学级裁判简直让人绝望，这不是因为它在逻辑上多难，而是很多情况下，你是在根本没看懂游戏规则的情况下游戏就开始了，当你想回头看规则的时候，才发现在环节中是不能看回看聊天记录的。这就像游戏作者在开始就设定好的，“你体验过绝望吗？”

你要问我滋不滋瓷，我还是滋瓷的。平时工作完，很累，再来两盘dota简直是找虐。GAL最大的好处在于打起来轻松，杀杀时间。[spoiler] 反正我又没女朋友[/spoiler]

略有扯远，最后还是推荐一下弹丸，整体游戏品质不错，剧情的表现力在GAL中属于上乘，游戏性也相当的高，不会说一个手柄一个A键按到底，完美的节奏，优质的立绘，恰到好处的BGM，再加上声优的卖力演出加持，配合动画食用效果更佳在。

GAL中，10分满分我能给个8.5分。

[spoiler] 最后的最后——我要立志成为超高校级的胖次收藏家！[/spoiler]

26416339.review:
If you liked Phoenix Wright, you'll probably enjoy this. If you liked Danganronpa 1, you'll enjoy this even more.

The plot is even more fucked up and amazing than in the previous game. Very linear, which is a tad annoying at times, but overall linearity didn't feel like a detriment to the game.
Trials, which are the most fun part of the game, feel tense and powerful.
Don't expect very complex gameplay, it's a visual novel after all. However, gameplay in the sequel has expanded upon the original.
Music is great in my opinion, I enjoyed it a lot. Same goes for the characters.
Voice acting is mostly limited to cutscenes and trials, the quality of it is on par.
Also, the game is pretty long. A single chapter can take as long as 5 hours. However it's not required to sit through a chapter in one sitting, the game does an alright job splitting chapters into segments.

26355087.review:
I wasn't as taken with the characters overall this time around (Nekomaru's the best boy hands-down though), but DGR2 is still well worth your time if you enjoyed the first game.

Aside from the endless debate portions, just abandon any existing expectations you might have for the class trials and get ready for truth blades and logic dives! Logic dive is by far my favourite new feature in class trials. It's a really fun minigame that's vaguely reminiscent of SSX and Wipeout combined.

The voice acting is marvelous and if you're a big enough weeb, you're probably going to hear some people you recognise.

My only real complaint is that they call the hangman's gambit "improved" when actually I think they kinda mangled it compared to the DGR1 version. There are certain times where you just have to resign yourself to taking damage because the letters are all over the place and on a super-fast collision course with eachother.

As usual, expect twists, turns and and an amazing, energizing soundtrack.

26161501.review:
Давно хотел написать, но всё как то руки не доходили. Отнесу это сразу к обоим частям игры.

Две эти части стали моей любимой вселенной за очень короткое время, чему я оказался крайне удивлен и рад, потому что ничего обычно так не привлекало моё внимание, как в этот раз

Всё просто, сначла ты учишь имена персонажей, бурча про то что никто тебе не нравится, и все они какие то скучные... Находишь вайфу(может даже несколько), начинаешь сохнуть по ней, и в итоге начинается сюжет. Проходит время, и ты начинаешь вникать, вливаться в этот мир, и вот персонажи уже не такие и скучные, они просто прекрасны! Казалось бы - всё прекрасно, но нет. Обязательным критерием обоих частей является неминуемая смерть персонажей, хочешь ты этого или нет, игра хочет, чтобы ты прочувствовал это ОТЧАЯНИЕ с ног до головы, что действительно будоражит, потому что сюжет действительно хорош, четко продуман и проработан; наблюдать за происходящим доставляет одно удовольствие(ну или боль)

Геймплейная составляющая проста и сложна одновременно - основной частью игры является составляющая новеллы, но помимо этого есть некий "судебный процесс", о котором я говорить не буду, потому что без спойлеров трудно(но он очень интересен!). Мы должны разбираться в смертях своих друзей и выявлять убийцу(чаще всего это тоже больно, мне кажется, я - мазохист).

В итоге, вся всленная определенно требует вашего внимания если вы определенно ЛЮБИТЕ новеллы. Если вы не фанат таковых, то вам будет сложно подолгу читать тонны текста.
Вселенная затягивает, что не есть плохо. Также, недавно закончилось аниме, которое завершило все происходящие события во второй и первой части игры, что я тоже, определенно, рекомендую посмотреть.

Обе части заслуживают честных 8.5\10, would watch my waifu die again(not)

[spoiler]KIBOU KIBOU KIBOU KIBOU KIBOU KIBOU KIBOU[/spoiler]

26131382.review:
***SE RECOMIENDA ALTAMENTE HABER JUGADO "DANGANRONPA: TRIGGER HAPPY HAVOC" O haber visto la primera temporada del anime para disfrutar mejor de la historia y/o entenderla mejor*** (No es obligatorio pero disfrutarás más la experiencia que te ofrece el juego).

Si te gustó el Primer Danganronpa, este te encantará aún más 8,5/10 

PROS:

+Nuevos y variados personajes bastante interesantes.
+Nuevas y diversas zonas que explorar.
+Nuevos "minijuegos" durante los Class Trials.
+Mejora de Interfaces.
+Nueva banda sonora con algunas canciones o toques de la anterior entrega.
+Voice Acting en Inglés (Personalmente me gustó mucho).
+ALTAMENTE Adictivo.

CONT:

-El minijuego de Monomi.
-El minijuego de la Mascota.
-La "mejora" del minijuego "The Hangman's Gambit" (Personalmente no me gustó demasiado).

---------------------

En esta segunda entrega de Danganronpa nuestros personajes son llevados a un resort situado en unas islas paradisíacas. En un principio se nos dice que estamos de "viaje escolar para hacernos amigos y conocernos mejor" pero como podréis esperar con la aparición de Monokuma se le da la vuelta al asunto y el feliz viaje se convierte en un terrible juego de asesinos donde solo el ganador podrá abandonar la isla.

Al estar atrapados en una isla desierta y no en una escuela, nos da la oportunidad de poder visitar gran variedad de escenarios donde podrán ocurrir todo tipo de eventos, investigando la isla en busca de una salida, podremos ver desde un resort hasta una base militar pasando por un gran número de escenarios de todo tipo. Los nuevos y carismáticos personajes aportan aún más diversidad al juego ya que cada uno es diferente y no hay dos personas con la misma personalidad y/o el mismo carácter. Incluyendo los asesinatos que cada uno es más curioso y misterioso que el anterior.

La banda sonora también ha mejorado lo suyo aportando nuevas y fantásticas canciones (Como por ejemplo "Ekoroshia" ) y añadiendo varias del primer juego con pequeños cambios (Ejemplo: Re_Trial Underground) que van a la perfección con las diversas situaciones en las que nos encontramos en el juego.

Otro aspecto que hay que destacar son los nuevos "minijuegos" o "puzles" de los Class Trial. Como por ejemplo "Rebuttal Showdown" o "Logic Dive" que le dan variedad al juego y te ayudan a resolver mejor el caso e interactuar con las opiniones y los argumentos de los demás personajes para llegar a resolver el caso. También podemos ver que han mejorado algunos aspectos de los minijuegos con respecto al primer juego. 

---------------------

(Esto es opinión 100% pura y dura x'D)

Todo lo bueno también tiene cosas malas... En mi opinión aunque el juego me parece bastante mejor que el primero aun se podrían pulir varias cositas, principalmente el minijuego de "The Hangman's Gambit" ya que han dado un paso atrás y no me gusta su funcionamiento ya que si te descuidas un segundo la pantalla se te llena de letras que al chocar unas con otras te bajan la vida de forma considerable. (Gran parte de mis Game Over han sido por este minijuego x'D).

Otra cosa que no me acaba de gustar es el minijuego de la mascota de Monomi, siendo sincera no está mal pero lo veo totalmente inútil ya que no te aporta nada a la historia y con él solo te dan varios logros en steam (si mal no recuerdo).

Para finalizar quiero añadir que he disfrutado muchísimo el juego y que lo recomiendo muchísimo. Al finalizarlo también recomiendo ver los animes "Danganronpa 3: Future/Desepair Arc" ya que ayudan a entender más la historia y complementan varios aspectos y eventos que se mencionan en este juego.

26096818.review:
Testing ... Testing ...
Hello boys and girls! It is time for a review!

My first one, actually ... weird ...

Anyway, to simply put my upcoming statements and opinions into a simple sentence:
[h1]Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair is an amazing game ... but only for the group of people who would be interested in playing it.[/h1]

Sure Sure Sure, that sounds like the same thing you should say for any game, right? However, I find that that is very true of this particular game. This game can be very selective on who would, and wouldn't, enjoy it. I do believe that anyone can pick up, play this game, and completely enjoy everything about it, even though they don't normally like the kind of games that DR2GD (that's short for Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair) is in the same category of, but this game still isn't the perfect game that would appeal to all of the people! However, it is safe to say that if you like games with a lot of mystery and solving those mysteries (Like Ace Attorney games and whatnot) then you'll like this one mainly because that is the biggest and most defining element for this game series ... except for one of the games in the series, but you won't find that game on Steam! Yet! ... maybe  ... puhuhuhuhuhuuuuu!

[b]PREREQUISITES[/b]

First of all, you [b]HAVE[/b] to play the first game: Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc!
It is equally amazing and sets the stage for a lot of what happens in this game. I mean, this game is the [u]SEQUEL[/u] to that game! So, go give Danganronpa 1 a shot before going into this game. If you don't like Danganronpa 1 for its [u]story-telling[/u], [u]gameplay[/u], [u]overall design[/u], or WHATEVER, then this game may not be for you. It will build off of the things that you hated in the first one, so it may be just more of what you hate.

Got it? Alright! If you've played the first Danganronpa, and/or are curious about whether the game is a worthy successor to the first one and/or a good game in general and/or just kinda bored and thought you'de go on a steam-review-reading-frenzy because ... well I don't know ... you're bored or something? ... then buckle up and get ready to FEEL DESPAIR!
I mean ... read the review! Yeah ... that ...

[b]STORY[/b]

I am NOT going to spoil the story for DR2GD for two reasons:
[olist]
[*]If I spoiled the game, why would you want to play it?
[*]IT WOULD TAKE WAY TO LONG TO SAY THE ENTIRE STORY AT CLOSE TO MIDNIGHT ON A MONDAY! I AM NOT PREPARED FOR THAT KIND OF COMMITMENT!
[/olist]

I can, however, summarize the basic gist of the story so that you know what you are in for. If you've played the first Danganronpa game, then you know what is basically going to happen:
[list]
[*]You are boy.
[*]You wake up on strange island with a class of people you have never met before.
[*]Everything seems strange and unsettling, but soon becomes sunshine and rainbows!
[*]The future seems hopeful and the other people on the island seem nice.
[*]PSYCH!
[*]You and your friends are now apart of a horrible game where everyone is forced to try to kill eachother without getting caught by a trial run by that same group of friends.
[*]You are the main boy who plays a large role in helping to catch the killer, or the "blackened" as a certain stuffed-bear in the game calls them.
[*]Everything pretty much goes downhill from there.
[/list]

The story is kinda sad, honestly. You spend a lot of time getting to know these characters, whom you know as your friends, only to end up watching them die at the hands of the people you still feel are your friends. It really bums you out! I would feel slightly depressed from all of the stuff that happens in the game, and a lot of that depressing stuff is in the form of horrible murders that you have to investigate and then have to pin on one of your friends with evidence! However, all of this sadness plays into the bigger parts of the story, and makes the ending feel amazing to witness. In order to know how the game ends, you have to beat the game ... after you beat the first one too ... because it's all one intertwined mess ... AND I LOVE IT!

[b]GAMEPLAY[/b]

The main game is split into two styles: Daily Life and Deadly Life.
Daily Life is when you can walk around the island and talk to the other students! You can use these opportunities to give them gifts that you can buy with coins that you collect from [u]PLAYING THE GAME[/u]! By giving characters gifts, you can become closer to them, and learn more information about them. A lot of these characters are very interesting, so I think you'll find at least one person that you'de like to get to know better! However, becoming friends with characters DOES NOT CHANGE THE OUTCOME OF THE MURDERS! You may end up becoming friends with someone who gets killed or is the killer! Your heart may be broken by this, and it sucks! You'll sometimes be trying to get to know everything about someone to get an achievment or just to know them as another character, BUT THEY'LL DIE BEFORE YOU EVEN GET THE CHANCE!
Spoiler about this game mechanic: [spoiler] I beat the game on the hardest difficulty and was able to unlock Island Mode, which is basically just Daily Life forever, AND NOBODY DIES so you can become friends with everyone! [/spoiler]

The second part of the gameplay is the Deadly Life. Deadly Life is the investigation part that happens after a body has been discovered. You will look for clues and then participate in a class trial to find the true killer! Finding evidence involves [i]some[/i] walking around, but is mostly just pointing and clicking things in rooms that pertain to the case. The class trail is a bunch of minigames that revolve around everyone trying to answer questions about the case, defend themselves, or piece together the events of the case. Most of this is also pointing and clicking, but there are sometimes word-puzzles, multiple choice questions, a platformer-decision-making minigame, and rhythm games.

This game involves a lot of clicking. You will sometimes use the keyboard to get to the main menu and walk around, but most of the game is clicking.

Another big part of the game is reading! Please be able to read when playing this game! ALSO BE READY TO SIT THROUGH A LOT OF DIALOGUE! If you are the kind of person who hates cutscenes and would rather play the game, ignore the urge to skip through text. THE DIALOGUE IS IMPORTANT! It conveys the story and gives clues to what the evidence means and how it can relate to the case! There are also sounds, and sometimes entire lines have voice overs for them, so be ready to hear a lot of "hmms" and "HEY BASTARD"s and "I see ..."s and "YOU'RE THE ONLY ONE"s during your playtime.

The sounds are actually pretty good, I must say ...

[b]E V E R Y T H I N G - E L S E[/b]

Uhh ... listen ... this game is just good ...
If you like mild horror and a lot of suspense and thrills: Play this game.
If you enjoy mystery based games: Play this game.
If you played the first game and loved that game to pieces: Play this game.
If you got two hands and one has a plate of cookies on it and the cookies are made of $100 bills: Let me have some of those "cookies", buy this game, and then play this game.

This is the part of my first review where I get really tired and rethink my life choices ...
I might revisit this review to "finish" it ... but not right now ... becuase sleep ... and boredom ...

Danganronpa 2 is a masterpiece. There's no other way to describe it. For all the good the first game does, the second does even more. Improvments to the class trials, with additions like logic dives and an improved and more engaging hangman's gambit, help to make them even more engaging than they were in the first game. 26076104.review:
Okay. So I decided to make an [i] actual [/i] review this time. In the last one I only said that the game's freaking good - which is true, but probably wouldn't convince anyone to actually play it. So yup, making a new one.

So, why is Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair so good? If you've played the first one, you already know what the game is like. Investigation. Friendship. Murder. Yup, pretty much all that repeats in DR2. And yet, this one is even better than the first. The characters are so unique here. Your (Hajime's) interactions with them and their interactions with each other are so meaningful, and everything is just so real. When one of them dies, you kind of feel like a part of you have died too. You really are able to form a [b] bond [/b] with all of them.

IIIIf amazing & unique characters aren't enough for you, well, I must also say that the cases are REALLY interesting and full of amazing plot twists in DR2. Even when you think you know what's going on, even when you think you know everything that is going to happen, BOOOOM PLOTWIST! Sometimes, the character you love the most will be the killer - Sometimes they will be the victim. That's just how it is here. 

I need to mention that the soundtrack is aaaaamaaaaaazing as well. It can change the mood completely. The characters' voice fit their personalities perfectly, too. There are some memorable laughs ([spoiler] Komaeda <3 Mikan <3 [/spoiler]) and speeches that are sure to stay in your head.

Damn, this game is awesome. It's worth every penny. Tbh I kind of want to erase my memories of it so I can play it again and again and again and again and get surprised over and over and over again.

Anyway. If you read until this point and this review convinced you, I wish you a nice trip! It's gonna be totally worth it, I swear. Puhuhuhu.

Отличная игрушка  с отличным сюжетом, персонажами, саундтреком и всем всем прочим. 
Так и хочется нахваливать эту игру за столь приятно проведенное время, что я провел за ней. 
Из единственных минусов, которые хочется отметить - язык, но если  есть желание, то и это не проблема!
С самого начала игры ты втягиваешься в эту безумную атмосферу, которую нам преподносит автор. Ты напрягаешь всевозможные извилины, чтобы разгадывать загадки, что даются над одна за одной. Какие только теории не строишь в попытках понять,  что же ждет тебя в дальнейшем. А какие там персонажи! Пожалуй, нет такого человека, которому не понравился хоть один персонаж. Все эти персонажи оказались мне по душе, всем им я  сопереживал и каждый из них отпечатался у меня в памяти. Цена полностью оправдывает себя, ведь за эту сумму мы получаем такую удивительную историю, о которой будет что вспомнить. 
Вообщем, всем  советую пройти это и вы ни капельки не пожалеете о потраченном времени!

连续几个通宵补完二代，真的停不下来，好久没有玩到那么爽快又燃的推理游戏了，绝对推荐！！
作为一个悬疑推理游戏，前三章给我的感觉是普通的达到平均水准
第四章比较出彩，这个杀人手法真是令人眼前一亮，另外真是给狛哥的智商跪了。
至于第五章，节奏给人很紧迫，非日常篇刚结束的时候我是一脸懵逼的，学级裁判的时候暂停了好几次，剧情连续反转真的是太荡气回肠了，也真的太虐了。不得不说第五章可以说是弹丸系列的巅峰之作，[spoiler]希望与希望的终极对决，狛枝的希望与七海的希望之间激烈碰撞，小天使的决意让我泪崩，狛枝最后的留言更是神来之笔。正如希望会产生绝望一般，最黑暗的绝望中必然会孕育出最强大的希望[/spoiler]狛枝凪斗和七海千秋，已经很久没有遇到让我这么震撼的人物了，这两个人物的刻画实在是太出色，尤其是狛枝，弹丸一直以来的卖点——悬疑推理也成了刻画角色的附属品，也无怪乎其人气甚至超过主角。
终章也很不错，创哥太燃了，[spoiler]看到盾子被莫诺美揍真是大快人心。[/spoiler]

总而言之这游戏的价值超划算，还不赶快买买买！
看完动画心疼一下七海小天使，唉，不过还是感谢小高给力二代一个好结局。

25858144.review:
Where do I start with this game..  At first it felt like a thoughtless sequel that attempts to copy the original while trying to make everything bigger and better. You thought some characters in the first game were too exaggerated/comical? Now [i]every[/i] character is a silly caricature. You thought the first story was stupid at times? Now it's completely off the charts and abandons all realism. The world is bigger, there're more trial mini-games and now there're time-wasting mini-games even outside of trials. The murders are even more convoluted and at times don't make any sense whatsoever.  Halfway through the game I was almost ready to leave it unfinished and uninstall it, so frustrated I was with it.  

But despite all I decided to complete it for the sake of completion. I arrived at the last chapter and suddenly things got interesting again. And then suddenly everything started to make sense. And then suddenly it was 6am because I spent all night playing. 
Looking back most grievances I've had with the game make complete sense within the story now that I have the big picture. In fact, it's very difficult to view them as grievances at all anymore. Was the twist worth the frustration? It kind of was, the ending was very satisfying. It was probably also partly my fault not to see the twist coming and to just assume that the writers are stupid. 
That being said, the point about the trials still stands. A couple of cases don't make a lot of sense and have very weird solutions.  The new trial mini-games are also needlessly complicated and aren't very fun.  
But it's hardly a deal breaker. The game is still good.

Danganronpa 2 mach eigentlich genau das selbe was der erste Teil gemacht hat und das ist auch gut so.

Vorweg aber auch von mir der Hinweis man sollte doch erst Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc gespielt haben oder zumindestesn den Anime dazu geschaut haben bevor man dieses Spiel spielt.
Und auch hier gilt das es von enormen Vorteil ist wenn man vorab nichts über die Story weis.

Positive:
Klasse Story
Wieder mal viele verschiedene (teils verrückte) Charaktere mit jeder seiner eigenen Geschichte.
Passender Soundtrack.
Super Charakterdisgn

Negative:
Teilweise ziemlich zähes lesen
Die paar nervige extras wie die sache mit den Geschenken oder das Pet
Einige Neuerungen im Class Trial (neue oder abgänderte Minispiele) haben mir perönlich im ersten Teil besser gefallen
Keine deutschen Texte

Ja am Anfangen hat mir der Stil eigentlich nicht gefallen. Auf der Inseln war dei Atmoshäre nicht besonders gut und Monomi hat ziemlich genervt. Doch mit der Zeit entwickelt sich änlich wie beim ersten Teil die Story und am Schluss hat mir das ende sogar besser gefallen als in Teil 1.

Ich kann jedem dem der erste Teil gefallen hat dieses Spiel auf jeden fall empfehlen

25837828.review:
挺有意思的遊戲。跟前作比較起來，推理難度更高，推理小遊戲更多樣化，劇情安排有給人驚喜到，很多情節發展讓人意想不到，而且前後有呼應到，銜接的不錯。

人設也挺有趣，但相較於前作的人設來說，較不討人喜歡，對個人而言啦。

槍彈辯駁2代相較於1代推理難度高很多，尤其是在辯駁時，可選擇的言彈多了許多，有些答案又很相近，有些題目出的更是雲裡霧裡，本身就讓人迷惑問題在哪了，再配上那至少5個以上的可選答案，為辯駁時增加了難度，常常有已經知道兇手是誰了，但辯駁答案怎麼選都選不對的狀況XD

而2代的推理方式又新增了一種，思維入侵(滑板跑道小遊戲)，算是挺有創意，但很無聊，感覺只是多個變化讓人消磨時間，應該是讓有強迫症的人多花時間重覆玩出好成績的詭計XD

說到推理，2代的推理時間更長了，常常玩個一局班級審判要一個小時以上，有時候玩的不好想重玩，快轉也要十幾分鐘，算是挺消磨時間。更不用說跟(非)日常的活動對話與搜索線索的時間相加了，經常玩個一章都要三個小時以上，玩到最後真的會讓人膩味
，只想快進看劇情了。

而推理難度難度提升，尤其是第四章，真的是玩到要猜誰是犯人時還讓人不知犯人是誰，甚至是作案方式也是看劇情發展才慢慢有個大概，後來個人總結了一下，其實並不是這謎題藏的很深，而是線索不足，還有作者腦洞太大。

仔細想想，整個房間都是電梯已經很不合理了，然後又是只靠地板來升降，握草，那代表電梯的樓層多高，那地板下承載的螺桿長度就要有多長，地下就得有多深了，難怪讓人不會去懷疑，整個就不合理XD；還有那天花板，忘了劇情是怎麼解釋的了，不過整個挑空的建築，應該也會有蛛絲馬跡出來(不過因為這是虛擬世界，也就隨作者怎麼掰了)

而除了第四章推理難度高外，第五章的推理倒是簡單了許多，不過卻讓人印象深刻，因為狛枝凪斗這角色實在是太瘋狂病態了。比本作的主角日向創還像主角，個性也很神經質、為所欲為，把眾人和自己都當作棋子來看待，敢佈局、敢涉險、敢博奕、敢玩命，
行動力強，腦洞也很大，如果把狛枝凪斗和江之島盾子這兩人物比較起來的話，會發現前者的氣場比後者來的強得多，比較具有BOSS風彩，相較之下江之島盾子則像是神經病中二一樣，整個莫明其妙XD

而結局嘛~依舊是老生常談的希望戰勝了絕望，可謂之正義必勝XD。當然如果想了解整個故事來源和真結局的話，可以去補一下各作品的劇情。

順序來講的話是：槍彈辯駁ZERO(小說)->槍彈辯駁1->絕對絕望少女(動作遊戲，算是外篇)->槍彈辯駁1 if(小說，算是另一個世界線的故事)->槍彈辯駁2->槍彈辯駁3未來篇(動畫)->絕望篇(動畫)->希望篇(動畫)

其中絕望篇的故事算是跟槍彈辯駁ZERO發生在同一時期的，但如果沒有玩過槍彈辯駁2大概很難理解故事內容，所以放在後面。

最後來個系列總結，劇情腦洞中二，人設鮮明有趣，推理熱血獨特，對白逗比搞笑。其中較為致命的缺點就是基本設定與世界觀崩壞太過導致沒有代入感。

原本以為看的是學園推理，最後卻變成了科幻異能XD

25832667.review:
This is easily the best game I've in a long time. I try to play games from every genre so I can discover new game elements that I really enjoy, and therefore better determine which games I should and shouldn't buy. While I have enjoyed playing visual novel games in the past, they've never really left me feeling too impressed. My problem with the genresis that you can often just watch a walkthough of these games and get pretty much the same experience since they tend to be entirely plot driven with little, if any, gameplay. However, I quickly discovered that Danganronpa is nothing like most visual novels.

So you might be thinking, "There's no way a game where you mostly read text can have good gameplay!." 
Well then, ALLOW ME TO CUT THROUGH THOSE WORDS.

The gameplay features exploration, searching for clues, literally shooting the words out of peoples mouths, and praying to every god to spare the lives of your favorite characters (Side Note: If you play strategy games, don't expect any help from RNGesus). The main gameplay takes place during the Trials. Here, you use your own logic to prove or disprove your classmates assertations, figure out how the clues you've gathered fit together, and determine truth behind each murder. The game also has a variety of minigames with each trial that require a mix between logic and some skill to complete. While the trial can get difficult at times, the game offers three difficulty settings for both the minigames and the trials; appealling to players that would prefer to progress through the story or, alternatively, overcome despair through an incredible challenge.

"Well, if the developer's put this much effort into the gameplay, then the story must not be that great." 
NO, THAT'S WRONG!!!

The story-telling in this game is beyond compare (except, to it's predecessor). The story in this game will put you on an emotional rollercoaster. The whole time you will be filled with suspense, heartbreak, excitement, depression, fear, anxiety, and determination. All while being caught in a tug-of-war between hope and despair. 

"But a game's plot is never enough, unless the characters are also great!" 
I AGREE WITH THAT!

Which is each and every character in this game are so well developed. As progress through the game and learn more to about each of them, you'll slowly find yourself emotionally attached to them. I'd say be careful not to get too attached like every other reviewer will tell you, but the reality is, you won't have choice. And honestly, befriending and becoming close to characters in this game is arguably the best part about it. It sucks when you lose your favorite character, but it makes you that much happier when they survive. And even when they do die, you come to appreciate the impact they had on you, and you become determined to keep moving forward for thier sake.

"WOW THIS GAMES SOUNDS AMAZING NOW! But how do I know that this game is really worth spending my money on?"
I CAN PROVE IT WITH THIS!

You've already read this far into my review. If you didn't think you would buy this game this game, you would have ignored this review because of how long it was and looked at the really funny reviews instead. Clearly, you're too interested to not play this game.

(Side Note: If you haven't already, make sure you play the first game before this one. While I personally think this one has better gameplay and a much storyline, you'll enjoy it even more if you play through the first game. And if you have played the first game, why are you reading this review. You should playing this game right now.)

Now stop reading this and press that "Add to Cart button". DO IT. DO IT FOR HOPE.
