25766690.review:
Сказать то, что я был рад анонсу PC-версии Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair — значит ничего не сказать. Еще не остывшие очень приятные впечатления от первой части сопровождались многочисленными заявлениями знакомых с игрой людей, утверждающих что вторая часть лучше первой в два/пять/десятки раз, что больше подогревало мои ожидания. И не поймите меня неправильно, игрой я более чем остался доволен, но с этими утверждениями я все же готов поспорить.

Для полноты картины советую ознакомиться с [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/avtechnick/recommended/413410/]обзором на первую часть игры[/url], далее пойдет традиционный список удачных и не очень, по моему мнению, вещей в игре. 

Итак, начнем с плюсов:
[list]
    [*]Мономи, она же Девочка-волшебница Чудо ★ Усами — чуть ли не самый лучший персонаж в игре. Ее характер, ее музыкальная тема, а ее игра на контрастах с Монокумой... просто бесценна. 
    [*]Новый состав персонажей, как и в первой части, представляет собой такой же разношерстный набор ярких, интересных и просто приятных личностей, [strike]Chiaki one love[/strike].
    [*]Сюжет при схожей с предшественником схеме повествования включает в себя несколько довольно занятных плот-твистов.
    [*]Отдельно стоит упомянуть значительно возросший уровень драматизма в отдельных сценах. Если же в первой части от подобных сцен максимум у меня щемило в груди, то во время прохождения второй части в трех местах у меня слезы на глазах просто ручьем текли.
    [*]Суды по сравнению с первой частью стали напорядок длиннее и запутаннее. В геймплейном плане почти то же самое, разве что добавили пару-тройку неплохо вписывающихся мини-игр.
    [*][spoiler]Ну и невероятно вдохновляющий финал.[/spoiler]
[/list]

А теперь настал черед высказаться о нескольких вещах, которые местами уж сильно портили общие впечатления:
[list]
    [*]Сценаристы заимели у себя крайне неприятную привычку — если у персонажей есть какая-нибудь выходящая за рамки ординарного черта характера, то сценаристы начинают выдавливать ее по полной программе безо всякого чувства меры. И если эти странности в начале еще выглядят занимательными, то к концу уже начинает надоедать, а то и вовсе раздражать.
    [*]Разработчики в этот раз сильно перемудрили с уровнем творящегося на экране безумия, и если происходящее в первой части еще с ее дивными поворотами сюжета еще как-то держало себя в руках, то тут некоторые моменты просто скатываются в лютый фарс и неадекват, и даже финишный «обоснуй» не особо не помогает. А некоторые казни а то и вовсе оставляли с вопросом «Простите, что, б♥♥?».
    [*]В сюжете есть иногда провисающие моменты, когда одни плот-твисты виднеются за версту, а другие просто не заслуживают нагоняемой интриги.
    [*]И напоследок, булщитный в первой части Bullet Time Battle во второй части мутировал в более булщитный Panic Talk Action.
[/list]

Как итог скажу, что Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair — это более чем достойный сиквел, но ни в коем случае не превосходящий оригинал. Безумная атмосфера за редкими исключениями бережно сохранена, история такая же занимательная, а расследования и суды такие же интересные. Если вам понравилась первая часть, то ознакомление со второй чуть ли не обязательна.

[spoiler]P.S.: F♥ck Nagito[/spoiler]

25696080.review:
[Play Time] : 85.5시간 (도전과제 100% 달성기준, 한글패치 有)

[게임장르]
: 추리 어드벤쳐

[게임소개]
: '절망' vs '희망'의 2라운드 대결~


[한줄 평]
: 할인 없이 구매해도 충분히 제 값하는 게임

<참고사항>
 - 좀 더 재미있는 플레이를 위해서는 단간론파1을 먼저 플레이 하실것을 권고드립니다.
   (또는 단간론파1 애니메이션을 보셔도 무방합니다)
 - 2편에는 단간론파1편의 강력 스포가 포함되어 있습니다.
 - 단간론파 3편(희망편, 절망편) 애니메이션을 보셨다면 재미가 반감될 수 있습니다.


[게임평가]
: 본 작품은 단간론파 2번째 작품인 '단간론파2 : 안녕 절망학원' 입니다. 장르는 추리 어드벤쳐로 '절망'(악의 축)으로 부터 살아남기 위해 발생되는 살인사건들을 해결하고 해당 사건들의 진정한 흑막을 찾기 위해 진실을 파헤치는 것이 본 작품의 목표라고 볼 수 있습니다.

 본 작품(단간론파2: 안녕 절망학원)은 '절망(악)'과 '희망(선)'의 대립을 그리고 있으며 등장인물들은 절망이라는 마수로 부터 벗어나 이 사건의 진상에 다가가기 위해 진실을 파헤쳐야 한다는 스토리텔링과 세계관 설정은 일반적인 추리물에 비해 매우 흥미롭다고 볼 수 있습니다.

 또한 자신의 장점에 특화되어 있는 초교교급(게이머, 야쿠자, 희망, 요리사 등등)으로 개성넘치고 매력가득한 등장인물들이 등장함에 따라 스토리의 몰입도와 흥미가 한층 더해집니다.

 하지만 흥미있는 세계관과 매력과 개성 넘치는 등장인물들로 인해 게임 자체가 스토리 중심으로 맞춰지다 보니 추리보다는 스토리 위주로 맞춰져 있으며 추리도 전체적으로 난이도가 높지 않고 대다수 아케이트 형식(미니게임 형식)으로 이루어져 있기 때문에 추리게임 매니아 분들은 조금 실망할 수 있을 것으로 보입니다. 추리를 좋아하시는 분들은 추리게임 보다는 포인트 앤 클락 형식의 어드벤쳐로 추리요소가 포함되어 있는 게임으로 접근하시는 것이 좋겠습니다.

 위에서 설명한 스토리 중심의 추리게임이라는 것을 추가 설명하자면 일반적인 추리물들은 본질(진실)에 점차 다가가기 위해 증거물(힌트)를 찾아야만 합니다. 다만, 일반 추리게임들을 조그마한 증거들을 찾기 위한 과정이 하나의 스토리라인으로 볼 수 있지만 본 작품(단간론파)는 원활한 스토리 진행을 위해 증거물(힌트)들의 습득이 쉬워야 하기에 스토리라인 보다는 아이템 형식이라고 볼 수 있습니다.

 그리고 증거물이 모두 수집되면 학급재판이 열리게 되고 등장인물들과의 토론을 통해 범인을 찾아내게 되는데 본 작품의 제목으로 유추할 수 있듯 수집된 증거물들을 통해 상대방의 대화에 동의 또는 반론을 통해 진실을 찾아내야 합니다.

 본 작품은 일어, 영어 풀 보이스를 지원하고 있으며 약 30 ~ 35시간의 플레이 타임을 요구 합니다. 그리고 본 편을 클리어 했다면 클리어 특전인 '단간 아일랜드', '매지컬 미라클 걸 모노미', '단간론파 IF 소설'을 플레이가 가능합니다.

<클리어 특전 게임 소개>
I. 단간 아일랜드
 (1) 장르: 연애물

 (2) 게임소개: 우사미(모노미)가 모노쿠마를 쓰려트렸다는 가정하에 진행되는 본래의 목적을 진행

 (3) 플레이 방식
  - 주어진 시간에 재료들을 수집하여 해당 물건을 제작해야 함
  - 해당 목표를 달성하면 외출증(?)을 얻을 수 있으며, 외출증을 통해 상대방과의 러브러브 게이지를 올릴 수 있음
  - 본 작품에서 수집하지 못한 희망의 조각은 단간 아일랜드에서도 얻을 수 있음
  - 본 미니게임의 진엔딩을 보기 위해서는 모든 등장인물들의 희망의 조각을 얻어야만 함.
  - 진엔딩 이후 러브러브 게이지가 꽉찬 등장인물들에 대해 각 등장인물별 진엔딩을 볼 수 있음

 (4) 참고사항
  - 모든 인원의 진엔딩을 보기 위해서는 총 5~6회의 플레이가 필요함 (1회 플레이 타임 2~4시간)
  - 모든 인원의 진엔딩을 본다면 도전과제를 획득할 수 있음
  - 마지막 제작품 (우사미 로봇)을 완성한다면 모노쿠마 메달 300개를 얻을 수 있음
  - 모든 제작품을 100% 완성하기 어려우며, 1회 진행시 러브러브 공략 가능한인원은 최대 4명임


II. 매지컬 미라클 걸 모노미 (1회 플레이 타임 : 약 20 ~ 40분)
 (1) 장르 : 아케이드 
 
 (2) 게임소개 : 러브러브를 향한 모노미의 고군분투 대작전~!

 (3) 플레이 방식
  - 등장인물들을 위해 섬을 지키고 있는 로봇들과 투닥투닥 거리는 아케이드 액션게임
  - 지팡이를 통해 적들을 마법진(동그라미)에 가둬 적들을 처리하면 됨
  - 우사미 게이지가 꽉 차면 잠시동안 우사미로 변신할 수 있으며 공격력과 스테미나가 증가함

 (4) 참고사항
  - 메인 게임의 챕터를 클리어 하면 해당 미니게임의 챕터가 열리는 방식으로 이전 챕터 맵까지 진행이 가능함
  - 지팡이, 리본, 팬티 아이템은 각각 20개씩 존재하며 모두 수집하면 도전과제 획득이 가능함.


III. 단간론파 IF 소설 (플레이 타임 : 약 10분)
 (1) 장르 : 비주얼 노벨
 
 (2) 게임소개 : 단간론파 1편에 대해 다른 결말(가상의 시나리오)를 보여주는 작품임

 (3) 참고사항
 - 단간론파 1편의 등장인물들이 등장하며. 1편 시점이 배경이 됨
 - 단간론파 1편의 등장인물 소개를 볼 수 있으나 실제 본 미니게임을 좀 더 재미있게 즐기기 위해서는 단간론파 1편 플레이 또는 애니메이션을 볼것을 권유함
 - 본 미니게임을 클리어 하게 되면 갤러리 및 영상 항목이 활성화 됨
 - 즉, 도전과제 100% 달성을 하기 위해서는 단간론파 IF 도 클리어가 필수임


[총평]
: 본 작품(단간론파2: 안녕 절망학원)은 '절망'과 '희망'의 대립 구조로 되어 있는 흥미로운 세계관으로써 1편, 3편(희망편, 절망편 *참고: 게임은 3편이 존재하지 않으며 현재 애니메이션 방영중)과의 스토리 연계가 존재합니다. 1편의 스토리를 모른다 하더라도 본작품을 플레이 하는것에 대해서는 문제는 없으나 다만 점차 스토리가 진행되고 진실에 다가가게 되면서 1편의 사건을 언급하게 되기 때문에 1편의 내용을 알고 있어야만 스토리의 몰입도와 재미가 배가 되기에 1편의 내용을 먼저 숙지한 뒤에 플레이 할 것을 추천드립니다. (2편에는 1편의 강력한 스토가 내장되어 있으니 이를 원치 않는 분들은 2편 플레이를 자제하시는 것이 좋으며, 3편 희망편, 절망평 애니메이션 또한 2편의 초~ 강력 스포가 내장되어 있으니 참고 바랍니다.)

 그리고 본 작품 외에 다양한 미니게임들을 즐길 수 있기에 본래 가격으로 구매해도 충분히 제 값을 한다고 보며, 단간론파를 통해 흥미로운 세계관 속에서 개성과 매력 넘치는 등장인물들과 만나보는 것은 어떨까 싶네요~

25648013.review:
- Giocato su PSVita due anni fa -
Voi avete una ragazza. Sì, avete una ragazza. Un po' sulle sue, e vi dà fastidio, con un bel fisico naturale, non derivante dal fitness, un bel seno e una bella faccia. Non ama particolarmente gli animali mentre voi sì, e sebbene vorreste avere sei gatti e un cane è già tanto se potete metterli come sfondo del desktop. Poi un giorno vi svegliate e trovate lei con la sua pancia piatta ad accentuare quella quarta abbondante, gatti che ti miagolano da sotto le lenzuola mentre il cane ti scodinzola perché vuole che lo porti a spasso. 
Ecco, quel "sogno divenuto realtà" è Danganronpa 2, mentre la vita che facevate prima era Danganronpa 1. Tutto sommato, Danganronpa 1 era bello, proponeva qualcosa di ""nuovo"" (tra virgolette perché scenari del genere si erano comunque già visti) e i personaggi ti prendevano.
Ma Danganronpa 2 ha una qualità intrinseca *nettamente* maggiore, tra colpi di scena che vi distruggeranno il cervello (io, ad oggi, ancora piango e rido istericamente) e personaggi (specie uno, chissà chi) che vi attanaglieranno l'anima per farla loro. Solo l'ambientazione, a mio avviso, è inferiore a quella del primo Danganronpa, ma fidatevi che non ha senso discuterne, di una piccolezza simile.
Giusto per, perché di solito faccio analisi per persone che già "conoscono" e non per chi si informa da zero tramite Steam, Danganronpa 2 riprende esattamente il concept del capostipite: un'intera classe scolastica si ritrova "rinchiusa" in un'ambientazione dalla quale è impossibile fuggire senza seguire le regole di chi li ha imprigionati, e la regola principale è, sostanzialmente, uccidersi a vicenda. La cosa buffa sta nel fatto che non sono *costretti* a uccidersi: hanno la possibilità di vivere per sempre là, con cibo, bevande e tutto ciò che vogliono, ma per un motivo o per un altro degli omicidi avverranno comunque.
Tralasciando il lato storyline/narrativo, di cui è altamente difficile parlare per via dei possibilissimi spoilers (ma, ripeto, si sta a livelli eccelsi, con picchi che prendono a schiaffi robe come la morte di Jenny di The Darkness), Danganronpa 2 riesce a migliorarsi anche in qualcosa di leggermente più complesso, il gameplay. Essendo la serie (principale, visto che Another Episode è già un altro genere) una visual novel, è difficile aspettarsi un gameplay degno di nota o anche solo appagante, eppure già il primo Danganronpa non annoiava mai sotto questo punto di vista ma anzi, intratteneva in modo più che buono. E Danganronpa 2 introduce, appunto, sessioni giocate ancora migliori, più divertenti.
Eppure si torna a quanto detto poco fa: ci interessa poco del gameplay, perché resta comunque una visual novel. Sicuramente sarà meno pesante da giocare per chi non è abituato al genere, perché invece di avviare il gioco e aspettarti un libro, si avvierà un *vero* gioco con semplicemente molti dialoghi, ma... ecco, la serie va giocata per ciò che offre al livello di storia, personaggi e caratterizzazione, un po' come la serie Zero Escape (anche se lì già ci sono i puzzles veri e propri), e in particolare Danganronpa 2 va giocato per gli schiaffoni in faccia che ti tira quando meno te l'aspetti, per gli shin shoryuken che ti tira in due punti specifici, e per quel Nagito Komaeda che, signori, è l'ago della bilancia della vostra esistenza: se non vi piace, avete buttato anni a strascicarvi in una sopravvivenza inutile.

25643236.review:
(Note: If you never played a Danganronpa game, I highly suggest you go to Trigger Happy Havoc and play it first before buying this game, as it requires some logic of the first in order for it to make sense.  It is best to go into this series blind, so get a friend and tell them this is the happiest game on earth and watch them doubt you after the prologue.)

Now on to my review:

This game is set on a tropical island.  The characters consist of students of Hope's Peak Academy, a school that only accepts the most talent filled people.  Each character has a talent that defines them.

Your job as the main character is to befriend everyone on the island as they enjoy the tropical environment.  You give gifts to your favorite characters and chat with them under the sun as you work labor under the authority of a magical rabbit.  After reaching the highest in your affinity with your character of choice, you get their underwear. (Because every main character of Danganronpa has to be shipped with every single classmate)


Oh, and apparently the world has gone to hell and meanwhile you're  trapped on a tropical island with a malevolent bear who likes to toy with people like marionettes so.... (If you're wondering about the bunny, she's still there.... as a punching bag)

The gameplay consists of investigating murders as Monokuma tempts your classmates to kill each other in order to escape the island.  After finding clues, you are then taken to the class trial, where you solve the mystery behind each murder.  You fire "truth" bullets at characters statements and use many other methods to paint your way to the truth.  There are other methods as well such as Logic Dive, where you ride a snowboard down Hajime's mind, Hangman's Gambit, which is traffic simulator, and finally pasting panels together to paint the entire story of the investigation. There's also a part in the game where you play a point and click trapped room puzzle (Could never figure out the code without a hint).

The environments are very colorful and diverse.  Each island has a theme, and every area on said island fits the style.  4th Island is probably my favorite for it's catchy and colorful vibes.

The characters are unique and charming with personality.  As you hang out with each of them, you learn about them and bond, and soon, you too shall have a collection of underwear to hang on your wall.  These are well-written characters, and it is well worth the time to read through their dialogue, as you can sort of relate to some of the characters.

The story is well-structured.  It starts out confusing, but trust me, it will make sense as you play through.  The game gives you hints to various scenes that will happen later on, but you probably won't catch them until your second playthrough.  For the game to make sense, multiple playthroughs are required.  Feel yourself drown in Despair again as your classmates die again.

Did I also mention that your favorite character dies?  Your favorite character always die... Always.

Do I have any gripes about this game? Yes I do, they are minor but...

I dislike Chapter 2 , more specifically the extra event.  It felt forced and took me out of the experience of the game for a bit.  Chapter 2 is ok, but I really hate "A Man's Nut"; it's the only time in the game where Hajime breaks character and it annoyed me.

There was a certain thing that happened in Chapter 3 that felt rushed and unfinished (those that played the game will probably know what I am talking about.) 

There are some parts of the game that were translated incorrectly.  I mean, it's not that bad, it just annoys me a bit because I'm somewhat of a grammer nazi.

Now on to my spoiler-y part of my review. Not really a review; just some spoiler-ish saying that will hopefully make you giggle:

[spoiler] RIP Fatogami    I will never forget your lecture on the greatness of fried chicken[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Teruteru      I always hated your perverted ways; your cooking was the best part of you[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Mahiru       We were starting to get along and then you died[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Peko           You will always be the love of Fuyuhiko's life[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Fuyuhiko     I know you didn't die, but your poor eye ball[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Ibuki           You were always there to cheer people up with your music[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Hiyoko        I hated your guts and part of me was sort of happy when you died[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Mikan          I felt so sorry for you at first, but now I don't know[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Nekomaru  The Rejects club feels empty without you[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Gundham   The Demon with a heart of gold who left his hamsters to a meat eater[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Nagito        You will always be my favorite psychodic piece of trash[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Chiaki         You will always be best girl in my heart[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Monomi       You fail at your job as a teacher[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Junko          I never wanted you to come back, but you did anyway[/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Hajime        You will never be the same lovable boy again [/spoiler]
[spoiler] RIP Tomagachi   I forgot to clean your poop for the 10th time now[/spoiler]

Well wow. Danganronpa 2 is just as good as the first. Infact in ways it could be classed as better. The setting of the islands I wasnt as big a fan of, I prefered the hopes peak academy from the first game as a setting, but by no means was it bad. Jabberwock island is an amazing setting still. The characters were more detailed personality-wise, more friendly, and in times more unpredictable. This was by far the best sequel to danganronpa that I could imagine. 

The pc port was all in all amazing, had one issue with the first class trial, [spoiler]When inspecting Byakuya's corpse there was an object that didnt show up when I pressed the y button on the controller and didnt do anything when I hovered over it, unfortunately forgot what object it was as it was a while ago so probably has been fixed by now[/spoiler]

Controls I have no idea about as I used controller, so I can say the controller controls are really good.

Graphics are very similar to the first one, I love the style used though I can imagine some people wouldnt like the 2d sprites for everything.

All in all, this game is 10/10, same as the first one. I really hope when danganronpa 3 comes out we get a pc port. Thank you Spike Chunsoft for a fantastic game :3!

25513298.review:
Everything I liked about the first game, turned up to 21. Because 11 would just be predictable.

The only serious negative thing about this game is that the stakes are so high that I cannot imagine how Danganronpa v3 can be better than this. I'm serious. 

Needless to say, if you didn't enjoyed the first game you shouldn't bother with this. If you played the first game and you enjoyed it, there's no reason not to buy this.

And if you want to get into Monokuma's wild ride, start with the first game (obviously). Danganronpa 1 + Danganronpa 2 + Danganronpa 3 anime = one arc. Yep, they made a 24-episode anime that completes the first arc. Play/watch everything in order.

25505322.review:
Let's start with a few questions to see if this game is right for you:

Did you enjoy the first Danganronpa? y/n
Did you wish that more of your friends died in it? y/n
Did you wish that your heart was repeatedly torn out of your chest just so a sadistic psychopath could get off to your despair? y/n
Did you want to raise a cute little rabbit pet? y/n

If you answered yes to one or more of these questions (except maybe if the last one was the only one you answered yes to), then this is the game for you! It has all of that, plus, probably more unspeakable, despair inducing bits!

25502134.review:
I’ve played [i]Goodbye Despair[/i] before, and I got so excited when they released it on Steam too. This game is really good, just like the first one, [i]Trigger Happy Havoc[/i]. I loved to explore around the island, raising the pets, and of course, interacting with the characters. The trials are pretty good too, and somewhat a bit more complex than the first game. 

The soundtrack is amazing (the mini OST is so good, all the songs are great), just like both English and Japanese VA. I literally have no complains about this game, I loved all the characters and the ending was… [b]Awesome[/b]. Still, the first game is my favorite. But this sequel certainly is worth to play! Because of it I found Nekomaru Nidai, one of my favorite characters from the DGR franchise. Here’s some of his quotes that will change your life forever:

[spoiler]— “Listen up. The secret to being healthy is a good appetite, a good night's sleep, and a good shit!”
— “Eat well! Sleep Well! Shit well!!”
— “Shitting the pants… IS A MARK OF SHAME TO A MAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAN!”
— “The name's NEKOMARU NIDAI!!!! I've been reborn in the rivers of hell!!!!!”
— “As long as you have friends who have your back, you'll be able to clear a path to the future without giving up!”[/spoiler]

10/10, highly recommended and worth every cent!

25474607.review:
[i]Having come off of DR1 and not watched the DR3 anime[/i]

Danganronpa 2 shares a lot of similarities to its prequel and I dare say, shouldn't be played before DR1. The grievances I have w/ the first game still stick, namely its unnecessary inclusion of trial minigames and dated look (though I still like the artstyle).

The killing game takes place in an island, which made it lost the claustrophobic feel I had w/ DR1. Being a sequel, DR2 also dumps a lot of information--especially towards the last two chapters--which might lose you had you not played DR1. The chemistry between the characters here are considerably less apparent than in the first killing game. So DR2 plays more with your brain than your heart, probably partly due to not having the novelty of the first game or having to continue a relatively complicated story.

That said, playing with your brain is definitely what its good at. The game is very, very creative and I loved all its cases, particularly the one in the Funhouse. It maintains a sense of mystery throughout and is constantly full of surprises, with a canon story that follows DR1 really, really well and wraps up satisfyingly towards the end. Just like the first game, I can safely say that this game is worth playing for its story alone.

DR2 is much larger in scale than DR1, is heavy on the exposition but makes a brilliant mystery game. The trials are still easy, but the story is still amazing. The last two chapters are a huge rollercoaster ride and there're a lot of references to the first game as well as cameos which got me by surprise <3.

25417830.review:
เอาละครับ เราก็มาถึงเกม Danganronpa 2 : Goodbye Despair กันล่ะครับ

โดยเกมนี้เป็นเกมแนว  Puzzle + Visual Novel + Dating sims ละมั้งครับ เข้าทางเลยทีนี้ ชอบทุกอย่าง 555555

เอาละครับ มาเริ่มวิจารกันเป็นส่วนๆไปเลย
โดยผมจะแบ่งดังนี้นะครับ
-เนื้อเรื่อง
-ภาพ
-เสียง
-เกมเพลย์
-ราคา และ ความคุ้มค่า

เอาละครับเราไปลุยกันเลย

1.เนื้อเรื่อง

โดยเนื้อเรื่องถือว่าดี ครับ มีครบทุก element จริงๆ ไม่ว่าจะทุกข์ สุข หัวเราะ หรือ ร้องให้ มีครบทุกอย่างจริงๆ ครับ โดยที่เนื้อเรื่องจะทำให้เรารักตัวละครพวกนี้ ไปเรื่อยๆ เหมือนกับแทบไปติดเกาะเดียวกันเลยละครับ โดยที่ตัวเกมนี้ เป็น Visual Novel อาจจะมีปัญหาด้านความเข้าใจอารมณ์ ของตัวละคร ณ ตอนนั้นบ้าง แต่โดยรวมผมถือว่าผ่านครับ 
โดยรวมผมให้ไป 8/10ครับ เนื้อเรื่องค่อนข้างเยี่ยมครับ

2.ภาพ

แน่นอนครับเนื่องจากเกมเป็น Visual Novel ดังนั้นตัวเกมจึงไม่ได้ใส่ใจเรื่องภาพมากนัก แต่เน้นไปทางการพากย์เสียงซะมากกว่า โดยภาพในเกมจะเป็น 2.5D มุมมองด้านข้าง เหมือน Maplestory นั้นแหละครับถ้าเคยเล่น แต่ที่เน้นหนักสำหรับเกมนี้ คงไปอยู่ที่ CG มากกว่า โดยส่วนตัวผมว่า CG ค่อนข้างเยอะครับ ใน 1 Chapter จะมี ราวๆ 7-8 CG เลยด้วยซ้ำ ถึงจะไม่ได้สวยมากก็เถอะ 
โดยรวมเรื่องภาพให้ 5/10 ครับ สำหรับคนที่ชอบภาพเว่อวังอลังการ เลิกหวังไปได้เลย ครับ เกมนี้ภาพธรรมดามาก แต่ก็นะ อย่าเพิ่งตัดสินเกมกันที่ภาพละครับ :v

3.เสียง

ข้อนี้ผมข้ามได้ไหมอะ 5555555
ที่จะบอกคือ Soundtrack สุดยอดมากครับ สามารถช่วยดึงอารมณ์ และ สถานะการณ์ ของตัวละคร ณ ตอนนั้นออกมาได้เยี่ยมมาก "ไร้ที่ติครับ" คำเดียวจริงๆ
โดยส่วนตัวผมให้ 10/10 เลยครับ อวยเรื่อง Soundtrack มาก 5555555

4.เกมเพลย์
*SPOILER ALERT*
อาจจะมีการสปอยเกิดขึ้นได้นะครับ โปรดระวังด้วย

เอาละครับมาที่เรื่องเกมเพลย์
โดยเกมเพลย์ เราได้เล่นเป็นพระเอก ฮาจิเมะ ฮินาตะ สิ่งที่เราจะได้ทำก็มีสำรวจสิ่งต่างๆ ในแมพ จีบสาว จีบหนุ่ม ไปยันตอบคำถาม เล่น puzzle หรือ อื่นๆ ซึ่งลูกเล่นโคตรจะเยอะมาก โดยที่จะเพิ่มขึ้นเรื่อยๆ ทุกๆ Chapter แถมยังมี mini game สนุกๆให้ได้ลองกันอีกด้วยละนะคร้าบบบ โดยที่การเล่นเนีย หากเป็นคอเกมแนว Puzzle หรือ เกมแนวปริศนา ล่ะ ก็คุณจะต้องชอบแน่ๆ ครับ

ส่วนตัวในเรื่องเกมเพลย์ถือว่าค่อนข้างเข้ากับตัวผมมากครับ เล่นได้เพลินไม่เบื่อเลย แต่อาจจะมีตันนิดๆ หลังเคลียเกม + เก็บ Hope Fragment ครบ เพราะว่าเราแทบจะไม่มีอะไรให้ทำเหลือแล้ว นั้นแหละครับ เพราะงั้นผมให้ไป 7.5/10 ละกันครับ

5.ราคา และ ความคุ้มค่า
โดยที่ตัวเกมมีราคาอยู่ที่ 559 บาทในประเทศใน และมีเพลย์ไทม์รวมๆที่ 60-90 ชั้วโมง แล้วแต่ท่านว่าจะเก็บ Archivement ไหม หรือว่า เก็บ CG/Hope Fragment ไหม โดยตัวเกมที่ลูกเล่นค่อนข้างเยอะ สามารถสะสม CG ปลดล๊อค soundtrack และอื่นๆ โดยที่ตัวเกมเองก็มี Soundtack ที่ดีอยู่แล้ว และเนื่อเรื่องที่ค่อนข้างโอเคมาก ถือว่า*ค่อนข้าง*คุ้มเลยทีเดียว
ผมให้คะแนนส่วนตรงนี้ไป 7.5 ละกันครับ

เอาละครับแล้วก็มาถึง การ Recommend กันแล้วละครับ
สำหรับเกม Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair ผมแนะนำว่า : ควรซื้อมาเล่นหากเกมลดราคาครับ (76%)

เอาเป็นว่าเราก็ขอจบการวิจารเกมนีแต่เพียงเท่านี้ละกันครับ ขอบคุณครับบบบบ

25411532.review: 非常好玩的電子小說式遊戲，宛如在看一步步推理小說一般精彩，角色各個都很有魅力，中文化的部分也很用心，看得出完全是配合中文的使用者製作，用射擊的方式在審判場發言相當有趣，比起一代有更多有趣的小遊戲，但難度而言比一代高很多，一開始會比較難上手，整體而言是非常值得一玩的作品。

25409395.review:
总评 9.7/10

优点
+ 采用了不同于一代的开放式场景，手法更加多样
+ 比起一代大多利用地点制作诡计，二代既有地点的伪造，也有利用时间制作不在场证明的案件
+ 不局限于固定的室内，每个岛的案件场景都不尽相同
+ 引入了反驳激辩和逻辑潜入，同时在无休止讨论中引入了赞成的元素
+ 相比一代可以通过向黑白美用碎片交换技能，也能通过养宠物获得技能，技能点通过升级获得
+ 穿插了一些很有趣的案中案以及小游戏
+ 第五章的案件非常精彩，实在是意料之外

缺点
- 套路深似海，双杀、自杀（雾）代代相传
- 反驳激辩的时候容易把弱点给直接砍过去了（手残）
- 有的时候人名会显示成几个重复的字，bug望修复
- 隐藏黑白熊对眼神要求比较高

First of all, play the 1st before u start this one.

This game was a ground breaking sequel to the first in which the universe's plot expands even further with untraditional ways of invoking intrest through the original style of playthrough this game has. The Story is the main reason you should hold onto this game instead of getting it for its gameplay. However as this game is a import to PC from PS VITA it is well scripted and well done with its importation. The Series focuses on debates that try to clear up the fog that is made within each scenario of the game. There some cliche social moments but the main reason that the game excells with the debates is that the logical thinking put into solving the cases requires "some time". As it would stand the game has plenty of minigames that come with it along with a free novel once the main storyline had been completed. 

If a honest ranking was put for this game i would give it a 8.7/10 due to some files were not adapted for the english version but, the issue with that is very minimal and is sure not to tleave you in the water.

I played this in 6 sittings, each was 6 hours this time. (you could do them in just over 2)
Pros: The trials are more challenging and longer.
Cons: This makes them all almost 2 hours in length which could be an issue.

Chapters 1-4: these chapters are all great, and fairly original, the trials are more exciting and the characters are more likable, you can also skip daily life now (i didn't), 9/10.
Chapter 5: Genuinely devastating chapter, shows real growth from the first game, exists on it's own, and sets up chapter 6. 10/10
Chapter 6: Much better ending, cliche but original, confusing but also makes perfect sense. 9/10.

Other Pros: The deuteragonists are more likeable, while also not being perfect.
Other Cons: [spoiler]they both die.[/spoiler]

9/10 Play the first one literally just so you can play this one.

25173800.review:
Note: I'm shit at writing reviews so just BEAR with me. 
(also, if you wanna go into the game blind, don't read my review)

[h1][b]Introduction:[/b][/h1]
Danganronpa 2 is a great sequel to the amazing Danganronpa 1. I even think it's better than DR1. I went into this game knowing nothing about the story, characters, ect and I loved every second of it. If you loved DR1, you'll love this. I guess this game is also pretty great as a standalone game. But, if you play this without playing DR1, you might get confused during the last chapter. 

[h1][b]Story:[/b][/h1]
The story is almost the same as DR1's. You play as a boy named Hajime Hinata who gets enrolled into Hope's Peak Academy- a school for insanely talented teenagers. Soon after you get there, you and your classmates suddenly go on a "school trip" to a strange island. The school trip was meant to be happy and fun, but then Monokuma shows up and ruins everything. Like the first game, he makes all the students participate in a killing game where they must kill each other if they want to leave the island.

[h1][b]Gameplay:[/b][/h1]
One thing I really liked about this game is that they improved the Class Trial mini-games and made them a bit harder. In fact, the Class Trials are just harder in general. I was actually caught off guard by how hard they were. I expected them to be just as easy (or maybe a LITTLE harder) as the ones in DR1, but the first trial in this game took me 3 hours to complete because I failed... a lot.

Not only that, but they also added 2 NEW mini-games called "Rebuttal Showdown" and "Logic Dive" and I think they're pretty fun- especially Logic Dive. At first I didn't like Rebuttal Showdown because I didn't understand it, but it didn't take me long to figure it out. 

The only bad thing about the new Class Trials is "Improved Hangman's Gambit." They basically just took Hangman's Gambit from DR1 and made it harder, but also made it more annoying and not fun. 

[h1][b]Characters:[/b][/h1]
This game introduces a new colorful cast of characters. And honestly, I love the cast from this game more than DR1's characters. DR2's characters seem a lot more interesting. The new characters each have their own unique personalities and they all have pretty awesome character designs. The Japanese voice acting is also great! (I don't use dubs, so I can't really say if it's good or not.)

[h1][b]Other Things:[/b][/h1]
There's also a couple of new features in this game. For one: when you open your e-handbook there's now a "Pets" tab. Yes, you get to raise your own pet! You're supposed to give it gifts so you can raise its "hope" status and every once in a while you're supposed to check it and clean up its shit. The pet grows the more steps you take in the game. There's different pets you can raise (there's a guide on Steam that tells you how to get each pet) and if you raise it well, you'll get rewards! Most pets just give you some Monocoins and a couple of gifts but 2 of the pets will reward you with a skill that can be used in the Class Trials. 

Another new feature is a mini-game that can be accessed from the main menu called "Magical Girl Monomi." Though, I believe you can't play it right away. I think you have to progress in the main game a bit first. But anyways, in the mini-game, you play as Monomi and you basically have to fight these robot things. I've seen people complain about this game a lot. Even though I only played it to unlock the related achievements, I still enjoyed it. I thought it was pretty fun. 

And for those of you who have played Danganronpa 1 and are familiar with "School Mode", it returns in this game! Except it's called "Island Mode" instead. But it's basically the same exact thing. In Island Mode, Monomi wants you and your classmates to create things for her. Just like School Mode, Island Mode is an easy way to unlock the character's Free Time events so you can learn more about them.

[h1][b]Overall:[/b][/h1]
I rate this game a fucking 10/10.

25132438.review:
TLDR: This game is far more difficult than the first one, but if you pay attention, you will be fine. The story is amazing just like the first game.

At first, I despised this game, I thought it destroyed what the first game had accomplished. The first trial was a mess for me (Hangman's Gambit is a bitch). But then, I realized I cruised my way through the first title, but that may not be the case in this title. IT IS SAFE TO SAY THIS GAME IS FAR MORE DIFFICULT THAN THE FIRST ONE. As long as you pay attention during the investigations, the game isn't TOO difficult (although there is some conclusions in the game that no one would get without a guide imo). But one thing DR can never lose, is it's amazing story. While very farfetched, the story brings in interesting twists to get the most bored of players ingrossed in the game. If you loved the first one, this game makes a lot of improvements, but also butchered others (such as the afore mentioned Hangman's Gambit, and the fact that the PC port of the game has an almost game-breaking bug, where Bullet Time Battle/Panic Talk Action's rhythm is slightly off, meaning it is almost impossible to hit them unless you push the button far in advance). Anyways, buy the game, it's well worth your time.

25110517.review:
在正式评测之前先让我絮絮叨叨一会　弹丸３动画也出了　小高请您飞上天　[strike]这首ｃｎｍ送给小高和刚[/strike]
[b]尽量避免剧透，但还是会有不可抗力的剧透出现，注意避让[/b]
[h1]剧情相关[/h1]
弹丸论破２的剧情相比一代来说少了一份套路，多了一份恶意。真的，恶意，扑面而来的恶意。序章一开始的ｏｐ让我以为买错了游戏，之后倒是正常的弹丸展开……个ｐ啊，每当我认为下面会和一代一样时小高就狠狠打了我的脸。[spoiler]谁说最先死的是黑幕的？！把头伸过来给你加个ｂｕｆｆ[/spoiler]
第一章被害人死的冤啊，[spoiler]救人不成反被杀[/spoiler]凶手也冤啊，[spoiler]中了某高智商人的套还被黑白熊坑了一把[/spoiler]
第二章被害人死的冤啊，[spoiler]校园记忆被剥夺了谁知道发生了啥[/spoiler]凶手也冤啊，[spoiler]你约人出来居然还要我亲自动手来杀人……（涉及更高级别的剧透自动屏蔽）[/spoiler]
第三章被害人死的冤啊，[spoiler]得病脑子烧糊了都不知道为什么；我只是路过穿个衣服怎么好端端就撞上杀人事件了？[/spoiler]凶手也冤啊，[spoiler]没得病就是正常人一个，垃圾黑白熊毁我青春[/spoiler]
第四章被害人死的冤啊，[spoiler]救人成了机器人身体刚回来就死了[/spoiler]凶手也冤啊，[spoiler]不杀人就团灭这怎么玩[/spoiler]
第五章被害人死的一点都不冤，[spoiler]真·自作自受[/spoiler]凶手超冤冤过头了好吗，[spoiler]大家一起搞事结果就因为（更高级别剧透屏蔽）好好就被坑了[/spoiler]
第零章，[spoiler]狛枝[/spoiler]，强，无敌，逆天。
第六章，[spoiler]日向[/spoiler]，强，无敌，逆天。最后一章涉及剧透太多就不多说了。
总体来讲就是恶意，剧情跌宕起伏全程无尿点，巴不得一口气玩完结果因为恶意只能每天一章ｏｒｚ一般来讲只要认真玩搜查篇除了第五六章就能推理出凶手是谁了，总体来讲剧情处于上等水平。
[h1]人物相关[/h1]
只挑几个重点讲一讲，说到底弹丸２中没有人是不重要的，但跟整个弹丸世界观ｏｒ剧情推动有关特别重要的拎出来简单说一下。
日向，路人甲属性的主角，[spoiler]你这么想就大错特错了！[/spoiler][strike]一开始超高校级的？？？对应上代的幸运和？？？，差点以为是女主设定[/strike]存活组唯一智商，靠谱，稳重，毫无主角光环，非正常人。现在弹丸３动画也出了一半，大家也大概知道这家伙究竟是什么……还是那个词，揭开真相后散发出的恶意。
[spoiler]神座出流，真·万恶之源。说多也无益，神座ｐｒｐｒ[/spoiler]：）[spoiler]此妈拉奶[/spoiler]
狛枝，男主的好基友，某种意义上的双男主，无疑是弹丸２人设最成功的一位，胜过日向和七海。喜欢他的人超多，[strike]比如我[/strike]，讨厌他的人更是数不过来。[spoiler]没有他，互相杀戮的时间会推迟很多，毫无疑问搅屎棍[/spoiler]拥有幸运的他，和日向极为相似的他，自称希望的垫脚石的他，[spoiler]为了希望不惜堕入绝望的他[/spoiler]，复杂的设定正是他的人格魅力所在。弹丸３也有登场，[strike]崽啊，阿爸对你很失望[/strike]一如既往的帅哥＋神经病担当。
七海，路人女主，第一章学籍裁判后大放光彩。天使啊天使。[spoiler]可惜是个ａｉ[/spoiler]看破一切的小七海，总是给日向超多的帮助……好人，是个好人。第五章至关重要的人物。弹丸３绝望篇也登场了，虽然跟游戏性格不太一样但依旧能看到天使的一面。
罪木，人气意外的高。由于个人因素不是很喜欢她，但罪木这种弱娇的性格毫无疑问是一大卖点。才能运用方面是验尸主力，前两章学籍裁判至关重要。[spoiler]第一个恢复记忆的可怜娃子，也算间接引导出了事情的真相[/spoiler]
食神，第一眼看到他时我的内心是崩溃的。后来知道真相后我的内心依旧是崩溃的。好人啊！好人！[spoiler]欺诈师在弹丸３中也登场了，期待他和御手洗背后的故事ｗ[/spoiler]
其他角色就不一一赘述了。真的弹丸２中的每个人都各有特色。
[h1]操作相关[/h1]
不建议一上来选欺负人，认真的。作为一个手残，简单难度的滑滑板都能摔下来好几次……
电脑版的操作比ｐｓｐ上简单多了，可喜可贺可喜可贺。总之操作难度中等，不算太难（如果不选欺负人）
[h1]其他[/h1]
[b]优点[/b]
１.优秀的剧情，推理难度适中且合情合理
２.收集要素适中不容易让人感到厌烦，隐藏要素安排让人耳目一新
３.与其他人物的支线一如既往的ｇｏｏｄ，爱岛模式设定很棒
４.狛枝凪斗
[b]缺点[/b]
1.电子宠物，为了拿技能跑断腿
2.为了省略少许麻烦用规则强行解决一切，比如第二章海边小屋的浴室
3.恶意，满溢而出的恶意
4.狛枝凪斗
9.5/10 入宅作，绝对值得一玩。

If you've just finished Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc and are considering buying this sequel, there's not a single doubt in my mind that you will absolutely LOVE Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair. The story, gameplay, sounds, and ESPECIALLY the murders in Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair are leaps and bounds above the first game. Seriously. Miles.

The first game had me literally yelling at characters about how stupid they were acting during some of the investigations. This game had me bewildered throughout most of the game. SO refreshing. The story and world are much more open and the mysteries really seem like mysteries.

If you're here and haven't played Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc, go buy that one and play it. I got to play it on a friends Vita and loved it to bits, so I splurged and got the sequel. So: go try it out and I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

Get this game. If you haven't played the first one, play it. You'll have no regrets.

25076240.review:
[b]You are reading this because you just beat Danganronpa 1 and you want to know if this is worth picking up too. It isn't.[/b]

This might be hard to convince you of, seeing as how the first game was so good. But I promise you, this game is absolutely terrible. It is NOTHING like the first game. It is actually one of the worst games I have ever played, and easily the worst mystery/visual novel game I have ever played. I tried to like it, I wanted to like it. But I wasted my money on this 60 hour crap-fest. Just read the WIKI or watch the ending on youtube. Trust me.

[b]PROS[/b]:
- The way Mahiru says, "Jeez"
- Nagito mentions the Aussie pop duo, "The Veronicas". Remember them?
-Ibuki's hair
- The graphic update from the first game looks great (the animated backgrounds are a nice touch)

[b]CONS[/b]:
- Obnoxious characters
- Complete tonal shift [from the first game]. The setting and the topics it deals with are a goofy, cartoony mess that lacks depth.
- Contrived storyline [btw, these are the three most important fundamentals of any novel or work of fiction]
- Abysmal pacing [you will spend 30-40 hours before anything meaningful to the overall story takes place]
- Unclear game mechanics
- Anachronisms
- Nonsensical dialogue that is impossible to interpret at times
- Sugesstive "humor" that isn't particularly clever [it feels a bit like you're watching Beavis and Butthead. Characters will just start talking about their boobs/penises without any motivation and derail the conversation to no comedic effect]
- Murder trials that start out goofy and irrational, and progressively deteriorate to the point where jarring contradictions are completely overlooked and never explained [as if the developers just gave up and assumed that the player wouldn't notice or care]
- Verbiage, there is no need for about 2/3rds of the game's dialogue. The characters tend to talk cyclically.
- One of the worst endings that I have personally experienced. It provides resolutions to most of the story's conflict, but it ultimately leaves the player without fulfillment. You won't walk away from this game with a new perspective on life or anything like that. You'll just be happy that it's over.

That's about all I can say without spoiling anything. Overall, [b]this game sacrifices depth and emotion for self-aware, cartoony, ridiculousness[/b]. To the very end. When you have a crappy setting/theme, crappy characters, crappy dialogue, and a storyline that forces itself way too hard, you get a crappy novel. You get a crappy game.

3/10, it looks pretty and it is generally functional, but I would not recommend it.

25019046.review:
부디 제발 이 글을 단순히 쓴 글이라 생각하지 않기를 빌며.
스포는 전혀없다는 것을 미리 알립니다.


단간론파의 장점은 그래픽과 연출입니다. 
훌륭한 매력적인 그래픽과 그것에 살려 캐릭터성을 강화해 스토리텔링했습니다. 게임을 하는 동안 캐릭터 보는 맛으로 본게임인 학급재판을 기다렸습니다. 캐릭터 숫자가 숫자다 보니 본격적인 추리로들어가는데 시간이 상당히 걸립니다.

긴 서론을 끝내고 단서를 하나씩 얻으며 당신은 미리 범인이 누군가인지 알아맞추게 됩니다. 99%로 저 처럼 탐정소설 좋아하고 추리관련 좋아하는 사람은 이미 범인을 특정할 수 있습니다. 하지만 점점 진행될 수록 게임의 개연성이 깨지면서 진부함이 보이기 시작합니다.

(스포가 될 수 있음으로 내용에 대해 깊게 말하지 않으며 반박하시고 싶으면 댓글 달아주세요.)

여튼 그 후 학급재판에 들어갑니다. 시작부터 불안합니다. 게임에 상한 냄새가 나기 시작합니다. 토의 로직 구조 자체는 매우 완성도가 높습니다. 퍼즐이 아쉽긴하나 이 정도면 정성들여 만들었다는 것을 느낍니다.하지만 추리, 스토리 부분에서 이상하다는 것을 계속 느끼게됩니다. 개연성이 존재하지 않습니다.  말을 하고 싶은데 스포라서 말이 안나오는데

추리소설의 기본 원칙 밴다인의 20원칙을 상당량 위배합니다.( 연애부분을 언급하는 것이 아닙니다.)

정확히 말하면 억지로 끼어맞춘 덜렁덜렁한 싸구려 건담처럼
단간론파 학급재판에 환멸을 느끼게 됩니다. 하면 할 수록 그래픽이 아깝다. 연출이 아깝다 생각이 넘쳐납니다.

3류 추리소설, 3류 미스터리 소설보다 못합니다. 농담이 아니라 진짜 인터넷에 널려있는 아마추어의 아마추어가 쓴 쓰레기 소설보다 못하지 않나? 생각을 들게 합니다.  캐릭터성을 살리는 스토리텔링은 훌륭하나 그외 전부 형편없습니다. 진짜입니다.

단간론파의 장점은 하나입니다. 캐릭터성.
그거에 만족하시고 많은 분들이 좋아하시는 것 같지만 추리 좋아하시는분.
높은 깊은 완성도가 아닌 내용 자체를 즐기시는분.

추천하지 않습니다.

역전재판을 재밌게 하고 서커스 부분에 조금 아쉬움을 느끼신분. 그후 역전재판은 죄다 좋지않다 생각하시는분. 

추천하지 않습니다.

24984275.review:
Disclaimer, I didn't play the first DR game. I watched the anime. So I didn't really know what I was getting into with this. Nonetheless, I chose to play it on MEAN MODE, because come on-- you gotta be a little masochistic to play a game about beloved characters getting picked off one by one in the first place.

I was constantly impressed by how unique and charming the characters were. They all had complex, rich lives that I wanted to know more and more about-- but that was a little hard because MURDER.

Oh, and the soundtrack during the murder investigations and trials? Daaaaaaang, son. I want that playing every time I'm trying to solve a problem.

"Hey, how can we split the tab between five of us if Kate only had water?"
*bow wow wow na naaaa na naaa na naaa*

The murders were fascinating. Each setup was shocking, unique, and heartbreaking. The class trials were enormous fun that kept me up late into the night. Once I was on the case, I couldn't stop. Chapter 5 was especially gripping. Dude.

Some of the gameplay mechanics were a little frustrating. Maybe it was because I played it on PC, but certain trial elements never seemed to function that well-- particularly the end one. I'm blanking on its name, but it's the one where you have to hit the button on the beat to destroy the shields. I've been a musician for about 2 decades and yet I could never line up the button right, unless I was in Fever Mode, when all my button mashings were deemed successes. Huh. Other than that, I figured out most of it.

Some of the trial "answers" were logically ridiculous so I referred to a walkthrough (where others were complaining about the same thing), but those times were few and far between.

For all the swear words and bloodshed, some of the game was too cutesy and fanservice-y for my taste. I got easily bored with Monokuma and Monomi's interactions. I also wasn't super invested in the over-arching Future Foundation storyline, though towards the end I did get more interested in it as twists were revealed. Speaking of the end -- no spoilers here -- oh gosh, soooo much dialogue. I mean, I get that it's a Visual Novel, so that's forgivable other places, but certain characters seemed to talk in circles. (The voice acting is A+ throughout, though.)

I liked the end overall, though. It put an interesting spin on the previous gameplay, and I felt satisfied with everything. It carried the main themes through til the last line, and I loved the message, despite the constant bleakness of the scenarios.

Thank goodness for ISLAND MODE because I don't know how else I'm supposed to fill this hole in me now.

24970453.review:
Let me start off by saying BUY THIS GAME!
(Also, wanted to add that I did not play the first game, but watched the anime and plan to go back and play the first game.)

I'm going to give the pros and cons of the game and a little explination of why it is a pro or a con.

Pros:
OST-Probably the best OST I've ever heard and each song that is player perfectly fits the scenario. Some of the songs are so good you might even want to get them on your phone or something.

Story-This has the best story of any game I've ever played. You will be be sad enough that you want to cry. You will be exited enough that you start to dance in your chair. You will not expect most of the twists that happen in this game. You constantly be intrigued by the story that you will get lost in the game. You'll start up the game at 8:00 PM and then realize that's it 6:00 AM once you finally feel like turning your head away from the screen.

Characters-The characters in this game have such great design that you will develop relationships with these characters that you will cherish, too bad you'll feel much of the despair the game promises when they die though.

Puzzles-The puzzles in this game aren't to hard, but they aren't too easy either. They give you a perfect balance between the two. The minigames that are played for this are very well designed (Hangman's Gambit may be a bit controversial) that they are fun, and also make sense in there situation.

Voice Acting-It is absolutely amazing with some of the best voice actors out there such as Fukuyama Jun and Sugita Tomokazu; however, I can't stand the english voice acting so I highly, highly recommend the Japanese voice acting.

Art-Art is very well done which helps you totally capture the distress or happiness a character is feeling, or perhaps the creepy ambiance of a location.

Ending-One of the best endings I've seen. That's all I'm saying.

Cons:
-Look sensitivity while walking around is too low.
-Contains an unnecessary amount of saliva and snot (not a serious con)

Overall review:
BUY THIS GAME! At a $30 price tag you have no reason not to buy this game. However, I highly recommend you play the first game before you jump into this game as you'd be very lost to what's going on.

24957769.review:
ภาคต่อที่สนุกยิ่งกว่าภาคแรก(ที่ดีมากๆอยู่แล้ว)
มีการพัฒนาการชัดเจนทั้งเนื้อเรื่องที่ลึกขึ้น หนักขึ้นมีมิติขึ้น และเกมเพลย์ที่หลากหลายขึ้น

ระบบมินิเกมมีทั้งที่เอาของเดิมมาปรับปรุงใหม่ให้เจ๋งขึ้น และมินิเกมใหม่ๆ ที่ให้อารมณ์โต้วาทีดุเดือดยิ่งขึ้น

ข้อดี
- มินิเกมใหม่ๆ
- ฉากที่หลากหลายขึ้น
- เนื้อหาที่ลึกขึ้น โลกนี้ไม่ใช่สีขาวและสีดำสนิท ฝ่ายความหวังไม่ได้งดงามหมดจด และฝ่ายสิ้นหวังก็ไม่ใช่ชั่วโดยไร้ที่มาที่ไป
- อธิบายจุดเริ่มต้นของเหตุการทั้งหมดได้ชัดเจนขึ้น
(จากที่ภาคแรกอธิบายโคตรคลุมเครือ ไม่รู้ว่าตอนนั้นทีมงานคิดมุขไม่ออกหรือจงใจกั๊กไว้เหมือนกัน)
- มีโหมดพิเศษ Danganronpa If ที่เป็นนิยายภาคเสริมกรณีมุคุโร่ไม่ตายตอนภาคแรก
- ใช้เมาส์ช่วยเล่นได้มากในเวลาที่ต้องการความเร็ว
- มีระบบเลเวลแบบใหม่ ช่วยให้ใส่สกิลได้มากขึ้น หมดปัญหาสกิลเฟ้อประเภทหาสกิลได้แต่ยัดไม่ลง


ข้อเสียที่อยากบ่น
- การเลื่อนเคอร์เซอร์ในมินิเกม Hangman Gambit ด้วยจอยให้ทันในระดับความยากสูงสุดเป็นสิ่งที่แทบเป็นไปไม่ได้
เพราะเลื่อนช้าโคตรๆ ต้องใช้เมาส์ช่วยเท่านั้น
- ปัญหาสกิลเฟ้อถูกแทนที่ด้วยปัญาสกิลฝืด เพราะกลายเป็นมีสล๊อตว่างแต่หาซื้อมายัดได้ยากแทน
- โหมดพิเศษ ทีให้เราเล่นเป็นโมโนมี่มันโคตรบั๊กมาก


คุณค่าในการเล่นซ้ำ
- ภาคนี้มีฉากลับหลายฉากมาก ที่จำเป็นต้องมีไอเทมบางอย่างถึงจะปลดล๊อคได้
ซึ่งไอเทมเหล่านั้นก็อยู่ในตู้ Monomono ซึ่งการจะได้ไอเทมเหล่านั้นครบได้พอดีดูทุกฉากในเที่ยวแรกนั่นแทบเป็นไปไม่ได้เลย ยกเว้นคุณจะเป็นสุดยอดผู้โชคดีเหมือนนายนากิโตะ

24953209.review:
某天一觉醒来发现steam版弹丸都有了官中，我是十分兴奋的，于是虽然我被steam云坑了一把之前的存档都没了，但毕竟也是通过PSP版和PSV版好几遍的人（莫装逼），所以我顶着没多久的游戏时间来写测评了。
虽然本体是个系列粉但确实对2代的评价要更高一些，虽然它的第一章就已经难度颇高（讲道理其实它根本就不是新手章吧毕竟完全剧透一代，所以也不是不可以理解），不过某些章节的飙泪程度必须给点个赞，[spoiler] 虽然在动画播出到现在这个时间点的时候我已经开始怀疑史上最大最恶小高事件无法避免	[/spoiler]
以下纯属主观见解
+在阳光明媚的海岛上发生的节操碎一地的心跳修学旅行（才怪
+案件诡计提升，尤其第四章和第五章的设计简直让人惊叹
+相比一代更加提高的游戏性，虽然其实只是更虐手残了一些
+某些人物的塑造相当有意思，你们肯定知道我说的是哪些
+冲击力超强的真相，一代所揭开的不过是冰山一角

-作为推理游戏某些元素的加入稍有点超现实，但是背景在那里所以完！全！没关系！对吧。
-整人模式下某些技能的安装会导致难度反而加大，不知道是有意为之还是设计失误
-某些章学级裁判中的某些环节确实稍有点反人类

9.5/10。作为系列粉，全系列所有的作品里（不仅包括游戏）最高分数我给二代。

强烈建议第一次接触本系列的同学们不要在二代选择双整人模式。它真的会整你。

24837918.review:
呼噗噗噗噗噗噗噗噗噗，玩了5天，做梦都听得到这鬼畜的笑声_(:зゝ∠)_

首先要给官方汉化组点个赞。作为一款文字类游戏，这次汉化的水准非常高，基本上没有错误，不仅将很huang多duan梗zi都完整地呈现出来，连附带的官方小说和爱岛模式也翻译了，实在是太棒了~

弹丸论破12部是我首次也是唯一接触过的文字推理类游戏
因此只能[h1]对比1和2发表一些自己的一点见解。[/h1]

[spoiler]相比于第一部，首先黑幕作案的手法进一步提高，完美地运用了密室，时间差，空间差等意想不到的因素，特别是第五章狛枝教主的炫目的演出，极大地震撼了我幼小的心灵，不得不佩服编剧的脑洞。再者，学级审判中丰富了游戏的玩法，加入逻辑潜入和言刃向锋，提高了组字和论破的难度，提高了游戏的操作性。最后，人物的塑造也与第一部一样成功，每位角色的特点与个性非常鲜明（虽然各自的才能很奇怪）

当然，本作的点睛之笔自然是第六章，剧情急剧逆转，无限扩大，不仅解开了二代背景的谜团，还与完善了第一部的世界观，填了第一部留下的坑，不得不佩服编剧埋的伏笔之深，脑洞之大，也为第三部打下了基础。

更要吐槽的是，刷满好感度后送内裤的奇葩设定，创哥，没能力别伤心，你明明是超高校胖次收集家呀！O(∩_∩)O~~	[/spoiler]

然而，本作中仍有几个我认为[h1]不足的地方[/h1]

[spoiler][h1]动机[/h1]：本作每次黑幕杀人的动机我是非常不服，相比于第一部黑白熊煞费苦心创造一次次“动机”来使黑幕心生杀意，第二部只能用简单粗暴来形容，像十神的死，动机却是柏枝的一次失败的密谋，特别是罪木杀人，竟然只是因为染上了绝望病就夺走了两条人命（剧情最后解释清楚了），这让我非常不能接受，我认为需要更好的动机来使绝望慢慢地吞噬人的希望，更加符合绝望和希望抗争的主题	

[h1]剧情[/h1]：个人发现的一个漏洞就是，在第四章惊奇屋，田中作为黑幕第一个通过了赌命密室拿到了作案工具，然而黑白熊却把至关重要的学生档案给了后来的柏枝小天使，这也是为了剧情发展的需要吧	

[h1]环境[/h1]：可能是第一部位于封闭的学院，第二部位于开阔的海岛，我觉得后者给人的压迫感和紧张感不如前者。试着想想，每次出现命案后，前者会解锁一些与生活息息相关的重要场所，后者解锁一些更偏向于娱乐的次要场所，两者谁更能带来绝望感迫使杀机的诞生？

当然，最重要的是关于开头的胖十神与最后的真十神的矛盾并没有解释清楚！男神担当怎么可能变胖子！(╯‵□′)╯︵┻━┻（当然在弹3绝望篇里面解释清楚了）[/spoiler]

再说说[h1]狛枝凪斗[/h1]这个人物
[spoiler]作为一名超高校级幸运儿，他的性格和行为却如此令人捉摸不透，可以说是全作最出彩的一名角色。在我看来，狛枝凪斗是一名对希望有着病态痴迷的角色。他对超高校级学生无限崇拜，却极度鄙视普通人。为了看到绝对希望，他宁可去谋杀同学来使不同的希望相吞噬，在大家对案件一筹莫展时，却又会引导大家找到真相。在看到大家真正的身份后，他牺牲了自己制造了一场几乎完美的计划来抹杀所有的绝望！这让我不得不对他刮目相看。他的性格由于某些原因十分偏执甚至极端，在我看来他反而更像是盾子的对立面，为了希望不惜一切手段。处于希望与绝望边界线的人，只需推一把，便可任一一方的深渊。PS：狛日大法好。[/spoiler]

非常优秀的游戏，9.6/10

补番中（未来篇这么戏弄朝日奈小天使我要跟编剧寄刀片┗|*｀0′*|┛ ）

16.8.12

PROS

+ Nagito

CONS

本編の魅力が失われてしまうので
コミュニティハブは覗かない事を推奨します。

24729110.review:
This is a review. No spoilers. No Killing. No Despair. But some high- class humor.      C|8_{D  

''What is Danganronpa?'' Glad you ask lad. Well simply put: Your new teacher believes a class trip is the best way to begin a new school year. Accordingly, she beams you to a tropical island in the middle of nowhere. Why, you ask? Because you all ought to strengthen the bonds between everyone in your class, which consists of highschool students, who all have a specific talent. ''Now, where's the fun in that?''. Good question. Unfortunately an old aquaintance appears on stage. Those who know the first game, are aware as to who that could be and it is really not a secret, yet I will leave it at that. ''But what does he do, to add to the already amazing suspense of a class trip?''. Oh, I thought you'd never ask. Now, you are not only instructed to get closer to your schoolmates, no..., while doing that, said villain urges all of you diligent pupils, to dispose of each other. ''What?! I will have to murder innocent highschoolers?!'' Goodness, no. Instead, you will have to try and solve the murder mysteries presented to you, as you are one of the few who choose not to kill, naturally. You will gather all significant evidence and unveil your findings during the class trial. ''A trial without certainty as to who the murderer is? That seems rather odd...'' You know it is not just some trial. The class trial will decide who the murderer is... by majority vote. So make sure to persuade your fellas, or you may be the one to go. ''That can't be right, that's not fair!'' Upupu. I almost forgot. Everyone else except the succesful and undetected killer will die along the one who was wrongfully selected. ,,How cruel!'' Then prevent it! Be the one to outsmart them all and win by exposing the evildoers among your friends. Should you correctly uncover the identity of the killer by argument and minigames, only he or she will die. ''But is it all about these killings?'' Obviously not! You will have deep conversations of which you will probably speed read all those unrelated to murderers or persons in the game you actually like. Since I know that decadent generation of yours, I will mention an additional part of the game: Free Time. Can you believe it, humans passing their time by simulating free time In-Game, bonkers. There you will have the opportunity to engage in short conversations with your fellow captives and read a few sentences about what happened during free time, instead of you actually having anything out of it. ''But why bother, then?'' Well, it is not completely in vain, you know. You can give them gifts, that you purchased with coins earned by finding puppets of Mr. Villian, that are spread all over the island. Oh, and getting closer to some people, which may or may not help you later in the game. ''Is there anything else I should know?'' That might be about it. Even though some people may need to get used to playing a game with a lot of Visual Novel elements, it is worth investing time in it, since you will leave as the Ultimate .... what was it again? Nevermind. Guuud Niiiiigh!!!

24717812.review:
Okay, the only reason I didn't have a review of this up already is because I thought I had already made one, but whatever, now I'm here to educate you. So, Lesson number one, this series is freaking awesome and everyone should go check it out. There. Class dismissed.

Well, okay, real review. I don't have the first game on steam. I sometimes tell people I played it on the PS Vita so then they don't judge me, but really I just watched it on youtube. But then I found out how amazing it was and I just had to experience the second game myself. Besides, I don't even have a Vita.

Anyways, let's get some stuff out of the way right now. If you hate games that are story-driven, requires lots of logic, and take a long time, this series will NOT be for you. The writing is fantastic, but if you aren't in it for the long haul, you might not want to even bother with it. Although, if you aren't sure, maybe watch the prologue or something on youtube, just a TINY bit, and see if you are interested. Also, [b]PLAY THE FIRST GAME BEFORE THIS ONE PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF ALL THAT IS GOOD AND SACRED[/b]. This one spoils EVERYTHING from the first. And speaking of spoilers, DONT LOOK UP ANYTHING AT ALL. NOTHING. ONLY GO TO THE STORE PAGE AND BUY IT, THAT'S ALL YOU NEED TO DO.

That said, I will try to say things that will apply to BOTH games, because they are similar and both awesome.

So what's the premise? Well, I'll just tell you what happens in the prologue because, let's be real, that's not at all spoiler territory. So there's this place called Hopes Peak Academy, and if something graduates from there, they are basically set for life, but they need to meet 2 qualifications. 
1.) Be currently enrolled in high school
2.) Be they very best at what you do, and become an "Ultimate". For example, if you are amazing at singing, you would be invited as the "Ultimate Singer", or if you have a sexy as all hell accent, you would be the "Ultimate Sexy Accent".
So anyways, you play as Generic Anime Protaganist, but under different names depending on if it's the first or second game, and they were just invited to Hopes peak Academy. However, spooky things happen, and you wake up at a mysterious place and meet all of your classmates, aka the other characters, who all range from literally insane, to pervert, to hellspawn, to the resident cute shy girl who is literally best girl. And then the mascot character shows up and is like "If you want to leave, you need to murder one of your classmates and get away with it", thus steering the series into the murder mystery genre.

So, without spoilers, how is the story? It's fantastic. It's the main draw of this series. All of these things happening all the side and the mysteries of the main plot building up and then they get solved anD ILOJFDNDJRFEWHFD IT'S GREAT. The story also has a lot of emphasis on that characters, and all of them are great. Not all of them are LIKEABLE, but they are all written well. And you will find yourself getting attached to certain characters as they contribute to the story and then eventually they probably got freaking killed. Oh, and don't be fooled, people WILL die. And some deaths may hit you VERY hard, particularly if it's one of your favorites. But don't worry, it's all a part of the danganronpa experience.

The murder mystery parts are also very well written. Figuring out "whodunnit" is always interesting, and the further you go in the more complicated it gets. Which is another reason to start with the first game, IT'S SO MUCH EASIER TO FIGURE OUT. It's more like a warm-up for the second. While some of the trials have some details that could made me mad, but overall it's pretty great.

So how's the gameplay? It's pretty good. 1/3 of it is a visual novel, moving along in the story and going from place to place to trigger the next event in the story. 1/3 is a dating sim, where you spend free time with the currently surviving characters and give them presents, and if you give them something the actually like by reading item description and paying attention to the characters, you get little events that tell you more about them. And then the last 1/3 of it is a murder mystery, where a murder happens, and you need to look around and gather evidence, and then go to a trial and use it to solve the case. The gameplay helps you feel like you are getting closer to the characters and solving the mysteries yourself, and it's cool.

As for other important stuff, the soundtrack is pretty great. There are a few tracks that I just can't get out of my head sometimes. And also, the voice acting for both the English and Japanese is pretty solid. Also, yes, you can have English text and Japanese voices if you prefer, and apparently the Japanese cast has some very, VERY well known people. Like, one person in the second game is voiced by the same person who did the japanese voice for, ah, let's see here, Edward Elric from Fullmetal Alchemist, Temari from Naruto, Finn from Adventure Time, freaking PHARAH FROM OVERWATCH, need I go on?


So, you may be thinking, "This jumbled wall of text is nice and everything, but what's so amazing about it?" Well, it's really hard to truly put it into my words, but the writing just engrosses you. It wraps you up in a ball and it won't let you go until you know what happens. Between the characters, and the mystery, and just the foreshadowing dropped here and there and it's just DOJSHNEFJDVKOGBKLE; IT'S JUST FREAKING GREAT. I've been OBSESSED with this series every since I heard about it. And now is an EXCELLENT time to hop on the bandwagon, with the TWO ANIMES that are CURRENTLY AIRING. One is the VERY END, and one is the VERY BEGINNING. But just like the other things, DON'T WATCH THESE UNTIL YOU HAVE FINISHED THE FIRST AND SECOND GAME.

I'm using all caps a lot and this is very long because I'm VERY passionate about this series. IT'S SOOOOOOO GOOOOOOOOD 10 OUT OF FREAKING 10 GO BUY THE FIRST GAME NOW. Well okay MAYBE wait until it's on sale but GET IT SOON IF YOU CAN IT'S JUST SO FREAKING AMAZING.

24698440.review:
Danganronpa 2 : Goodbye Despair est un visual novel d’enquête et de procès. C’est la suite directe du premier opus, même si ce n’est pas de suite évident.


Tout d’abord, je vais présenter dans les grandes lignes le GROS point fort de DR2 : son scénario. Pour faire simple, le jeu reprend les mêmes bases que le jeu original : on incarne un étudiant, Hajime Hinata, fraichement admis à Hope's Peak Academy, une université pour les étudiants qui possèdent tous un talent particulier (on les nomme les Ultimates). Cependant, une fois dans la classe, un lapin rose, Usami, apparaît et les transporte sur une île tropicale pour qu'ils deviennent tous amis et collectionnent des fragments d’espoir. Mais bien sûr, Monokuma arrive et lance le Killing School Trip. Comme dans le premier jeu, pour s'échapper de l'île, les Ultimates doivent tuer un de leurs camarades et ne pas être démasqué lors des Class Trials (on y revient plus tard). Se lance alors un jeu mortel où les amitiés nouvellement créées sont mises en doute et où la confiance est une chose bien rare et fragile.


Voilà pour le scénario. Maintenant abordons le gameplay. Celui-ci est peu ou prou le même que le premier jeu. On enchaîne les free time où l'on parle aux personnages pour faire avancer l'histoire jusqu'à ce qu'un évènement arrive. Noter que maintenant, à chaque fois qu'on parle à un personnage on gagne donc des "fragments d'espoir" ce qui permet d'acheter des compétences pour les Class.

Les déplacements sont un peu modifiés : on se déplace toujours à la première personne dans les grands espaces fermés, mais dès qu'on est sur l’île, les déplacements s'effectuent à la troisième personne en 2D. C’est agréable mais ne change pas grand-chose. Cependant les déplacements 3D sont ralentis lorsque l'on tourne, ce qui freine la fluidité.

Ensuite les enquête des meurtres sont classiques : on examine les objets et on parle aux autres personnages pour recueillir leur témoignage, parfois significatif, parfois non, mais toujours utile au final.

Et enfin, les Class Trials. Là par contre de nombreux changements sont à notés.

Les Non-Stop Debates où l'on ne pouvait que réfuter une déclaration en tirant une balle s'enrichissent d'une nouvelle possibilité, on peut maintenant approuver les propositions des autres étudiants de la même façon.

Ensuite, le pendu se complexifie : il faut maintenant que deux mêmes lettres se heurtent pour pouvoir l'utiliser, et lorsque l'écran est plein de lettres, c'est très dure de ne pas perdre de crédibilité (je conseille pour cette phase le gameplay à la sourie, plus réactif que la manette).

En revanche les phases de manga pour résumer l'affaire sont simplifiées en nous permettant de n'avoir accès qu'à seulement un échantillon des vignettes.

En plus de c'est changements mineurs dans les mécaniques déjà existantes, deux nouvelles phases ont été rajoutées. D'abord le Rebbutal Showdown. Maintenant, le héros ne sera plus le seul à pouvoir réfuter des déclarations : les autres personnages vont eux aussi pouvoir objecter à vos déductions. Il faudra alors briser leurs réfutations à l'aide de coups d'épée et les achever grâce à une preuve. Cet ajout rajoute de la cohérence aux Class Trials et les dynamise.

Puis deuxième ajout, le Logic Dive. On se retrouve dans le cerveau de Hajime pour faire du surf et répondre aux questions de l'enquête en empruntant différents chemins. Petit bémol pour cette phase, les réponses sont souvent assez évidentes et on préférerait un QCM, mais le gameplay est plutôt fun et on attend chaque descente avec impatience.

Le jeu s’enrichit également un système d'XP qui augmente en marchant et en examinant des objets. Cela permet d'activer plusieurs "skills" lors des Class Trials.

On peut maintenant élever (de façon minimaliste) un animal de compagnie, à la façon d’un Tamagotchi, qui grandira grâce au nombre de pas. Il faudra aussi lui offrir des cadeaux pour que sa jauge de désespoir n'augmente pas jusqu'à la mort.

Voilà pour les modifications de gameplay.


Parlons maintenant du doublage, car bien que le doublage ne soit pas courant dans les visual novel, se limitant généralement à quelques mots pour rythmer l'action (comme les célèbres interjections des Ace Attorney), la série des Danganronpa se paie le luxe de doubler une grande majorité des personnages. Chaque Class Trial est doublé complètement (sauf les pensées et les phrases d'échec) et le reste du jeu est composé de petites phrases caractéristiques de chaque personnage durant les Free. Cependant, bien que ces phrases soit toujours à leur place dans le contexte, elles sont rarement les vraies paroles des personnages. J'ai fait le jeu avec les voix anglaises et entendre et lire en même temps des choses différentes est assez déstabilisant. Mais ça n'est pas un gros problème. Concernant le doublage anglais en lui-même, je l'ai trouvé très convaincant et très juste. Le doublage japonais l'est sûrement tout autant.


Maintenant abordons les graphismes et la musique. Pour moi rien à redire. Le chara design est inspiré et plus bariolé que le premier jeu. Chaque personnage possède de nombreux sprits couvrant une large gamme d’émotions (toujours en 2D, la direction artistique étant encore une fois si reconnaissable). Les exécutions, sans trop spoiler, sont toujours parfaitement réalisées dans leur design si caractéristique. Les environnements sont travaillés et diversifiés. Et je suis amoureux de la parallaxe! Les musiques sont excellentes et font très vacances tropicale, mais savent se nuancer avec des notes malsaines.


À la fin du jeu, on débloque l'Island Mode. C'est un jeu de gestion mélangé à un Date Simulator... C'est ce qui ce serait passé si Monokuma n'avait jamais pris le pouvoir. Le mode est sympa mais sans plus. Il permet surtout d'avoir tous les Free Time de tous les personnages et de passer plus de temps avec ses personnages préférés (Mahiru!!!). Si l’on passe beaucoup de temps avec un personnage dans un lieu qu’il apprécie, on débloque une fin secrète (à noter que ces fins peuvent se cumuler).

On a aussi accès à la lecture de la nouvelle Danganronpa IF qui raconte ce qui se serait passé dans le premier jeu si Makoto avait retrouvé le mémoire avant le premier meurtre.

On peut aussi incarner Monomi et combattre les Monobeasts dans un jeu typé arcade (une sorte de beat’em up) très répétitif.


Côté durée de vie, l'histoire principale vous prendra 40-50 heures en prenant son temps puis si vous visez les 100% il vous faudra bien 70-75 heures.


En conclusion, Danganronpa 2 : Goodbye Despair est un excellent jeu qui dépasse pour moi le premier jeu de loin (meilleurs personnages, meilleurs enquêtes, meilleur plot twist de fin (encore plus WTF mais plus "logique"), gameplay plus varié). Il ne faut plus qu'espérer que Spike Chunsoft sorte sur Steam Ultra Despair Girls et Danganronpa V3. On croise les doigts!

[h1]Из [b]Надежды[/b] рождается отчаяние, а из [b]Отчаяния[/b] надежда...[/h1]

Вoобще, слова выше - это в кой-то мере истина всей серии ронпы на данный момент(Не считая приквела, ибо не играл). Вторая часть этой серии, как и первая, окунает тебя в "Жизнь" полную отчаяния, смертей, страданий и сожалений, через которые в твоей душе пробивается слабый, но постепенно усиливающийся луч надежды. Это история о потерях, которые приведут к одному – рождению новой надежды у героев игры, но у игрока оставят остатки отчаяния в душе. 

Danganronpa 2 повествует нам о 16 подростках, которые каким-то неведомым образом попали на остров, они не помнят, что было до этого, и не понимают происходящего. Всё и так непонятно, а перед их взором появляется ещё и какой-то “Говорящий кролик” Усами, которая говорит про то, что остров создан для них, тут всё будет хорошо, а их цель просто наслаждаться всеми благами и собирать “Фрагменты надежды”. И казалось бы, можно смириться и прожить всё это время до конца, но… Появляется “Отчаяние” в лице Монокумы – “говорящего медведя”, который рушит все планы Усами наповал – с этого момента остров в его распоряжении, сбор фрагментов надежды не поможет, а в душе остаётся лишь отчаяние. Монокума ставит ультиматум – “Хотите выбраться с этого острова? Тогда убейте кого-то!” – после этих слов начинается ВСЁ. Всё… Отчаяние, убийства, печаль от потери дорогих тебе людей, не желание верить в то, что твои друзья пошли на подобные шаги ради того, чтобы выбраться с острова – и всё это будет приправлено кучей клифхангеров и отличных диалогов. 

По ходу истории, каждый из шестнадцати человек должен будет убить кого-то, дабы ему позволили выбрать с острова – но всё не так просто, ибо исход решается на “Классном суде” – если все проголосуют за убийцу, то тогда погибнет только он, а все остальные выживут, если же все ошибутся, тогда эффект будет диаметрально противоположным. 
Из Суда рождается основной геймплей, но перед ним есть несколько этапов. Все они завязаны на рассказе истории, улучшении отношений с персонажами и расследовании убийства. 

И теперь о Суде. Сам он тоже проходит в несколько этапов, и при каждом новом убийстве эти этапы постепенно усложняются. Первый и самый основной этап – “Аргументация”. В нём мы приводим аргументы, которые представлены пулями в “барабане”(Собираемы нами в расследовании), которые при выстреле рушат изречения собеседника и приводят нас к какому-то выводу,  или же поддерживаем того, кто приводит по нашему мнению верные предположения. Собственно, в нём есть ещё один мини-ивент – нам просто в один момент нужно выбрать верный вывод, и всё. 
Второй этап – некое “сражение”, где нам предлагается разрубать слова собеседника, который вклинился в спор/диалог между нами, да пытается нам что-то противопоставить. Мы “рубим” его слова и наносим решающий удар, который рушит всё, что он пытался нам донести. 
Третий – “Гамбит”. Нам летят буковки, мы их совмещаем, вставляем в нужное место и составляем слово/слова, которые являются решающими на данный момент. Этап простой на словах, но не на деле. 
Четвёртый – Logic Dive. В нём мы должны прокатиться по определённой зоне в мини-игре, пытаясь не попасться на препятствия, по ходу дела ещё и выбирая направление, где кроется верный ответ. Сам по себе он прост, но выглядит приятно, и играется также.
Пятый – Panic Talk Action. Что-то вроде ритм игры, где мы должны нажимать кнопку вовремя и не отпускать её, дабы произвести “Выстрел” и разрушить “Щиты” противника, дабы нанести решающий удар против его слов. И всё это ещё не все механики, которые есть в игре. Их больше и они делают игру интересней, как и даже половины вещей не сказано об истории, которая делают эту игру такой шикарной, какая она есть. 

Danganronpa 2 – это история, которая не оставит тебя равнодушным, даст тебе интересных персонажей, которые будут хорошо прописаны, кучу клифхангеров и отличный саундтрек. Всё это будет совмещенно с отличным визуальным стилем, где авторы не ленились прорисовать как можно больше вариаций персонажей, хорошим для ВН геймплее, который разбавляет чтение кучи текста и так далее. Это история, в которую ты должен окунуться сам, дабы родить Надежду появившуюся из отчаяния… [u]Сможешь ли ты преодолеть DESPAIR[/u]?

24568717.review:
只有英文版简直硬伤，我并不会拿不会英文为借口，如果玩过汉化版剧情应该很熟悉的，而且也是一种学习英语的好方法（真的有人会依靠这玩意学习么，不过对于广大日呆，靠日语发音确实可以推测句子意思:bbtcat:），然而对于某些部分，英语有着其致命的缺陷，过于繁琐。显然，在闪耀字谜上，不能够提供和汉化版以及日语版一样的简洁的字符，这使得后面几乎很难做到完全无伤，或者说伤害极小，这是最为值得吐槽的。

此外，有些成就设计的比较反人类了，比如走10000步，创妹等级99都是什么鬼，[spoiler]难道海突做的太痛苦报复玩家？[/spoiler]，还有就是电梯出现的动画明显有问题，这点貌似是不能更正的，不过这段说的都是一些小缺点，强迫症玩家勿入。

还有一些其他的缺点，这个实际上使这个游戏PSP版就有的设定，所以就不吐槽了。

讲道理，剧情的话我估计为了支持正版的粉丝都是知道的，没玩过2的朋友我也不想给各位剧透。我只能说，第四章开始剧情真是超超超超超绝望，各种拆CP已经喜闻乐见了，我甚至怀疑编剧是FFF干部，此外，对于15名高中生的故事刻画也是一如既往的细致，即是你再恨一个人你也不会恨起来（除了罪木以外都萌，对于我这句话，请玩到第三章再喷，另外，绝望篇的罪木真呆萌。）

此外，弹丸2的剧情是弹丸系列的中枢，弹丸3的未来篇和绝望篇都在其中找得到对应，弹丸1的很多要点在里面得以体现，所以想要理解弹丸世界观的，弹丸2不可错过。

关于学级裁判环节的设置，除了一如既往的无休止议论和回答以外，都做出了改动与增减，增加了逻辑深潜（跑酷），反驳论战（切水果），修改了闪耀字谜的选字方式，这种修改实际上一定程度上减小了错误率，不过眼睛花的化也可能出错吧。PTA虽然骨架一样，不过从原来的OSU击打模式变更成OSU条状模式，最终一击也变成了自己去拼言弹，增加了难度。场景再现虽然没什么变化，但由于西园寺的技能，难度减小了不少（在此纪念天国的波导，一直是死在这里），[spoiler]从此全动作类游戏制霸[/spoiler]，不过这些更改，对于老玩家都不是事。

顺带一提，这代学级裁判的噪音比以前多，我第三章做完第一个消音成就，第五章做完第二个（实际上是你无聊吧:bbtcat:）

24544993.review:
9/10 

Pros: 
-Great character art
- Great story line
- Has kept in the Japanese audio option (thank you :D)
- 2 new modes to the trials which add a fresh spin to the debate
- Lots of great extras (as usual) for when you complete the game
- Held a lot more emotional weight between characters (for me) than the original
- Definitely recommended for those who love VN and a bit of murder mystery solving. 

Cons:
- Sometimes the truth bullets that needed to be matched up to the correct statement were impossible to deduct with logic - I think something got lost in translation when turning from Japanese to English which made for some fustrating moments in the debates
- Some characters set up VERY obvious death flags so it was very easy to guess who was going to die next unlike the first Danganronpa and ruined the suspense of wondering who was going to get murdered.
- For me (personally) I found very little replay value except to look at the extra little unique cutscenes I missed with the necessary key items.
- It seemed a lot easier to guess what had happened in each murder and how it was done, I'm not sure if it was because playing the first Danganronpa made it this way but I found myself less satisfied with resolving the turn of events because I had guessed almost all of it already.

24515302.review: An interesting cast of 16 characters are put on an island to kill each other (Highly simplified explanation). Nobody would kill their friends of course, right? Probably yes, but here, if someone kills someone else and passes a class trial they get to go free and everyone wants to get out. This creates an engaging story of wondering who will be killed next and then focusing on who could have killed them, gathering up all the clues you can before the class trial to determine your fate with some fairly simple gameplay mechanics. I must admit, the highlight of the game for me comes from when the killer is found out. If the killer does get caught... they get brutally executed. Watching what execution Monokuma has come up with for the character's speciality is always a joy. The only real problem I have with the game is the end, [spoiler] which completely invalidates everything that has happened. No-one actually died, it was a virtual world and everyone was in a coma. I felt that was really shitty but only the survivors got out of their coma and everyone else was stuck in theirs. I only now hope that in the anime (which is a continuation) they don't ruin it by "Oh yeah, the survivors found a way to get them out. Fuck everything that happened in the game"[/spoiler]. Concluding, Danganronpa 2 Goodbye Despair is a great game and better than the first. [strike] P.S Gundham is the best and a totally valid reason to buy the game exclusively for. [/strike]

24490326.review: This game was one hell of an experience for me. I remember when Dangan Ronpa was a very niche series and you had to go through various hoops to see the game, let alone play it. That was the case for this game for quite a while, as it simply wasn't localized or had a good enough fan translation in forever, so a lot of people couldn't really witness it. I finally did, and boy was it worth it. I believe that the first game is required to understand this game towards the end, but that's not even a gripe I had with it. It was a perfect next installation to the series and one of the few sequels that was much better than the first in every way imaginable. I can only hope Ultra Despair Girls releases onto steam sometime soon, as I've found myself hooked on this franchise and I personally can't wait for the third installment. However, knowing how long it takes for a Dangan Ronpa game to make it to the states, let alone added to Steam, it may be a while. Either way, I had a fantastic time with this game and applaud everyone working on it.

24473438.review:
This game asks the player to have a basic understanding of hydrolysis and relative densities of gases and the resultant properties of that, but does feel the need to remind you what an octagon is.

Seriously though, it's a good game if you like mysteries and watching characters that you get really attached to die (wait, what?). 

Pros:
[list]
[*]Well-made and interesting cases to solve
[*]new and improved trial minigames are better than the first game
[*]Original and more unique characters than the first game's (though those who do make a return appearance are a nice touch)
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*]Some of the cases require outside-the-box thinking or incredible attention to detail that I just don't think is logical.
[*]Some minigames, especially Hangman's Gambit, can become overwhelming
[*]The themes of the game and its setting clash really badly
[*]Someone was worried about a murder occurring, so they confiscated everyone's forks.
[/list]
Personal Taste:
[list]
[*]Some of the characters, notably Peko and Nagito, can have their voice lines drowned out by music.
[*]Gifting system is complicated and a community guide is basically required to go anywhere with it
[*]Some of the depicted deaths are fairly brutal
[*]It really sucks sometimes when your favorite character turns out to be a cold-blooded killer
[/list]

In short, buy the first game first for a taste of this style and if you find you like it come here and prepare yourself for ~25 hours of reasoning, logic, child murder (Again, someone made a game about this?), and some seriously weird twists. Well worth the price, if you can get through an hour or so of Usami.

Updating Review: I finished game.

I still think as a game it is bad. In short, skip the game and read the manga or novels.

Story: 
The story is bad until chapter 3 and then it gets interesting. It is the only good part of this game. The bad part of the story is that they try to shoe horn in everyone’s reaction. It is really annoying in the beginning because maybe 2 or 3 are relevant and the other 15 are just noise.

Game-play: 
The game-play is bad. They try to hide it by adding lots of different types of game-play. However, not one single type is decent. The worst part of this game are the games itself. None of them are fun and I found myself trying to rush through them to get back to the dialog. I would have enjoyed this game more if they took them out completely.

Art style: 
There are several different art styles in the game, they should have picked one for two. It is weird. The first person 3D graphics of this game are worse than the original Quake. They should have stuck to 2D.

Controls: 
Saving the game is a crap shoot. You have to finish the mini game to save the game. Sometimes even when the menu is available, it won't let you save the game. This isn't a survival game, I should be able to save the game at any time. In a technical sense, this type of game is easy to write save game files, there is no excuse.

Exiting the game takes several steps; it is psychotic. I mean that in the sense that I wouldn’t want to be alone in the same room as anyone who thinks the procedure to quit this game is acceptable.
